materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Main Color (MC) Jute (00082) 2 balls or 220 yards/201 m
Contrast A Indigo (01114) 2 balls or 160 yards/146.5 m
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Mosaic Dc = Working in front of chain spaces, work 1 dc in skipped sc 3 rows below
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Notes: 
• When working dc in rows 3 rows below, work in front of ch-2 spaces, not around. 
• Each skipped sc has ch-2 worked above it for 2 rows. This establishes the ‘gap’ where Mosaic Dc will later be worked
• Mosaic Dc always replaces sc directly behind it on working row
• WS of your work maintains alternating 2-row striped pattern because you are working in front of chain spaces each time you work Mosaic Dc - you are never working around chain-spaces. The chain-spaces are positioned behind Mosaic Dc.
PLACEMAT
With MC, ch 59.
Set-up rows:
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 58 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
Zig-Zag Mosaic Pat (see Chart on page 2)
1st row: (RS). With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn. 58 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Join A. Turn.
3rd row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. *(Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc) twice. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 ch. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 ch. Rep from * to last 3 sc. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Join MC. Turn.
5th row: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *Ch 2. Skip next sc. Working in front of A, Mosaic Dc. Skip next 2 ch. 1 sc in next sc. Working in front of A, Mosaic Dc. Skip next 2 ch. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *1 sc in next sc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 ch. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Ch 2. Skip next 2 ch. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join A. Turn.
7th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. *Working in front of MC, Mosaic Dc. Skip next 2 ch. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Working in front of MC, Mosaic Dc. Skip next 2 ch. Ch 2. Skip next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn.
8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *Ch 2. Skip next 2 ch. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Rep from * to last ch 2. Ch 2. Skip next 2 ch. 1 sc in last sc. Join MC. Turn.
9th row: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Working in front of A, Mosaic Dc. Skip next 2 ch. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Working in front of A, Mosaic Dc. Skip next 2 ch. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn.
10th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 5 sc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 ch. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 ch. Rep from * to last 4 sts. 1 sc in each of last 4 sts. Join A. Turn.
11th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. *Ch 2. Skip next sc. Working in front of MC, Mosaic Dc. Skip next 2 ch. Ch 2. Skip next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
12th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 ch. 1 sc in next st. Ch 2. Skip next 2 ch. Rep from * to last 3 sc. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Join MC. Turn.
Rep 5th to 12th rows 4 times more, ending on a 12th row.
Next row: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. *Working in front of A, Mosaic Dc. Skip next 2 ch. 1 sc in next sc. Working in front of A, Mosaic Dc. Skip next 2 ch. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. Break A.
Next 3 rows: With MC, ch 1. 1 sc in each st across. Turn.
Fasten off.

materials: Bernat Super Value (225 g/8 oz) Contrast A (07414 Natural) 1 ball
Size 6.5 mm (U.S. K or 10½) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
2 black buttons ½ ins [1.5 cm] in diameter for eyes.
measurements: Approx 33 ins [84 cm] long x 3 [7.5 cm] ins in diameter.
gauge: 9½ sc and 11 rows = 4 ins [10 cm] with 2 strands of yarn.
instructions:
Note: To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook. Draw new color through 2 loops, then proceed in new color. Work is done with 2 strands of yarn. 
BODY 
With 2 strands of A, ch 5. Join in ring. 
**1st rnd: Ch 1. 6 sc in ring. Join with sl st to first sc. 6 sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in every sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sc. 
4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.** 
5th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
6th rnd: Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Rep last rnd, changing colors as follows: With A - 24 rnds, With B - 2 rnds, with A - 4 rnds, with B - 2 rnds, with A - 3 rnds, with B - 2 rnds, with A, 20 rnds, (with B - 1 rnd, with A - 1 rnd) 4 times, with B - 2 rnds, With A - 2 rnds, with B - 14 rnds. Fasten off. Break yarn. 
“End” of Body: With 2 strands of B, ch 5. Join in ring. Work from ** to ** as given above. Fasten off. Stuff Body. Sew “End” in position. 
LEGS (make 4).
With B, ch 7. Join in rnd. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. 7 sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Rep last rnd once more. 
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 3 dc in next sc. 1 dc in next sc. 3 dc in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. 
Sew legs to body as shown in picture. 
TAIL 
With A, ch 8. Join in rnd. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. 8 sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
Rep last rnd 5 times more. 
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 dc in each of next 2 sc. Miss next sc. 1 dc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 7 sts. 
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 dc in next dc. Miss next dc. 1 dc in next dc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 6 sts. 
Next rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in next st. Miss next st) 3 times. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. 
Attach Tail to Body. 
EARS (make 2). 
With B, ch 12. 
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 11 sc. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 
Rep last 2 rows twice more. Fasten off. 
Sew Ears as shown in picture. Attach buttons for eyes. With B embroider nose and mouth.

materials: Bernat® Happy Holidays™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 240 yds/219 m)
Version 1 Main Color (MC) Glittery Green (31711) 1 ball
Version 2 Main Color (MC) Twinkly White (31709) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Length of ribbon for hanging loop.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Approx 17" [43 cm] long from cuff to heel.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first sc.
Cuff: With A, ch 46. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring, taking care to not twist chain.
1st rnd: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Join. Turn. 46 sc.
2nd rnd: (WS). Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Turn.
Rep 2nd rnd, alternating RS and WS until work from beg measures 5" [12.5 cm], ending on a WS rnd. Turn. Break A. Join MC.
Leg: 1st rnd: (RS). With MC, ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Rep last rnd until work from bottom of Cuff measures 9" [23 cm]. Fasten off.
Heel: With RS facing, join A with sl st to first sc.
1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 22 sc. Turn.
Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row for 2" [5 cm], ending on a WS row.
Shape heel: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 15 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 9 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 10 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Turn.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 11 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 12 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Turn.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 13 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Turn.
7th and 8th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 14 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 15 sts.
Fasten off at end of 8th row.
Joining rnd: (RS). Join MC with sl st at left side of Heel Base. Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 23 sc of instep. PM. Work 7 sc up right side of Heel, 1 sc in each of next 15 sc across end of Heel. Work 7 sc down left side of Heel. Join. 52 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to marker. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Join. Rep 2nd rnd until 44 sts rem.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep last rnd until work from joining rnd measures 5½" [14 cm].
Shape toe: 1st rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Sc2tog) 4 times. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Sc2tog) 4 times. Join.
Cont in same manner, dec 4 sts on every rnd until 12 sts rem. Break yarn, leaving a long end.
Draw end tightly through rem sts and fasten securely.
Hanging loop: Fold ribbon into loop and sew to top edge of Stocking as shown.
Keeping stocking flat, mark edges of chart of choice, so chart will be centred. Embroider monogram with A using Cross St.
Note: To avoid stitching though all thicknesses, place a piece of cardboard inside Stocking when working cross stitch.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each of 334 Buff A, 235 Lemon B, and 376 Burgundy C. Note: Only a small amount of each yarn color is needed.
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 3.75 mm [US F-5].
Polyester fiberfill, 18" [45.5 cm] thin gold ribbon (for hanger), yarn needle
abbreviations: A, B, and C = Color A, B, and C
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Ornament measures about 4½" [11.5 cm] tall.
gauge: 20 sts = 4" [10 cm]; 20 rows/rounds = 4" [10 cm] in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
CRUST
With A, ch 2.
Row 1: Work 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook—3 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in first sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last sc—4 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in first sc, 2 sc in each of next 2 sc, sc in last sc—6 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Row 5: Ch 1, turn, sc in each of first 2 sc, 2 sc in each of next 2 sc, sc in each of last 2 sc—8 sc.
Row 6: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Row 7: Ch 1, turn, sc in each of first 3 sc, 2 sc in each of next 2 sc, sc in each of last 3 sc—10 sc.
Row 8: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Row 9: Ch 1, turn, sc in each of first 4 sc, 2 sc in each of next 2 sc, sc in each of last 4 sc—12 sc.
Row 10: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Row 11: Ch 1, turn, sc in each of first 5 sc, 2 sc in each of next 2 sc, sc in each of last 5 sc—14 sc.
Row 12: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Row 13: Ch 1, turn, sc in each of first 6 sc, 2 sc in each of next 2 sc, sc in each of last 6 sc—16 sc.
Row 14: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Row 15: Ch 1, turn, sc in each of first 7 sc, 2 sc in each of next 2 sc, sc in each of last 7 sc—18 sc.
Row 16: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Row 17: Ch 1, turn, working in back loops only, sc in each sc across. Note: The free front loops should show at the bottom of the Crust when all pieces are sewn together.
Edging: Ch 1, turn, 3 sc in first sc, slip st in next sc, *3 sc in next sc, slip st in next sc; repeat from * across; working in ends of rows, work sc evenly spaced along side edge of Crust, 3 sc in point, sc evenly spaced along other side edge of Crust, slip st.
Fasten off.

CHEESE
With B, ch 2.
Rows 1–16: Work same as Rows 1–16 of Crust—18 sc.
Fasten off.

Sauce: Working in back loops only, join C with slip st in the first back loop of Row 16, slip st in each back loop across. Note: The free front loops of Row 16 should show at the top of the Cheese when all pieces are sewn together. Fasten off.

PEPPERONI (make 5)
With C, ch 3.
Row 1: Work 7 hdc in 3rd ch from hook; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3. Fasten off, leaving a long tail.

FINISHING
With A, sew Cheese to Crust, stuffing very lightly before completing seam. With C, sew each piece of Pepperoni to Cheese, inserting needle through middle of Pepperoni.
Fold gold ribbon in half. Insert crochet hook around a few stitches at the top of the ornament, place ribbon fold on hook and draw through to form a loop. Thread ends of ribbon through loop and pull to tighten. Tie ends together with a bow or overhand knot to form hanging loop.
Weave in any remaining ends.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 334 Buff A, 400 Grey Heather B, 316 Soft White C, 312 Black D, and 321 Gold E
abbreviations: dec (decrease) = draw up a loop in next 2 sts, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops.
dec2 = draw up a loop in next 3 sc, yarn over and draw through all 4 loops.
measurements: Pilgrims measure 9” [23 cm] high.
gauge: Gauge is not important for this project, but stitches for stuffed body parts should be close enough that stuffing does not show through.
instructions:
Head and Body (For Both Man and Woman)
Beginning at top of head with A, ch 2.
Round 1: 6 Sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with a slip st in first sc—6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, [inc] 6 times; join—12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, [sc in sc, inc] 6 times; join—18 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, [sc in 2 sc, inc] 6 times; join—24 sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, [sc in 3 sc, inc] 6 times; join—30 sc.
Rounds 6-11: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join. Stuff as you go along.
Round 12: Ch 1, [sc in 3 sc, dec] 6 times; join—24 sc.
Round 13: Ch 1, [sc in 2 sc, dec] 6 times; join—18 sc.
Round 14: Ch 1, [sc in sc, dec] 6 times; join—12 sc.
Round 15: Ch 1, [dec] 6 times changing to B in last st; join—6 sc.
Round 16: With B, repeat Round 2—12 sc.
Round 17: Repeat Round 3—18 sc.
Round 18: Repeat Round 4—24 sc. Continue stuffing.
Rounds 19-22: Repeat Round 6. For Man only change to D in last sc of Round 22.
Rounds 23 and 24: Repeat Round 6. For Man only change to B in last sc of Round 24.
Lower body (Man and Woman)
Round 25: With B for Man, and C for Woman, working in remaining back loops only of Round 24, ch 1, [sc in 2 sc, dec] 6 times; join—18 sc. Continue stuffing.
Round 26: Ch 1, [sc in sc, dec] 6 times; join—12 sc.
Round 27: Ch 1, [dec] 6 times; join—6 sc. Fasten off.
Arms (Both Man and Woman)
With B, ch 8; join with a slip st to form a ring.
Rounds 1-5: Ch 1, sc in each ch around changing to C in last sc of Round 5; join—8 sc.
Rounds 6 and 7: With C, ch 1, sc in each sc around changing to A in last sc of Round 7; join.
Row 8: Pinch arm to work through 2 thicknesses. With A, ch 1, sc in 4 sc to close; turn—4 sc.
Fingers: * Ch 3, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and next ch **, slip st in next sc; repeat from * across, end at **—4 fingers. Fasten off. Stuff and whipstitch top of arm closed, leaving long tail for sewing.
Feet (Both Man and Woman)
Round 1: With D, ch 4; 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch, 3 sc in last ch; join—7 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, [inc] 3 times, sc in next sc, [inc] 3 times; join—14 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in 9 sc, dec3, sc in last 2 sc; join—12 sc.
Nose (Both Man and Woman)
With A, ch 2.
Round 1: 6 Sc in 2nd ch from hook; join—6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join. Fasten off leaving tail for sewing.
Collar (Both Man and Woman)
With C, ch 13.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn—12 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, [sc in sc, inc] 6 times—18 sc. Fasten off leaving long tail for sewing.
Man’s Hat
With B, ch 2.
Rounds 1-5: Work same as Head Rounds 1-5—30 sc.
Round 6: Ch 1, sc in back loops of each sc around; join.
Rounds 7-11: Ch 1, sc in both loops of each sc around changing to D in last sc of Round 11; join.
Round 12: With D, ch 1, sc in each sc around; join.
Round 13: Ch 1, [sc in 4 sc, inc] 6 times changing to B in last sc; join—36 sc.
Round 14: With B, ch 1, sc in front loops of each sc around; join.
Round 15: Ch 1, working in both loops [sc in 5 sc, inc] 6 times; join—42 sc.
Round 16: Ch 1, [sc in 6 sc, inc] 6 times; join—48 sc.
Round 17: Ch 1, [sc in 7 sc, inc] 6 times; join—54 sc.
Round 18: Ch 1, [sc in 8 sc, inc] 6 times; join—60 sc. Fasten off.
Man’s Hair
With D, working in remaining back loops of Round 14, join in any loop; ch 1, (sc, ch 6) in each loop around; join—36 loops. Fasten off leaving long tail for sewing to head.
Woman’s Hat
With C, ch 2.
Rounds 1-5: Work same as Head Rounds 1-5—30 sc.
Round 6: Ch 1, sc in back loops of each sc around; join.
Rounds 7 and 8: Working in both loops, ch 1, sc in each sc around; join.
Row 1: Ch 1, [sc in 2 sc, inc] 10 times; turn—40 sc.
Rows 2-6: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 7: Ch 1, [sc in 2 sc, dec] 10 times—30 sc. Fasten off.
Tie for Woman’s Hat
With C, ch 7, sc in remaining front loops of Row 6 of Woman’s Hat, ch 7. Fasten off.
Woman’s Hair
With E, attach 6 short fringes to 6 back loops of Row 7 of woman’s hat.
Woman’s Apron
With C, ch 13.
Row 1: Sc in each ch across; turn—12 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, inc, sc in next 10 sc, inc; turn—14 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, inc, sc in next 12 sc, inc; turn—16 sc.
Rows 5-8: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn. Fasten off at end of Row 8.
Tie for Woman’s Apron
With C, ch 22, 12 sc across foundation row of Apron, ch 22. Fasten off.
FINISHING (Both Man and Woman)
Using photo for placement, sew arms between Rounds 18 and 19 of body. Sew legs to bottom of body. Sew nose between Rounds 8 and 9 of head. Sew collar around neck. Sew hats in place. With D, embroider eyes and mouth. For man only, with E, embroider buckles on hat, belt, and shoes. For woman only, tie apron around waist. Trim woman’s bangs to match picture.

materials: RED HEART® Spark-a-Doodle™: 1 ball 9001 White Cloud A
RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 656 Real Teal B and 672 Spring Green C
abbreviations: A, B, C = color A, B, C
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Snowman measures 9” tall; scarf measures 1” x 21”; hat measures 13” around the brim and is 5½” long.
gauge: 12 sts = 4”; 16 rows = 4” in sc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SnOWmAn
Using the razor knife, cut a small slice off of the larger Styrofoam ball, so that the ball sits flat. Insert the toothpick halfway into the smaller ball and insert the opposite half of the toothpick into the top center of the larger ball. Add a drop of craft glue between the two balls and push them together. Allow glue to dry.
Coat both balls with craft glue, one at a time. Carefully wrap the balls with A, taking care to completely cover both balls. It is necessary to loop the strand portion of the yarn to cluster the pompoms closely together. Allow glue to dry. Using craft glue, glue the black buttons to the smaller ball to make the snowman’s eyes and the orange button for the nose.
SnOWmAn’S HAT
Round 1: With B, ch 4; join with slip st to first ch to form a ring; ch 1, 12 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, [sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times; join – 18 sc. Drop B and carry up wrong side of work.
Round 3: With C, ch 1, sc in each sc around; join.
Round 4: Ch 1, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc] 9 times; join – 27 sc. Drop C; pick up B.
Round 5: With B, ch 1, sc in first sc, [2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc] 13 times; join – 40 sc.
Round 6: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join. Drop B; pick up C.
Rounds 7 and 8: With C, ch 1, sc in each sc around; join. Drop C; pick up B.
Rounds 9 and 10: With B, ch 1, sc in each sc around; join. Drop B; pick up C.
Rounds 11-16: Repeat Rounds 7-10, then Rounds 7 and 8 once more.
Round 17: With B, ch 3, skip first sc, dc in next sc and in each sc around; join in top of ch-3.
Rounds 18 and 19: Ch 3, dc in next dc, bpdc around next 2 sts, [dc in next 2 dc, bpdc around next 2 sts] 9 times; join in top of ch-3. Fasten off at end of Round 19. Weave in ends.
SnOWmAn’S SCARf
Leave 2” yarn tails when joining and fastening off.
With B, ch 85. Fasten off.
Row 1 (Right Side): With C, slip st in each st across. Fasten off.
Row 2: With right side facing, join B; slip st in each st across. Fasten off.
Rows 3-6: Repeat Rows 1 and 2 twice.
Trim yarn tails on both ends to 1½” for fringe.
finiSHinG
Place hat and scarf on prepared snowman.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Sizes U.S. 7 (4.5 mm) and U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume™ crochet hooks or sizes needed to obtain gauge.
Susan Bates® split-lock stitch count marker.
Small amount of black worsted weight yarn.
abbreviations: Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 (3) stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Approx 5" x 7" [12.5 x 18 cm], excluding ears.
gauge: 12 sc and 12 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook, holding 2 strands of yarn tog.
instructions:
Note: Rnds are joined with sl st to first sc.
With larger hook and 2 strands of A held tog, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sc as last sl st. 1 sc in next sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sc as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sc as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sc as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sc.
7th to 10th rnds: Cont in this manner, inc 6 sc evenly around each rnd. 60 sc at end of 10th rnd.
11th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Place marker at end of last rnd.
Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
Rep last rnd until work from marked rnd measures 8" [20.5 cm]. Fasten off.
Inner Ears (make 2)
With smaller hook and single strand of B, ch 10.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 9 sc.
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 10 sc.
6th to 8th rows: As 2nd to 4th rows.
9th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sts. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 12 sc.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 3" [7.5 cm].
Shape top: 1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each st to last 3 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 10 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st across. Turn.
3rd to 5th rows: As 1st row. 4 sc.
6th row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. 2 sc.
7th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Do not fasten off.
Work 1 rnd of sc evenly around Inner Ears. Join. Fasten off.
Outer Ears (make 2)
With smaller hook and single strand of A, ch 14.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 13 sc.
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 6 sc. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 14 sc.
6th to 8th rows: As 2nd to 4th rows.
9th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sts. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 16 sc.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 3½" [9 cm].
Shape top: 1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each st to last 3 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in last sc. Turn. 14 sc.
Rep 1st row 5 times more. 4 sc.
Next row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. 2 sc.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Do not fasten off.
Work 1 rnd of sc evenly around Outer Ears. Join. Fasten off.
Stitch Inner Ears to Outer Ears as shown in photo.
Nose
With B and smaller hook, ch 6.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 5 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 3 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. Sc3tog. Fasten off.
Fold brim of Basket over as shown in photo, allowing for 2½" [6.5 cm] overlap. Sew Nose in position to Basket as shown in photo.
Work whiskers in black in Chain St as shown in photo. Sew Ears to Basket.
CHAIN ST
Pompom
Wind C around 4 fingers approx 60 times. Remove from fingers and tie tightly in center. Cut through each side of loops. Trim to smooth round shape. Attach pompom to back of Basket at base.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m) Hot Green (01712) 1 ball makes Large and Small Trees
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
measurements: Large: Approx 9" [23 cm] high x 16" [40.5 cm] circumference. Small: Approx 3½" [9 cm] high x 7 ½" [19 cm] circumference.
gauge: 14 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Large Version
Note: Work all sts in back loops.
**Ch 2. 
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join 
with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops, 2 sc 
in each sc around. Join with sl st to first 
sc. 12 sc.
3rd and 4th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc 
around. Join with sl st to first sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next 
sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to 
first sc. 18 sc.
6th and 7th rnds: As 3rd and 4th rnds.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc.  
2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join 
with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
9th and 10th rnds: As 3rd and 4th rnds.
11th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc.  
2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join 
with sl st to first sc. 30 sc.
12th and 13th rnds: As 3rd and 4th rnds.
14th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc.  
2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join 
with sl st to first sc. 36 sc.
15th and 16th rnds: As 3rd and 4th 
rnds.**
Cont as established, inc 6 sts on next and 
every following 3rd rnd, until there are  
66 sc.
Next 2 rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. 
Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off at end 
of last rnd.
Small Version
Work from ** to ** as given for Large 
Version. Fasten off.
Finishing
Cut 1 piece of felt and 1 piece of 
cardboard to fit circumference of bottom 
of Tree. Stuff Tree. Pin felt to bottom of 
Tree, placing cardboard between felt and 
stuffing. Sew felt in position. Sew buttons 
on Tree as shown in picture.

materials: Bernat® Pop!™ (5 oz/140 g; 280 yds/256 m) Foggy Notion (84012) 1 ball
Size U.S. K/10½ (6.5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hdc2tog = Yoh and draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 7" [18 cm] wide x 17" [43 cm] long.
gauge: 10 hdc and 5 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Stocking is worked toe up and heel is worked once body of stocking is complete.
Ch 3.
Round 1: Work 8 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join with sl st to 2nd chain. (8 sts)
Round 2: Ch 2. Make 2 hdc in every stitch. Join with sl st to 2nd chain. (16 sts)
Round 3: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next st. 1 hdc in next st. Repeat from * around. Join with sl st to 2nd chain. (24 sts)
Round 4: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st. (24 sts)
Round 5: Ch 2. *2 hdc in next st. 1 hdc in each of next 2 sts. Repeat from * around. Join with sl st to 2nd chain. (32 sts)
Rounds 6-7: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st. (32 sts)
Round 8: Ch 3. 1 dc in same st as ch. *Sk next st. 2 dc in next. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to space between ch 3 and first dc.
Rounds 9-14: Ch 3. 1 dc in same st as ch. *2 dc between next 2 dc group. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to space between ch 3 and first dc.
Round 15: Ch 1. 1 sc in same space as sl st. *2 dc between next 2 dc group. Rep from * 7 times more. 1 sc between next 2 dcgroup. Ch 18. Join with sl st to first sc.
Round 16: Ch 3. 1 dc in same st as ch. *2 dc between next 2 dc group. Rep from * 7 times. 2 dc in sc. Sk first ch. **2 dc in next ch. Sk 1 ch. Rep from ** to end of ch. Join with sl st to space between ch 3 and first dc.
Rounds 17-34: Ch 3. 1 dc in same st as ch. *2 dc between next 2 dc group. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in space between ch 3 and first dc.
Rounds 35-44: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each st. Join with sl st to 2nd ch.
Heel: Round 1: Join yarn with sl st in middle v-stitch of chain with toe facing upward. Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 11 ch. 1 hdc in next 15 sts. 1 hdc in each of rem 7 ch. Join with sl st to 2nd ch.
Round 2: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 8 sts. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in next st and place marker. Hdc2tog. Hdc in next 10 sts. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in next st and place marker. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of last 5 sts. Join with sl st to 2nd ch.
Round 3: Ch 2. *1 hdc in each st until 2 sts before marker. Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in marked st. Hdc2tog. Rep from * once more. 1 hdc in each st to end of round. Join with sl st to 2nd ch.
Rounds 4-5: Rep round 3. Fasten off.
Assembly: Turn stocking inside out and seam heel using a whip stitch. Weave in ends. Fold top down 3" [7.5 cm]. Make 15 ch, fasten off and secure just inside top of stocking to hang. Attach pompoms to each end of chain, securing with a knot just below the fold.
Pompoms: (Make 1 each)
Wind yarn around 3 (4) fingers approx 60 times. Remove from fingers and tie tightly in center. Cut through each side of loops. Trim to smooth round shape.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 skein each 365 Coffee A, 319 Cherry Red B, 672 Spring Green C and 316 Soft White D.
Yarn needle, stitch marker, fiberfill, black embroidery floss.
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Cupcake ornament is 4½” tall.
gauge: 16 sc = 4”; 14 rows = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
CUPCAKE
Sides
With A, ch 8.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across – 7 sc.
Rows 2-20: Ch 1, turn, working in back loops only, sc in each sc across.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail.
Using tail, sew last row to first row to make a ring.
Bottom
With A, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Place marker for beginning of round.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around – 12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] around – 18 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail.
Using tail and fitting Sides around edges of Bottom piece, sew pieces together.
Top
With C, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Place marker for beginning of round.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around – 12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] around – 15 sc.
Round 4: [Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] around – 18 sc.
Round 5: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] around – 24 sc.
Round 6: Sc in each sc around.
Fasten off.
Round 7: Join D to front loop of first sc of Round 6 with sc, working in front loops only, sc in each sc around – 24 sc.
Round 8: [Slip st in next sc, 3 sc in next sc] around, slip st in first st to join.
Fasten off.
Round 9: Join D in back loop of Round 6 with slip st, 4 dc in next sc, [slip st in next sc, 4 dc in next sc] around, slip st in first st to join.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail.
FINISHING
With wrong sides together, sew pieces together, stuffing with fiberfill before sewing closed.
Red Rose
With B, ch 7.
Row 1: Work 3 hdc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across.
Fasten off.
Roll length into a rose shape and sew in place in center of Top.
Weave in ends.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver Ombre™ (10 oz/284 g; 482 yds/440 m)
Red Heart® Super Saver ™ (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333m)
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Small quantities of worsted weight acrylic yarn in brown and tan (approx 5 yds/4.5 m per pumpkin).
abbreviations: Dcbp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at back of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.
Dcfp = Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice.

Dcfp2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 2 times. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Hdc2tog = Yoh and draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Trfp = (Yoh) twice and draw up a loop around post of next stitch at front of work, inserting hook from right to left. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times.
measurements: Large: Approx 11" [28 cm] in diameter by 6" [15 cm] tall. Small: Approx 7" [18 cm] in diameter by 4½" [11.5 cm] tall.
gauge: 15 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
Notes: 
• All rnds are joined with a sl st to first st.
• Pumpkins are worked from the top down. 
Large Pumpkin (see diagram on page 5.)
**Ch 2.
1st rnd: (WS.) 10 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. Turn. 10 sc.
2nd rnd: (RS) Ch 1. *(1 sc. 1 dc) in next st. (1 dc. 1 sc) in next st. Rep from * around. Join. Turn. 20 sts.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *(1 sc. 1 dc) in next st. 2 dc in next st. 1 dc in next st. (1 dc. 1 sc) in next st. Rep from * around. Join. Turn. 35 sts.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next st. 2 hdc in next st. Skip next st. 3 dcfp around next st. Skip next st. 2 hdc in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Join. Turn. 45 sts.
5th and alt rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join. Turn.**
6th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sts. 2 hdc in next st. Skip next st. 1 trfp around each of next 2 sts 2 rows below. 1 trfp around skipped st. 2 hdc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Rep from * around. Join. Turn. 55 sts.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next st. Skip next st. 3 dcfp in next st 2 rows below. Skip next st. (1 dcfp around st 2 rows below) 3 times. Skip next st. 3 dcfp in next st 2 rows below. Skip next st. 2 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Join. Turn. 65 sts.
10th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next st. 2 hdc in next st. (1 dc in sp before group of 3 dcfp 2 rows below. Skip next st, 1 trfp around next 2 sts 2 rows below, Working in front of two trfp just worked, 1 trfp in front around skipped st) 3 times. 1 dc in the sp after group of 3 dcfp sts 2 rows below, 2 hdc in next st, 1 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Join. Turn. 95 sts.
Mikey’s Hints:
• The dcbp in the next round are worked around sts 2 rows below that were placed in the sps before and after the groups of 3 sts that make up the braids.
• To achieve the effect shown in the Anthracite version, change the dcbp in 12th and 14th rnds to a dcfp. This will frame the braids differently.
12th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sts. (1 dcbp around next st 2 rows below. 3 dcfp around each of next 3 sts 2 rows below) 3 times. 1 dcbp around next st 2 rows below. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. Join. Turn.
14th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next 3 sts, (1 dcbp around next dcbp 2 rows below. Skip next st. 1 trfp around each of next 2 sts rows below. Working in front of two trfp just worked, 1 trfp in front around skipped st ) 3 times. 1 dcbp around next dcbp 2 rows below. 1 sc in next 3 sts. Rep from * around. Join. Turn. 95 sts.
15th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
16th to 31st rnds: Rep 12th to 15th rnds four times more.
32nd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next st. Hdc2tog. (Skip next st. 1 dcfp around each of next 3 sts 2 rows below) 3 times. Skip next st. Hdc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Join. Turn. 65 sts.
34th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. (Skip next st. 1 trfp around each of next 2 sts 2 rows below. Working in front of two trfp just worked, 1 trfp around skipped st) 3 times. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. Turn. 55 sts.
36th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next st, 1 dcfp around next st 2 rows below. Working into next 2 sts 2 rows below, dcfp2tog. 1 dcfp around each of next 3 sts 2 rows below. Working into next 2 sts 2 rows below, dcfp2tog. 1 dcfp around next post 2 rows below. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Join. Turn. 45 sts.
38th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next st. dcfp2tog using next 2 posts 2 rows below, 1 dcfp around each of next 3 posts 2 rows below. Working into next 2 sts 2 rows below, dcfp2tog. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Join. Turn. 35 sts.
39th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. Turn. 25 sts.
Stuff pumpkin, being careful not to overtuff (stuffing should not be visible through sts.) 
40th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. Do not turn. 15 sts.
41st rnd: As 5th rnd. 15 sts.
42nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in next st. (Sc2tog) 7 times. Join. Fasten off, leaving an approx 24” [61 cm] tail. Place yarn on a tapestry needle and feed the yarn through all stitches in the last round and pull to close.
Proceed to Pumpkin Shaping and Finishing. 
Small Pumpkin (see diagram on page 6.)
Work from ** to ** as given for large Pumpkin. 
6th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next st. 2 dcfp around first hdc 2 rows below. Skip next st. 1 sc in next st. Skip next st. 1 trfp around each of next 2 dcfp 2 rows below. Working in front of 2 dcfp just worked, 1 trfp around skipped dcfp below. Skip 3 sts behind trfp. 1 sc in next st. 2 dcfp around next hdc 2 rows below. Skip next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Join. Turn. 55 sts.
7th rnd: Ch 1.  *1 sc in each of next 10 sts. 2 sc in next st. Rep from * around. Join. Turn. 60 sts.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next st. 1 dcfp around each of next 3 sts. Rep from * around. Join. Turn.
9th and alt rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.  Turn.
10th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next st. Skip next st. 1 trfp around each of next 2 sts 2 rows below. Working in front of 2 trfp just worked , 1 trfp around skipped st. Rep from * around. Join. Turn. 60 sts.
12th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next st. 3 dcfp around next 3 posts. Rep from * around. Join. Turn. 60 sts.
13th to 20th rnds: Repeat 9th to 12th rnds twice more. 
21st rnd: As 9th rnd. 
Mikey’s Hint: 
• All single crochet stitches in the next round are skipped, as only trfp sts are  are worked.
22nd rnd: RS. Ch 1. *Skip next 2 sts 2 rows below. 1 trfp around each of next 2 sts 2 rows below. Working in front of 2 trfp just worked , 1 trfp around last skipped st. Rep from * around. Join. Turn. 45 sts.
24th rnd: Working all sts in current rnd around sts worked in 22nd rnd , *1 dcfp around next st. Dcfp2tog. 1 dcfp around each of next 3 sts. Dcfp2tog. 1 dcfp around next st. Rep from * around. Join. Turn. 35 sts.
26th rnd: Ch 1. Working all sts in current rnd around sts worked in 24th rnd,  *Dcfp2tog. 1 dcfp around  each of next 3 sts. Dcfp2tog. Rep from * around. Join. Turn. 25 sts.
28th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next st. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. Do not turn. 15 sts.
Stuff Pumpkin, being careful not to overtuff Pumpkin (stuffing should not be visible through sts.) 
29th rnd: As 9th rnd. 
30th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in next st. (Sc2tog) 7 times. Join. Fasten off, leaving an approx 24” [61 cm] tail. Place yarn on a tapestry needle and feed the yarn through all stitches in the last round and pull to close.
Both Versions:
Pumpkin Shaping and Finishing 
With yarn on tapestry needle, feed needle through center of both top and bottom of Pumpkin.
Catch edge of hole at bottom of Pumpkin, and feed needle back through center of top. Pull lightly on yarn so indentation forms at top of Pumpkin as shown in photo. Secure tightly and weave in end.
Large Pumpkin Stem
With brown yarn, ch 31. 
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook, 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 30 sts.
2nd row: Ch 2 ( does not count as st). Working into back loops only across entire row , 1 hdc in each of next 10 sts. 1 sc in each of last 20 sts. Turn. 30 sts.
3rd row: Ch 1. Working into back loops only , 1 sc in each of next 20 sts. 1 hdc in each of  last 10 sts. Turn. 30 sts. 
Rep 2nd and 3rd rows twice more. 
Fasten off leaving a 24” [61 cm] tail.
Small Pumpkin Stem
With brown yarn, ch 11.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 10 sts.
2nd to 7th rows: Ch 1. Working in back loops only , 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn. 10 sts.
Fasten off leaving a 24” [61 cm] tail.
Stem Finishing 
Fold Stem with long edges touching.
Working in  back loops only, whipstitch along edges to form a cylinder.
Once across, gather the side of the rows to pull closed. This is the top of the stem. Fasten off and weave in ends.
For the large Pumpkin Stem, stuff bottom 2/3 of stem (the section worked in hdc.) 
For the small Pumpkin Stem, stuff entire length of Stem lightly.
Place Stem on of Pumpkin, and sew in place.
Mikey’s Hint: 
• For the small Pumpkin, Mikey sewed the stem in place slightly offset from centre, to give the Stem a more natural-looking lean.
For the large pumpkin, once sewn around, do not fasten off. Curl the thinner part of the stem into a circle as shown in photo. Using a yarn needle, Run the strand up through the stem and come out where you believe the permanent “curl” should be. Whipstitch into place securely. Tie off and weave in ends. 
Curly Vines
Mikey’s Hints: 
• When fastening off, leave longer tails to sew to base of the pumpkin stem. 
• Large pumpkin uses all three vine sizes, while small pumpkin uses only two shorter lengths.
With tan yarn, ch 27 (21-15). 
1st row: 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 3 sc in each ch to end of chain. Fasten off.
Sew each vine to the base of the stem where you think it looks the best!

materials: Bernat® Happy Holidays (100 g/3.5 oz; 219 m/240 yds)
Size 3.5 mm (U.S. E or 4) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Small amount of black yarn for eyes.
measurements: Approx 2 x 4 ins [5 x 10 cm].
gauge: 15 sc and 16 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
Head: With MC, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 16 sc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc. 
4th and 6th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 32 sc. 
7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 40 sc. 
8th to 16th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Shape top: 1st rnd: Ch 1. *Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – sc2tog made. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 32 sc. 
2nd and 4th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc. Stuff Head. 
5th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 16 sc. 
6th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. Fasten off. 8 sc.
Hat: With MC, ch 40. Join with sl st to first ch, taking care not to twist ch.
1st rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each ch around. Join A. Break MC. Working in back loops only for remainder of Hat, proceed as follows:
2nd and 3rd rnds: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join. 
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 35 sc. 
5th and 6th rnds: As 2nd rnd.  
7th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc. 
8th and 9th rnds: As 2nd rnd. 
10th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 25 sc.
11th and 12th rnds: As 2nd rnd.
Cont dec 5 sts on next rnd and every following 3rd rnd until 5 sts rem. 
Fasten off. Draw yarn through rem sts tightly and fasten securely. 
Pom-pom: Wrap MC around 2 fingers 20 times. Remove from fingers and tie tightly in center. Cut through each side of loops. Trim to a smooth round shape. Attach pom-pom to end of Hat as shown in picture.
Beard: With MC, ch 20.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 19 sc. 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc across. Turn. 
3rd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 
Rep last row until 3 sts rem.
Next row: Ch 1. Draw up a loop in each of next 3 sts. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – sc3tog made. 
Fasten off.
Sew Beard and Hat to Head as shown in picture. With black yarn, embroider eyes. With A, embroider mouth and nose. Make ribbon loop and attach to top as shown in picture.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®, Art. E300
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 3.75 mm [US F-5]
abbreviations: A, B, C, etc. = Color A, B, C, etc.
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Ornament measures about 4½" [11 cm] across.
gauge: 20 sts = 4" [10 cm]; 20 rows/rounds = 4" [10 cm] in single crochet.
instructions:
SHELL
With A, ch 2.
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Do not join, work in continuous rounds (spirals). Place a marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—18 sc.
Round 4: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 5: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—30 sc.
Round 6: [Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—36 sc.
Round 7: [Sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—42 sc.
Round 8: [Sc in next 6 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—48 sc.
Round 9: [Sc in next 7 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—54 sc.
Round 10: Sc in each sc around. Fasten off, leaving a long tail.
LETTUCE
With B, ch 33.
Row 1: Slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in next 11 ch, sc in next 8 ch; leave remaining chains unworked.
Rows 2–8: Ch 13, turn, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in next 11 ch, sc in next 8 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Sew first row and last row together, keeping shredded lettuce ends free on each side, to form a tube. Stuff the tube lightly, then gather and sew both ends of tube closed, leaving the lettuce ends loose.
TOMATO PIECES (make 7)
With C, ch 3.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in last ch—2 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across. Fasten off, leaving a long tail.
CHEESE
With D, ch 10.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each remaining ch across—9 sc.
Rows 2–8: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail.
FINISHING
With A, sew Lettuce to center of wrong side of Shell, allowing lettuce ends to hang out over the edges.
With C, sew four Tomato Pieces to sc section of Lettuce, scattering and leaving middle open for Cheese.
With D, sew Cheese (diamond like) to top of Lettuce.
With C, sew three remaining Tomato Pieces to top of Cheese.
Fold up Shell. With A, sew several stitches through all layers to hold Taco shape.
Face
With yarn needle and E, using photograph as a guide, embroider a back stitch smile and French knot eyes on front of Taco.
Fold gold ribbon in half. Insert crochet hook around a few stitches at top of ornament, place ribbon fold on hook and draw through to form a loop. Thread ends of ribbon through loop and pull to tighten. Tie ends together with bow or overhand knot to form hanging loop.
Weave in any remaining ends.

materials: RED HEART® Soft®: 1 ball each Teal 9518, Tangerine 4422 and Lavender 3720
Craft glue or hot glue gun
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Flower measures 2” (5.1 cm) diameter
gauge: GAUGE: Flower measures 2” (5.1 cm) diameter
instructions:
Add wrapped yarn letters to a shelf or wall in whatever name or words you desire! We’ve given you some hints here for covering the letters that can be purchased at many craft stores. For a feminine touch add the optional crocheted flowers.
1. Cover all surfaces of the letter by gluing an area and then wrapping yarn to cover it.
2. Glue your flowers in place as desired or to cover messiest areas.

FLOWERS 
(Make 2 flowers for each letter)
Ch 4, join with slip stitch to make a ring.
1st petal: *Sc into ring, ch 7.
Repeat from * 6 times – 7 petals.
Slip st into first sc.
Fasten off and weave in ends.

WRAP THE LETTERS
1. Cut short pieces of yarn and glue to ends of letters.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 316 Soft White A, 624 Tea Leaf B, and 319 Cherry Red C and 312 Black for fish face D.
abbreviations: Dec (decrease) = [draw up a loop in next st] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
measurements: Stocking measures 13½” long.
gauge: 10 sts = 3”; 12 rows = 3” in sc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook/needles to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Side (Make 2)
With A, ch 34.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and next 31 ch, 3 sc in last ch, working on opposite side of ch work 32 sc; turn – 67 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in 32 sc, [inc] 3 times, sc in remaining 32 sc; turn – 70 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in 33 sc, inc, sc in next 2 sc, inc, sc in 33 sc; turn – 72 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in 34 sc, [inc] 4 times, sc in 34 sc; turn – 76 sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in 37 sc, [inc] twice, sc in 37 sc; turn – 78 sc.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc in 37 sc, [inc] 4 times, sc in 37 sc; turn – 82 sc.
Row 7: Ch 1, sc in 37 sc, inc, sc in next 6 sc, inc, sc in 37 sc; turn – 84 sc.
Row 8: Ch 1, sc in 38 sc, inc, sc in next 2 sc, [inc] twice, sc in next 2 sc, inc, sc in 38 sc; turn – 88 sc.
Row 9: Ch 1, sc in 27 sc, hdc in next 10 sc, 2 hdc in next sc, hdc in next 2 sc, 2 hdc in next sc, hdc in next 6 sc, 2 hdc in next sc, hdc in next 2 sc, 2 hdc in next sc, hdc in next 10 sc, sc in next 27 sc; turn – 92 sts.
Row 10: Ch 1, sc in 30 sts, [skip 3 sts, 7 tr in next st, skip 3 sts, sc in next st] twice, sc in next st, [skip 3 sts, 7 tr in next st, skip 3 sts, sc in next st] twice, sc in 29 sts; turn.
Row 11: Ch 1, sc in 32 sts, [inc] 3 times, sc in next 5 sts, [inc] 3 times, sc in next 6 sts, [inc] 3 times, sc in next 5 sts, [inc] 3 times, sc in 32 sc. Fasten off.
Center Paw
With B ch 6.
Round 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 3 ch, 3 sc in last ch, working on opposite side of ch, sc in next 3 ch, 2 sc in last ch; do not join but work in continuous rounds – 12 sc.
Round 2: Inc in first sc, sc in next 3 sc, [inc] 3 times, sc in next 3 sc, [inc] twice – 18 sc.
Round 3: (Sc, hdc) in first sc, (hdc, dc) in next sc, 2 dc in next sc, slip st in next sc, 2 dc in next sc, (dc, hdc) in next sc, (hdc, sc) in next sc, sc in remaining 11 sc. Fasten off. Sew in place on front side of stocking.
Toe Prints (Make 4) 
Round 1: With B ch 2; 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Round 2: Inc in each sc around; join with a slip st in first sc. Fasten off. Sew in place.
Fish
Row 1: With C ch 2; 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook; turn.
Row 2: Ch 1, inc in each sc across; turn – 6 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in next sc, inc, sc to last 2 sc; inc, sc in last sc; turn – 8 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 5: Repeat Row 3 – 10 sc.
Rows 6 and 7: Repeat Rows 4 and 5 – 12 sc.
Row 8: Repeat Row 4.
Row 9: Ch 1, sc in next 6 sc; fin: ch 6, sc in 2nd ch from hook, hdc in next ch, dc in next ch, tr in next ch, hdc in last ch, sc in last 6 sc; turn.
Row 10: Ch 1, sc in first 6 sc, skip fin, sc in last 6 sc; turn.
Row 11: Repeat Row 4.
Row 12: Ch 1, sc in first sc, dec, sc to last 3 sc; dec, sc in last sc; turn – 10 sc.
Row 13: Repeat Row 4.
Rows 14 and 15: Repeat Row 12 – 6 sc.
Row 16: Ch 1, sc in first sc, [dec] twice, sc in last sc; turn – 4 sc.
Row 17: Repeat Row 4.
Row 18: Ch 4, (2 tr, dc, hdc, sc) in first sc, slip st in next 2 sc, (sc, hdc, dc, 3 tr) in last sc; turn.
Row 19: Ch 1, sc in first 6 sts, slip st in 2 slip sts, sc in next 5 sts and in top of ch-4. Fasten off.
With D, embroider eyes and mouth. Sew Fish in place.
Finishing
Sew front and back sides together through both loops of last row.
Border and Hanging Loop
Join A in top center back st of stocking with sc; work sc evenly around; ch 10 for hanger; sc in each sc around to last 2 sc; skip last 2 sc, work 16 dc in ch-10 loop, skip first 2 sc of last round; join with a slip st in next sc. Fasten off.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® “Classic Crochet Thread” size 10: 2 (2, 4, 4) balls 494 Victory Red A
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions given in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Flags measure 9 x 14½” (18 x 28½, 22½ x 35¾, 27 x 43)”
gauge: 21 sts = 4”; 12 rows = 41/8” in dc with double strand of thread and E hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
FLAG
With E hook and double strand of A ch 77 (152, 190, 228).
Row 1: Dc in 4th ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 75 (150, 188, 226) sts.
Row 2: Ch 3, skip first dc, dc in each dc across and in top of ch-3; turn.
Repeat Row 2 working 0 (2, 3, 4) more rows with A, then 2 (4, 5, 6) rows B, [2 (4, 5, 6) rows A, 2 (4, 5, 6) rows B] twice – 6 stripes.
Next Row: With A, work in dc across first 43 (87, 110, 132) sts changing to C in last st, with C work in dc to end; turn.
Next Row: With C, Work in dc across first 32 (63, 78, 94) sts, with A work in dc to end; turn.
Continue to work all C sts with C while keeping continuity of A and B stripes until there are 13 stripes in all, ending with an A stripe. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
Band
Row 1: With C hook, attach double strand of B at upper left corner of C section; ch 1, work 2 sc in each row end across the short side of the flag; turn.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Work 1 (3, 5, 7) more sc rows. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
NOTE: Work Round 1 of Stars over the beginning strand; then pull on this strand to close the center of the star tightly.
STARS (Make 100)
Smallest (Medium) Sizes only
Rnd 1: With steel (C) hook and single (double) strand of B, ch 3; slip st in 2nd ch from hook, slip st in next ch as the “ring”, [ch 2, slip st in 2nd ch from hook, slip st in the “ring” chain] 4 times – 5 points. Fasten off. Weave in ends. Star should measure approximately 3/8 (5/8)” across.
Large Size only
Rnd 1: With C hook and double strand of B, ch 2; 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with a slip st to first sc.
Rnd 2: [Ch 2, sc in 2nd ch from hook, slip st in next sc] 5 times – 5 points. Fasten off. Weave in ends. Star should measure 7/8” across.
Extra-large Size only
Rnd 1: With C hook and double strand of B, ch 2; 10 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with a slip st to first sc.
Rnd 2: [Ch 3, sc in 2nd ch from hook, hdc in next ch, skip next sc, slip st in next sc] 5 times – 5 points. Fasten off. Weave in ends. Star should measure 11/8” across.
FINISHING
All Sizes
Glue 50 stars to C section on front and back of flag following photograph for placement.
AUNT LYDIA’S® “Classic Crochet Thread”, Size 10, Art. 154 available in white & ecru 400 yd; solid color 250 yd; shaded color 300 yd balls.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each of Main Color MC and Contrast Color CC. Colors Used: 319 Cherry Red, 316 Soft White, and 368 Paddy Green.
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[] = work directions given in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Stockings measure 11 (17, 21)” long.
gauge: 12 sts = 4”; 15 rows = 4” in sc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
LEG
With MC, ch 31 (43, 47).
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 30 (42, 46) sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Repeat Row 2 and work stripe pattern of 8 rows MC and 2 rows CC until 6 (9, 11½)” from beginning, end wrong side row. Fasten off.
HEEL: With right side facing, skip 23 (32, 35) sc; join CC and sc in last 7 (10, 11) sc; bring other side of leg around and sc in first 7 (10, 11) sc; turn – 14 (20, 22) sc.
Next Row: Ch 1, dec, sc in each sc to last 2 sc; dec; turn – 12 (18, 20) sc.
Repeat last row to dec 1 st each end of every row until 4 sts remain. Now increase 1 st at each end of every row until there are 14 (20, 22) sc. Fasten off.
FOOT: With right side facing, skip first 7 (10, 11) sc of heel, join MC and sc in last 7 (10, 11) sc, [dec over next 2 sc of leg] twice, sc in next 8 (14, 16) sc of leg, [dec over next 2 sc of leg] twice, sc in remaining 7 (10, 11) sc of heel; turn – 26 (38, 42) sc. Work even in sc and stripe pattern until foot measures 3 (5, 6)” from last row of heel, end wrong side row. Cut MC.
TOE-Next Row: With CC, ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn. ** Next Row: Ch 1, dec, sc in next 9 (15, 17) sc, dec; turn – 11 (17, 19) sc.
Dec 1 st each end of every row until 3 sc remain. Fasten off. **
With wrong side facing, join CC in next sc of last long row. Repeat from ** to **.
FINISHING: Sew toe, foot, heel, and back seams.
Top Edging and Hanging Loop: With right side facing, attach CC at back seam.
Round 1: Ch 1, sc in each st of beginning ch around; join with a slip st to first sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join; ch 12, slip st in same st as joining; slip st in each ch of ch-12. Fasten off. Weave in ends.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® Scrub Off™ (2.6 oz/75 g; 106 yds/97 m) Energetic Pink (90013) 2 balls
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 6" [15 cm] diameter.
gauge: 13 dc and 7 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: Ch 3 at beg of rnds does not count as dc.
Ch 5. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring. Ch 40 for hanging loop and sl st back into ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. Work 25 sc in ch-5 ring. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. 3 dc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first dc. 75 dc.
3rd rnd: Ch 3. 3 dc in each dc around. Join with sl st to first dc. 225 dc.
4th rnd: Ch 3. 3 dc in each dc around. Join with sl st to first dc. 675 dc.
Fasten off.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® Party™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 195 yds/178 m)
Size U.S. F/5 (3.75 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume™ crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
measurements: Approx 6½” [16.5 cm] wide.
gauge: 16 sc and 17 rows = 4” [10 cm].
instructions: To join colors, work to last loops on hook of first color. Draw new color through last loops and proceed. Join all rnds with sl st. VERSION 1 CIRCLE (make 2) (See diagram on page 2). With A, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring. 1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 15 dc in ring. Join B to top of ch 3. Break A. 16 dc. 2nd rnd: With B, ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Join C to first sc. 24 sc. 3rd rnd: With C, ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in next sc. 1 dc in next sc. 1 dc in back loop only of next sc. *1 dc in next sc. 2 dc in next sc. 1 dc in next sc. 1 dc in back loop only of next sc. Rep from * around. Join B to top of ch 3. Break C. 30 dc. 4th rnd: With B, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *2 sc in next dc. 1 sc in each of next 2 dc. Working in front of rnds, 1 tr in rem front loop of sc from 2nd rnd. Skip next dc (behind tr). 1 sc in next dc. Rep from * around, ending last rep at **. Join to first sc. Fasten off. 36 sts. Join Circles: Place WS of Circles facing each other, matching pat (aligning tr sts). 1st rnd: Working through both thicknesses, join D with sl st through any tr of 4th rnd. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in next tr. Rep from * around, ending at **. Join A to first sc. 2nd rnd: With A, sl st in next sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp. *1 hdc in next sc. 2 dc in next sc. (Ch 3. Sl st back into first of 3 ch) twice. Ch 3. Sl st back into last dc worked – trefoil picot worked. 2 dc in next sc. 1 hdc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. 3rd rnd: Join D with sl st in any ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp. *Ch 6. 1 sc in top point of next trefoil picot. Ch 6. Rep from * around, ending at **. Join to first sc. 4th rnd: *8 sc in next ch-6 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 3. Sl st back into last sc worked - picot made. 8 sc in next ch-6 sp. Skip next sc. Rep from * 4 times more. 8 sc in next ch-6 sp. 1 sc in next sc. Ch 32 for hanging loop. Sl st back into last sc worked. 8 sc in next ch-6 sp. Skip last sc. Join to first sc. Fasten off. VERSION 2 Work as for Version 1 substituting B for A, A for B, D for C and C for D.

pattern_name: COUNTDOWN TO CHRISTMAS CROCHET ADVENT CALENDAR
materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (6 oz/170.1 g; 315 yds/288 m)
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hdc2tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next st) twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 25" [63.5 cm] wide x 37" [94 cm] tall
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Background
With A, ch 83.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 82 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 37" [94 cm]. Fasten off.

Edging
1st rnd: (RS). Join B with sl st in any corner. Ch 1. Work 1 rnd sc evenly around Background, working 3 sc in each corner. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

Tabs (make 2)
With B, ch 39.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 38 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 2½" [6 cm]. Fasten off.

Fold Tabs in half. Beg 1" [2.5 cm] in from corner on top edge of Background, sew Tabs evenly across as shown in picture.

TREE
Section One
With C, ch 2.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn. 1 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. Turn. 2 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 4 sc.
4th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep 4th row until 34 sts in row. Fasten off.

Section Two
1st row: (RS). Skip first 7 sc in last row. Join C with sl st to next sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same st as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 19 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 20 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each st to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until 54 sts in row. Fasten off.

Section Three
1st row: (RS). Skip first 7 sc in last row, Join C with sl st to next sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same st as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 39 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 40 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each st to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until 74 sts in row. Fasten off.

Sew Tree to Background 2½" [6 cm] from top. Sew 24 buttons to hang ornaments onto Tree through all thicknesses, evenly spaced, as shown in photo.

STAR
With J, ch 3.
1st rnd: 10 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 20 hdc.
Fasten off.

Star Points
Each point is worked over 4 sts. 5 points total. Join with sl st to next hdc of last rnd.
1st row: Ch 2. Beg in same hdc as last sl st, hdc2tog twice. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in last hdc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 2. Hdc2tog. Fasten off.
Rep Star Points 4 more times. Sew Star to top of Tree as shown in picture.

POCKETS (make 4)
Ch 9.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 8 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 3" [7.5 cm]. Fasten off.
With A, embroider numbers 1-24 on Pockets according to diagram. Beg 1¼" [3 cm] up from bottom and 1" [2.5 cm] from side, sew 3 edges of Pockets onto Background in order according to diagram, leaving 1" [2.5 cm] between Pockets.

ORNAMENTS
WREATH (make 2)
FRONT and BACK (make alike)
With C, ch 8. Join with sl st to first ch, making sure not to twist ch.
1st rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). 2 hdc in first ch. 2 hdc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 16 hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first hdc. 2 sc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.
Fasten off.

With WS facing each other, sew center of Wreath tog. Join D, with sl st to any sc through both thicknesses. Work 1st rnd through both thicknesses, lightly stuffing as you go.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. Ch 2. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Ch 2. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. Do not fasten off.

Loop: Ch 6. Join with sl st to first sl st in last rnd. Fasten off.
Bow: With B, ch 30. Fasten off. Tie ch into bow and fasten to bottom of Wreath.

SNOWMAN (make 2)
Head: With D, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 8 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep 2nd rnd twice more.

Body: 1st rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep 2nd rnd 3 more times.
Next rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 8 times. 8 sc. Fasten off, leaving a tail. Lighty stuff Snowman. Using tail, gather bottom of Snowman and fasten securely.

With E, embroider buttons and eyes as shown in picture. With I, embroider carrot nose as shown in picture.

Scarf: With K, ch 20. Fasten off. Tie Scarf around Snowman’s neck as shown in picture.

Loop: With D, ch 8. Fasten off. Secure onto top of Snowman’s Head.

SANTA (make 2)
Beard and Face: With D, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 2 sc in next sc. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.

7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Join M. With M, 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Break M. With D, 1 sc in each of last 6 sc. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep 7th rnd twice more.

Hat: 1st rnd: Ch 1. In front loops only, 1 sc in first sc. Ch 2. *1 sc in next sc. Ch 2. Rep from * around. Join H with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: With H, ch 1. In rem back loops only 2 rows below, 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.

Lightly stuff Santa.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 6 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 6 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 3 times. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

Loop: With D, ch 9. Fasten off. Sew loop to top of Santa’s Hat.
Mustache: Cut 3" [7.5 cm] length of D. Tie knot in center of strand. Trim to ¾" [2 cm] with knot at center. Sew into place as shown in picture.
Finishing: With one ply of E, embroider Eyes as shown in picture.

HOT COCOA (make 1 each with G as Color 1 and I as Color 1)
Front: With Color 1, ch 9.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 8 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 2" [5 cm].
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Join F. With F, 1 sc in next sc. 1 hdc in next sc. 1 dc in each of next 2 sc. 1 hdc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Break F. With Color 1, 1 sc in last sc. Turn.
Next row: 1 sl st in back loop only in each st to end of row. Fasten off.
With D, embroider 3 French knots for Marshmallows.

Back: With Color 1, ch 9.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 8 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 2" [5 cm].
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. 1 hdc in next sc. 1 dc in each of next 2 sc. 1 hdc in next sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Turn.
Next row: 1 sl st in back loop only in each st to end of row. Fasten off.

Handle: With Color 1, ch 7.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 3 sc in next ch. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 3 sc in next ch. 1 sc in last ch. Fasten off.
Finishing: With sl st edges facing out and Handle sandwiched between Front and Back on the right of the Hot Cocoa, sew sides, top, and bottom tog.

Loop: With Color 1, ch 9. Fasten off. Sew loop to top right corner of Hot Cocoa.

SNOWFLAKE (make 2)
With D, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). 2 hdc in first sc. 2 hdc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 12 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 hdc. Ch 3. *1 sc in each of next 2 hdc. Ch 3. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: 1 sl st in each of first 2 sc. (Sl st. Ch 2. Sl st) all in next ch-3 sp. *1 sl st in each of next 2 sc. (Sl st. Ch 2. Sl st) all in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sl st.

Loop: Ch 8. Join with sl st to last sl st. Fasten off.

MITTEN (make 1 each with L as Color 1 and N as Color 1)
With A, ch 14. Join with sl st to first ch, making sure not to twist.
1st rnd: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 14 hdc. Join Color 1. Break A.
2nd rnd: With Color 1, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in first hdc. 1 sc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first sc.

Thumb gusset: 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in each rem sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each rem sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sc.

Hand: 1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. Skip next 4 sc. 1 sc in each rem sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep 2nd rnd once more.

Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Sc2tog. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * twice more. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 10 sc.
Next rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 5 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 5 sc. Fasten off, leaving tail. Draw tail through rem sc and fasten securely.

Thumb: Join Color 1 with sl st in first skipped st of thumb gusset.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same st as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 4 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Fasten off, leaving tail. Draw tail through rem sc and fasten securely.

Loop: With A, ch 9. Fasten off. Sew loop to Mitten as shown in picture.

HOLLY (make 1 with K as Color 1 and G as Color 2 and 1 with C as Color 1 and H as Color 2)
Leaf (make 2)
With Color 1, ch 8.
1st rnd: Working in top loops only, 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 hdc in next ch. (1 hdc. 1 dc. 1 hdc) all in next ch. 1 sc in next ch. (1 hdc. 1 dc. 1 hdc) all in next ch. 3 sc in last ch. Do not turn. Work in rem loops of foundation ch, 1 hdc in next ch. (1 hdc. 1 dc. 1 hdc) all in next ch. 1 sc in next ch. (1 hdc. 1 dc. 1 hdc) all in next ch. 2 sc in first ch. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

Berry: With Color 2, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Finishing: Sew 2 Leaves and Berry tog as shown in picture.

Loop: With Color 1, ch 9. Fasten off. Sew to top of Holly.

GIFT (make 1 with G as Color 1 and H as Color 2 and 1 with B as Color 1 and J as Color 2)
Front and Back (make alike)
With Color 1, ch 9.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 8 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 2¼" [5.5 cm]. Fasten off.

Ribbon: With Color 2, ch 9.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of hook. Fasten off.
Sew Ribbon to Front as shown in picture.

Bow: With Color 2, ch 7.
1st row: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 5 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). 1 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Fasten off.
With Color 2, wrap yarn around middle of Bow to cinch in the middle. Sew onto Front as shown in picture.
With Bow facing out, sew around edges of Front and Back, lightly stuffing as you go.

Loop: With Color 1, ch 9. Fasten off. Sew onto corner of Gift as shown in picture.

CANDY CANE (make 2)
Coil (make 1 each in A and H)
Ch 20. 2 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 3 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Fasten off.
Twist Coils around each other to form Candy Cane. Bend slightly approx 1" [2.5 cm] from top. Using H, tack loosely to form curve.

Loop: With H, ch 9. Fasten off. Sew to top of Candy Cane as shown in picture.

STOCKING (make 1 each with B as Color 1 and K as Color 1)
With A, ch 14.
1st row: (RS) 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of row. Join Color 1. Turn. 12 hdc.
2nd row: With Color 1, ch 1. Working in front loops only, 1 sc in first hdc. 1 sc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.

Leg: 1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep 1st row until work from beg measures approx 2" [5 cm] ending with RS facing. Fasten off.

Heel: With RS facing, skip first 9 sc. Join A with sl st in next sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Bring other side of leg around. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc of long row below. Turn. 3 sts.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 1 sc in next sc of long row below. Turn. 4 sts.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 1 sc in next sc of long row below. Turn. 5 sts.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 1 sc in next sc of long row below. Turn. 6 sts.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 1 sc in next sc of long row below. Turn. 7 sts.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 1 sc in next sc of long row below. Turn. 8 sts. Fasten off.

Foot: With RS of work facing, skip first 3 sc of Heel. Join Color 1 with sl st in next sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc of Heel. Skip next sc of Leg. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Skip next sc of Leg. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc of Heel. Ch 1. Turn. 10 sts.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Join A. Turn.

Toe: Next 2 rows: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 5 times. Fasten off.

Finishing: Sew Cuff and Leg back seams. Sew Foot and Toe seams. Sew corners of Heel closed.

Loop: With A, ch 9. Fasten off. Sew to top corner of Stocking as shown in picture.

REINDEER (make 2)
Snout: With F, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 8 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Rep 2nd rnd 2 twice more.

Head: 1st rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep 2nd rnd 3 more times.
Next rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 8 times. 8 sc. Fasten off, leaving a tail. Lightly stuff Head. Using tail, gather top of Head and fasten securely.

Nose: With H, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

Ears (make 2)
With F, ch 4.
1st row: Sl st into 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. Sl st in last ch. Fasten off.

Antlers (make 2)
With M, ch 5.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of row. Turn. 4 sc.
2nd row: Sl st in each of first 3 sc. Ch 2. Sl st in same sc as last sl st. Sl st in last sc. Fasten off.

With E, embroider eyes as shown in picture. Sew Antlers, Ears, and Nose onto Head and Snout as shown in picture.

Loop: With F, ch 9. Fasten off. Sew to top of Reindeer as shown in picture.

GINGERBREAD MAN (make 2)
Head: With F, ch 3.
1st rnd: 10 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first hdc. Fasten off.

Arms: 1st row: Ch 4. Join with sl st to any 2 hdc in Head. Ch 5. Turn.
2nd row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. 1 sc in each of next 2 sl st. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 10 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Fasten off.

Torso: 1st row: Skip first 3 sc. Join with sl st in next sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same st as sl st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Turn. 4 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Turn.
Rep 2nd row once more. Do not fasten off.

Legs: 1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. Turn. 2 sc. Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Turn.
Rep last row twice more. Fasten off. Rep last row twice more. Fasten off.

Join with sl st to first unworked st on Torso.
1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. 1 sc in next sc. Turn. 2 sc.
Rep last row 3 more times. Fasten off.

Icing: With A, sl st into any edge st of Gingerbread Man. Sl st evenly around Gingerbread Man. Fasten off.

Loop: With F, ch 9. Fasten off. Sew to top of Gingerbread Man as shown in picture.

materials: Aunt Lydia's® Fine Crochet Thread, Size 20: 1 ball 201 White
Aunt Lydia's® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 1 ball 1 White
Aunt Lydia's® Fashion Crochet Size 3: 1 ball 201 White
abbreviations: ( ) = work all directions in parentheses in the indicated stitch or space
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Finished size: varies by thread size (3.5" for Size 20, 4" for Size 10, 6" for Size 3)
gauge: CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the finished size.
instructions:
SNOWFLAKE #2 (All sizes)
With selected thread and hook, ch 5, slip st in first ch to form ring.
Round 1 (Right Side): Slip st in ring, Beginning 3-tr cluster in ring (see Special Stitches), ch 5, slip st in top of cluster just made, ch 4, *3-tr cluster in ring (see Special Stitches), ch 5, slip st in top of cluster just made, ch 4; repeat from * 4 times, slip st in top of first cluster—6 clusters with ch-5 loops. 
Round 2: Slip st in first ch-5 loop, ch 2 (counts as dc), 8 dc in same loop, [9 dc in next ch-5 loop] 5 times, slip st in top of beginning ch-2—6 9-dc shells. 
Round 3: (Slip st in 2nd dc, ch 1, sc in same dc, ch 3, skip 1 dc, sc in next 2 dc, ch 11, sc in same dc, sc in next dc, ch 3, skip next dc, sc in next dc, skip last dc) in first shell, *(skip first dc, sc in next dc, ch 3, skip 1 dc, sc in next 2 dc, ch 11, sc in same dc, sc in next dc, ch 3, skip next dc, sc in next dc, skip last dc) in next shell; repeat from * 4 times, slip st in first sc of round—6 ch-11 loops.
Round 4: Slip st in first ch-3 space, ch 1, *2 sc in ch-3 space, ch 3, 2 sc in same ch-3 space, 3 sc in next ch-11 space, [ch 3, 3 sc in same ch-11 space] 2 times, Triple picot in sc just made (see Special Stitches), 2 sc in same ch-11 space, [ch 3, 3 sc in same ch-11 space] 2 times, 2 sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, 2 sc in same ch-3 space; starting in next ch-3 space, repeat from * 4 times then from * to ** once; turn, ch 7, slip st in 7th ch from hook to form ring; (turn, ch 1, 11 sc) in ring just made, slip st around base of ring; 2 sc in same ch-11 space, [ch 3, 3 sc in same ch-11 space] 2 times, 2 sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, 2 sc in same ch-3 space; slip st in first sc of round. Fasten off and weave in ends. Block and stiffen with stiffener of choice (see Note).

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each of 336 Warm Brown A, 316 Soft White B, and 319 Cherry Red C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4 mm [US G-6]
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Man and Lady measure 5½” (14 cm) tall; House measures 5” (12.5 cm) tall; Baby measures 4½” (11.5 cm) tall.
gauge: 4 sc = 1” (2.5 cm); 4 rows = 1” (2.5 cm). CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Large Heart (make 3)
With C, ch 2.
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Do not join.
