Round 2: (Sc, ch 2, sc) in first sc, slip st in next sc, 2 hdc in next sc, ch 1, slip st in next sc, ch 1, 2 hdc in next sc, slip st in next sc; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing.
MAN 
Body (make 2)
Beginning at top of head, with A, ch 4.
Row 1 (right side): Work 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch, 2 sc in last sc, turn—5 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first sc, *2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc; repeat from * across, turn—7 sc.
Rows 3–6: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 7: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc3tog, sc2tog, turn—3 sc.
Row 8: Ch 6, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 4 ch, sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last sc, turn—9 sc.
Row 9: Ch 6, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 4 ch, sc in each sc across, turn—14 sc.
Row 10: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in next 10 sc, sc2tog, turn—12 sc.
Row 11: Ch 1, sc in first 10 sc; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—10 sc.
Row 12: Ch 1, sc in first 8 sc; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—8 sc.
Rows 13 and 14: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
First Leg
Row 1 (right side): Ch 1, sc in first 2 sc, sc2tog; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—3 sc.
Rows 2 and 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn—4 sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in last 3 sc, turn—5 sc.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc in each sc across. Fasten off.
2nd Leg
Row 1 (right side): With right side facing, join A with sc in first unworked sc of Row 14, sc in next 2 sc; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—3 sc.
Rows 2 and 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 4: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in last 2 sc, turn—4 sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in first 3 sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn—5 sc.
Round 6: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; working across ends of rows, in sts, and in opposite side of foundation ch, sc evenly spaced around working 2 sc as needed in rows at curved edges; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off, leaving long tail on one piece for sewing.
FINISHING MAN
1. Select one piece as front. Leave remaining piece unworked.
Edging Round (right side): With right side facing and working in front loops only, join A with sc in any sc, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc.
2. With B, embroider French knot eyes and 3 French knots across each arm and leg. Using photograph as a guide, embroider small straight stitches under eyes for smiling mouth.
3. Sew large heart on front.
4. Working through unworked back loops of Edging Round and both loops of back, sew front and back together, tucking in ends and stuffing lightly as you go.
5. Hanging Loop Join B with slip st to center of top of head, ch 15, slip st in same st as joining st. Fasten off.
Weave in ends.
LADY 
Body (make 2)
Work same as man.
Bib Apron 
Bib 
With B, ch 5.
Row 1 (right side): Ch 1, sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across, turn—4 sc.
Rows 2–4: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn. 
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in each sc across. Do not turn.
Apron
Row 1 (right side): Ch 1, work 5 sc evenly spaced across ends of rows, turn—5 sc.
Rows 2 and 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc across, turn—20 sc.
Rows 4–6: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
FINISHING LADY
Work Steps 1 and 2 of Finishing Man instructions.
Sew large heart on apron. Sew apron to front of lady.
Work Steps 4 and 5 of Finishing Man instructions. Weave in ends.
BABY 
Body (make 2)
Beginning at top of head, with A, ch 4.
Row 1 (right side): Work 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across, turn—6 sc.
Rows 2–5: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 6: Ch 1, [sc2tog] 3 times, turn—3 sc.
Row 7: Ch 5, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 3 ch, sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc, turn—8 sc.
Row 8: Ch 5, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 3 ch, sc in each sc across, turn—12 sc.
Row 9: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in last 10 sc, turn—11 sc.
Row 10: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in next 7 sc; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—8 sc.
Row 11: Ch 1, sc in first 6 sc; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—6 sc.
First Leg
Row 1 (wrong side): Ch 1, sc in first 3 sc; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—3 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next 2 sc, turn—4 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc across. Fasten off.
2nd Leg
Row 1 (wrong side): With wrong side facing, join A with sc in first unworked sc of Row 11, sc in next 2 sc, turn—3 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn—4 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in each sc across. 
Round 5: Work same as Round 6 of man.
Bib
With B, ch 2.
Row 1 (right side): Work 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook, turn.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first sc, 2 sc in next 2 sc, sc in last sc, turn—6 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first sc, *2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc; repeat from * across, turn—8 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 5: Ch 1, sc in next sc, sc2tog, sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog, sc in last sc, turn—6 sc.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc in next sc, [sc2tog] twice, sc in last sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
FINISHING BABY
Work Steps 1 and 2 of Finishing Man instructions.
Using photo as a guide and with 2 strands of C held together, embroider heart on bib with 2 lazy daisy stitches. Begin and end each stitch in same place in center of bib, angling stitches away from each other. Sew bib to front.
Work Steps 4 and 5 of Finishing Man instructions. Weave in ends.
Row 9: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc2tog, sc in each sc across to last 2 sc, sc2tog; change to A, turn—11 sc.
Row 10: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Row 11: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in each sc across to last 2 sc, sc2tog, turn—9 sc.
Rows 12–17: Repeat last 2 rows 3 times—3 sc.
Round 18: Ch 1, sc3tog; working down first side, sc in end of each row; working in opposite side of foundation ch, 3 sc in first ch, sc in each ch across to last ch, 3 sc in last ch, working up other side, sc in end of end of each, 3 sc in first sc; join with slip st in next st. Fasten off.
Back
Work same as front, omitting all color changes.
Window
With B, ch 8; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, 12 sc in ring. Do not join.
Round 2: Slip st in front loop of first sc, *ch 2, skip next sc, slip st front loop of next sc; repeat from * around, ch 2, skip last sc; join with slip st in first slip st. Fasten off.
FINISHING HOUSE
On front, work Edging Round of Finishing Man instructions.
Trim With right side of front facing and held upside down (top of piece closest to you), join B with slip st in first unworked loop of Row 9, *ch 4, skip next unworked loop, slip st in next unworked loop; repeat from * across. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Tack loops down.
Using photograph as a guide, sew window in place and embroider 2 crossing straight stitches for panes.
With C, embroider a French knot in center of each ch-4 space of trim. With B, embroider French knots around sides and lower edge of front.
Work Steps 3–5 of Finishing Man instructions. Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Super Value™ (7 oz/197 g; 426 yds/389 m)
Snowman Main Color (MC) Winter White (07407) 1 ball
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Approx 15" [38 cm] long from cuff to heel.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions: Note: When working Cuff, sl st loosely and do not ch at beg of rows. Cuff: With A, ch 17. 1st row: (RS). 1 sl st in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sl st in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 16 sl st. 2nd row: Working in back loops only, 1 sl st in each sl st across. Turn. Rep 2nd row until work from beg measures 14" [35.5 cm], ending on a WS row. Join Cuff: Working in back loops only, sl st last row and rem loops of foundation ch tog. Fasten off. Leg: Join MC with sl st to side edge of Cuff. 1st rnd: Ch 1. Work 46 sc evenly around side edge of Cuff. Join with sl st to first sc. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep 2nd rnd until work from bottom of Cuff measures 9” [23 cm]. Heel: With RS facing, join MC with sl st to first sc. 1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 22 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Rep 2nd row for 2" [5 cm], ending on a WS row. Shape heel: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 15 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 9 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Turn. 3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 10 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Turn. 4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 11 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Turn. 5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 12 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Turn. 6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 13 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Turn. 7th and 8th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 14 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 15 sts. Fasten off at end of 8th row. Joining rnd: With RS facing, join MC with sl st at left side of Heel Base. Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 23 sc of instep. Place marker. Work 7 sc up right side of Heel, 1 sc in each of next 15 sc across end of Heel and 7 sc down left side of Heel. Join with sl st to first sc. 52 sc. Nose: (make 1). With B, ch 2. 1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc. Fasten off. Ears: (make 2). With MC, ch 2. 1st row: (RS). 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn. 2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. Turn. 4 sc. 3rd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 6 sc. 4th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 8 sc. 5th to 10th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 11th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 12th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Fasten off. Antlers: (make 2). With C, ch 2. 1st row: (RS). 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn. 2nd to 7th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. Fasten off after last row. Sew Eyes, Nose, Ears and Antlers to Stocking as shown in picture. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to marker. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep 2nd rnd until 44 sts rem. Next rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd until work from joining rnd measures 5½" [14 cm]. Shape toe: 1st rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Sc2tog) 4 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Sc2tog) 4 times. Join with sl st to first sc. Cont in same manner, dec 4 sts on every rnd until 12 sts rem. Break yarn, leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts and fasten securely. Hanging loop: With A, ch 25. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and each ch to end of chain. Fasten off. Fold in half and sew in position. Snowman Note: Ch 2 at beg of rows or rnds count as hdc. Eyes: (make 2). With C, ch 2. 1st rnd: 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 2nd rnd: Ch 2. (1 dc. 1 hdc) in same sp as last sl st. (1 hdc. 1 dc. 1 hdc) in each of next 4 sc. Join with sl st to top of ch 2. Fasten off. Nose: (make 1). With B, ch 3. 1st row: 3 hdc in 3rd ch from hook (counts as 4 hdc). Turn. 2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Turn. 4 hdc. 3rd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in first hdc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. Turn. 5 hdc. 4th to 7th rows: Ch 2. 1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. Turn. Fasten off after 7th row. Sew Eyes and Nose to Stocking as shown in picture. Reindeer Eyes: (make 2). With C, ch 2. 1st row: 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn. 2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. Turn. 4 sc. 3rd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 6 sc. 4th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 hdc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join A. Turn. 8 sts. 5th row: With A, ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 hdc. Sc2tog. Turn. 6th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 7th row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. Fasten off.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver® (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Small amount Contrast J Petal Pink (0373)
Bernat® Pipsqueak™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 101 yds/92 m)
Sizes U.S. G/6 (4 mm) and U.S. H/8 (5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
3 Tissue Boxes, 9" x 4.75 x 4.5" [23 x 12 x 11.5 cm].
abbreviations: Cluster = (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops) 4 times in indicated stitch. Yoh and draw through all 5 loops.
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Approx 10" x 5" x 12" [25.5 x 12.5 x 30.5 cm], excluding hat.
gauge: 14 hdc and 12 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook.
instructions:
Notes:
• Tissue Box Cover is worked from top down, beg with top panel and Hat brim.
• The rem of Hat is worked separately and attached later.
• Try the Cover on tissue box for size as you work.
• Ch 1 or ch 2 at beg of rnds does not count as st.
• Join with sl st to first sc or as specified otherwise.

TISSUE BOX COVER
Top Panel
With larger hook and A, ch 17.
1st row:  1 hdc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 16 hdc.
2nd to 14th rows: Ch 1. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.

Sides
Begin working in rnds as follows:
15th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each hdc to end of row. Work 14 sc evenly along first side of Panel. Working in rem loops of foundation ch, 1 sc in each of next 16 ch. Work 14 sc evenly along other side of Panel. Join. 60 sc.
16th rnd:  Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 hdc in each sc around. Join. 60 hdc.
17th and 18th rnds: Ch 1. Working in both loops,  1 hdc in each hdc around. Join. Fasten off at end of last rnd.

Hat Brim: 19th rnd: With I and K held tog, join with sl st in front loop of first hdc. Ch 2. Working in front loops only, 1 dc in each st around. Join. Fasten off. 60 dc.

Head
20th rnd: Join [B for Santa and Elf or E for Reindeer] with sl st to rem back loop of 18th rnd join. Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 hdc in each st around. Join. 60 hdc.
21st to 27th rnds: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 hdc in each st around. Join.
Your cover should be half way down the length of your tissue box. This is where the tissues will poke out from under the nose at the front of the Cover. If not, add or remove rows as needed. Put cover on box and decide which side will be the front. PM for 8 center hdc of front for tissue slot.

Tissue Slot: 28th rnd: Ch 1. 1 hdc in each hdc to first marker. Ch 8. Skip next 8 hdc. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of rnd. Join. 52 hdc and 1 ch-8 sp.
29th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 hdc in each st and ch around. Join. 60 hdc.

Bottom
Santa and Elf Only: 30th to 32nd rnds: Ch 1. 1 hdc in each st around. Join. Fasten off at end of 32nd rnd.
Body Trim: 33rd rnd: With I and K held tog, join with sl st in front loop of first hdc. Ch 2. Working in front loops only, 1 dc in each st around. Join. Fasten off. 60 dc.
34th rnd:  Join [A for Santa or C for Elf] with sl st to rem back loop of 32nd rnd join. Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 60 hdc.
35th rnd: Ch 1. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join.
Rep last rnd until Cover reaches end of tissue box. Fasten off.

Reindeer Only: 30th to 32nd rnds: Ch 1. 1 hdc in each st around. Join. Fasten off at end of  32nd rnd.

Collar
33rd rnd: With I and K held tog, join with sl st to first hdc. Ch 1. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join. Fasten off.
34th to 36th rnds: Join C with sl st in first hdc. Ch 1. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join. Fasten off at end of 36th rnd.
37th rnd: With I and K held tog, join with sl st to first hdc. Ch 1. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join. Fasten off.
38th rnd: Join E with sl st in first hdc. Ch 1. 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join. Rep last rnd until Cover reaches end of tissue box. Fasten off.

CANDY DISH/POT OF GOLD
Base
With larger hook and G, ch 11.
1st row: 1 hdc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 10 hdc.
2nd to 4th rows:  Ch 1. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Turn.
Note: When working in continuous rnds, move marker up as you complete each rnd.

Sides
Begin working in continuous rnds.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 hdc in each hdc to end of row. Do not turn. *Working along side edge of Base, 2 hdc in end of first row. 1 hdc in end of each of next 2 rows. 2 hdc in end of last row.* Working across rem loops of foundation ch, 1 hdc in each of next 10 ch. Rep from * to * once more. Do not join. PM for beg of rnd. 32 sts.
6th rnd: Working in back loops only, 1 hdc in each hdc around.
7th to 11th rnds: Working in both loops, 1 hdc in each hdc around.
12th rnd: Working from left to right, instead of from right to left, as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

REVERSE SC DIAGRAM

HAT
Santa or Reindeer Only:  With larger hook and A, ch 2. Work in continuous rnds.
1st rnd: 6 hdc in 2nd ch from hook.

2nd rnd: 2 hdc in each hdc around. 12 hdc.
3rd rnd: 1 hdc in each hdc around.
4th rnd: *1 hdc in next hdc . 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. 18 hdc.
5th and 6th rnds:  1 hdc in each hdc around.
7th rnd:  *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc . 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. 24 hdc.
8th and 9th rnds:  1 hdc in each hdc around.
10th rnd:  *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. 30 hdc.
11th and 12th rnds: 1 hdc in each hdc around.
13th rnd:  *1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc . Rep from * around. 36 hdc.
14th and 15th rnds: 1 hdc in each hdc around.
16th rnd:  *1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. 42 hdc.
17th and 18th rnds: 1 hdc in each hdc around.
19th rnd:  *1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. 48 hdc.
20th and 21st rnds: 1 hdc in each hdc around.
22nd rnd: *1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. 54 hdc.
23rd and 24th rnds: 1 hdc in each hdc around.
25th rnd:  *1 hdc in each of next 8 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. 60 hdc.
26th to 31st rnds:  1 hdc in each hdc around.
32nd rnd:  1 sc in each of next 2 hdc. Sl st in next hdc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Pompom: Wind I and K around 3 fingers approx 50 times. Remove from fingers and tie tightly in center. Cut through each side of loops. Trim to smooth round shape. Attach Pompom to point of Hat.

Notes:
• To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops, then proceed in new color.
• Carry yarn on WS up side of work when not in use.

Stripe Pat
With A, work 3 rnds.
With C, work 3 rnds. 
These 6 rnds form Stripe Pat.

Elf Only: With larger hook and C, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 hdc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 6 hdc.
2nd rnd: 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 12 hdc.
3rd rnd: 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join.
4th rnd:  *1 hdc in each of next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 hdc.
5th and 6th rnds:  1 hdc in each hdc around. Join with A at end of last rnd. Do not break C.
Proceed in Stripe Pat as follows:
7th rnd:  *1 hdc in each of next 2 hdc. 2 hdc in hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 hdc.
8th and 9th rnds:  1 hdc in each hdc around. Join.
10th rnd:  *1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 hdc.
11th and 12th rnds: 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join.
13th rnd:  *1 hdc in each of next 4 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sts.
14th and 15th rnds: 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join.
16th rnd:  *1 hdc in each of next 5 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Join. Rep from * around. 42 hdc.
17th and 18th rnds: 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join.
19th rnd:  *1 hdc in each of next 6 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 48 hdc.
20th and 21st rnds: 1 hdc in each hdc around. Join.
22nd rnd: *1 hdc in each of next 7 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 54 hdc.
23rd and 24th rnds: 1 hdc in each hdcst around. Join.
25th rnd:  *1 hdc in each of next 8 hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join. 60 hdc.
26th to 31st rnds:  1 hdc in each hdc around. Join. 60 hdc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Pompom: Make same as for Santa and Reindeer.

FACIAL FEATURES
Before you begin, we encourage you to share your personality with these three characters - changing eye colors and more. Be creative and have fun!  Safety eyes can be used in place of the black pupils if preferred. Irises can be customized to match family members or friends who the Cover is for. You can also get quite creative with the elf’s hair strands! You can make them longer, or wavy or curly! Every elf is unique!
You can make arms longer if you wish.
NOSE
Santa or Elf Only:  With smaller hook and B, beg using magic loop method, demonstrated here:  https://www.yarnspirations.com/ca-en/video-y-crochet-magic-loop.html
Work in continuous rnds.
1st rnd:  6 sc in ring. 6 sc. PM for beg of rnd.
2nd rnd:  2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 18 sc.
4th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
5th to 9th rnds:  1 sc in each sc around.
10th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 18 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Proceed to Back Plate.

Reindeer Only:
With smaller hook and A, beg using magic loop method, demonstrated here:
https://www.yarnspirations.com/ca-en/video-y-crochet-magic-loop.html

Work in continuous rnds.
1st rnd: 6 sc in ring. 6 sc. PM on last st.
2nd rnd:  2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 18 sc.
4th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
5th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 30 sc.
6th to 10th rnds:  1 sc in each sc around. 30 sc.
11th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
12th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 18 sc.
13th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Proceed to Back Plate.

Back Plate
With smaller hook and matching color yarn, beg using magic loop method.
Work in continuous rnds.
1st rnd:  6 sc in ring. 6 sc. PM for beg of rnd.
2nd rnd:  2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 18 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

EYES
Whites (make 2)
With smaller hook and I, beg using magic loop method.
Work in continuous rnds.
1st rnd:  6 sc in ring. 6 sc. PM for beg of rnd.
2nd rnd:  2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 18 sc.
4th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc. Join. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Pupils (make 2)
With smaller hook and H, beg using magic loop method.
1st rnd: 5 sc in ring. Join. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Irises (make 2)
With smaller hook and [E for Santa or F for Elf and Reindeer], beg using magic loop method.
Work in continuous rnds.
1st rnd: 6 sc in ring. 6 sc. PM on last st.
2nd rnd:  2 sc in each st around. 12 sc. Join. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

EARS
Elf Only (make 4):  With smaller hook and B, beg using magic loop method. Work in continuous rnds.
1st rnd:  8 sc in ring. 8 sc. PM for. Beg of rnd.
2nd rnd:  2 sc in each sc around. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
4th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 32 sc.
5th rnd: 1 sc in each sc around. Begin working in rows.
6th row: 1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Turn. 8 sc.
7th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 6 sts.
8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sts. Turn.
9th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 4 sts.
10th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. Turn. 4 sc.
11th row:  Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. Turn. 2 sts.
12th row:  Ch 1. Sc2tog. DO NOT turn. 1 st.
Edging rnd: (RS). Work 40 sc evenly around edge of Ear. Join. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.
Note: Be sure that each of 4 ear pieces have the same number of sts around, as they will be sewn tog later.

Santa Only (make 2): With smaller hook and B, beg using magic loop method.
1st row: 6 hdc in ring. Turn. 6 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in each hdc to end of row. Turn. 12 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1. *1 hdc in next hdc. 2 hdc in next hdc. Rep from * to end of row. 18 hdc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Reindeer Only (make 2): With smaller hook and E, beg using magic loop method. Work in continuous rnds.
1st rnd:  6 sc in ring. 6 sc. PM for beg of rnd.
2nd rnd:  2 sc in each sc around. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 18 sc.
4th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 24 sc.
5th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. 30 sc.
6th to 9th rnds:  1 sc in each sc around.
10th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 24 sts.
11th rnd: 1 sc in each st around.
12th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 18 sts.
13th rnd: 1 sc in each st around. Join. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

HAIR
Santa Only: With larger hook and I, ch 46.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 45 sc.
2nd row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Cluster in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 45 sts - 23 sc and 22 clusters.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row.
This length should fit across 3 sides of cover behind the face.
4th to 13th rows: Rep 2nd and 3rd rows 5 times more. Fasten off, leaving a 36" [91.5 cm] long tail for sewing.

Elf Only: With larger hook and L, ch 45 loosely. This should fit across 3 sides of Cover behind the face.
1st row: Sl st in 2nd ch from hook.
**Short Hair Strand: *Ch 10. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. Sl st in each of next 9 ch. Sl st in next foundation ch. Rep from * 13 times. 14 Short Hair Strands.**
Long Hair Strand: *Ch 14. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. Sl st in each of next 13 ch. Sl st in next foundation ch. Rep from * 15 times. 16 Long Hair Strands. 
Rep from ** to **, working last sl st in the same last ch. Fasten off, leaving a 36" [91.5 cm] long tail for sewing.

MITTENS AND ARMS ( Make 2 )
With smaller hook and [H for Santa or C for Reindeer or D for Elf], beg using magic loop method.
Work in continuous rnds.
1st rnd:  6 sc in ring. 6 sc. PM for beg of rnd.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. 10 sc.
3rd rnd: 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in each of next 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 14 sc.
4th rnd: 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. 2 sc in each of next 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 18 sc.
5th rnd: 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sts. 2 sc in next sc. 22 sc.
6th to 9th rnds:  1 sc in each sc around.
10th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 20 sts.
11th rnd: *1 sc in each of next 8 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 18 sts.
12th rnd: *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. 12 sts. Join. Fasten off.
With I and K held tog, join with sl st to front loop of last sl st.
13th rnd:  Ch 2. Working in front loops only, 1 dc in each st around. Join. Fasten off. 12 dc.
Santa Only: Join A with sl st to back loop of sl st join of 12th rnd.
14th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc. PM for beg of rnd.
Stuff mitten lightly and continue to stuff arm as you go. Work in continuos rnds.
15th to 40th rnds:  1 sc in each sc around. PM for beg of rnd. Join after 40th rnd. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Elf Only: Join A with sl st to back loop of sl st join of 12th rnd.
Stripe Pat
With A – 4 rnds.
With C – 4 rnds.
These 8 rnds form Stripe Pat.
14th rnd:  With A, ch 1. Working in back loops only,  1 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
First rnd of Stripe Pat complete.
Stuff mitten lightly and continue to stuff arm as you go.
15th to 45th rnds:  Cont in Stripe Pat, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Fasten off at end of last rnd, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Reindeer Only: Join E with sl st to back loop of sl st join of 12th rnd.
14th rnd:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join. 12 sc. PM on last st.
Stuff mitten lightly and continue to stuff arm as you go. Work in continuous rnds.
15th to 34th rnds: 1 sc in each st around. 12 sc. Join after 34th rnd. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Santa Only:
Beard
Start with long tail to be used for sewing later. With larger hook and I, ch 18.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 17 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *Cluster in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * across. Turn. 9 sc and 8 clusters.
3rd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 13 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 15 sts.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *Cluster in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * across. Turn.
5th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 11 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 13 sts.
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *Cluster in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * across. Turn.
7th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 9 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 11 sts.
8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *Cluster in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * across. Turn.
9th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 7 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 9 sts.
10th row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first st. *Cluster in next st. 1 sc in next st. Rep from * across. Turn. 9 sts.
11th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Sc2tog. Fasten off leaving long tail for sewing. Weave tail up the side of the Beard so there is a tail at each end of the foundation ch.

MOUSTACHE (make 2)
Start with long tail to use for sewing later. With larger hook and I, ch 8.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 7 sc.
2nd row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *Cluster in next st. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to end of row. Turn. 7 sts.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn. 7 sc.
4th row: Ch 1. Sl st each sc to end of row. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

TONGUE
With smaller hook and J, ch 4.
1st row: 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 2 sc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 6 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc to end of row. 12 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

ROSY CHEEKS (make 2)
With smaller hook and J, beg using magic loop method.
Work in continuous rnds.
1st rnd: 6 sc in ring. PM for beg of rnd.
2nd rnd:  2 sc in each sc around. Join. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Elf Only:
Brows (make 2)
With larger hook and G, ch 6.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of chain. 5 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

FRECKLES (make 6)
With smaller hook and D, beg using magic loop method.
1st rnd: 6 sc in ring. Join. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

MOUTH
With larger hook and H, beg using magic loop method.
Work in continuous rnds.
1st rnd:  6 sc in ring. 6 sc. PM for beg of rnd.
2nd rnd:  2 sc in each sc around. Join. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Reindeer Only:
Main Antlers (make 2)
With smaller hook and F, beg using magic loop method.
Work in continuous rnds.
1st rnd:  8 sc in ring. 8 sc. PM for beg of rnd.
2nd to 16th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Small Antlers (make 4)
With smaller hook and F, beg using magic loop method.
Work in continuous rnds.
1st rnd: 8 sc in ring. 8 sc. PM on last st.
2nd to 6th rnds:  1 sc in each st around. Join. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Bells (make 10)
With smaller hook and G, beg using magic loop method. Work in continuous rnds.
1st rnd: 8 sc in ring. PM on last st.
2nd rnd:  1 sc in each st around. Join. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

Assembly
Sew Hat to top of Cover, just above the Trim.
Stuff the Nose and sew on the back plate. Sew above the tissue slot.
Sew the Iris (or safety eye) to the centre of the Pupil. Sew the Pupil to the White and offset it as shown.
Sewing a little white on the Pupil gives the eyes some reflection and direction.
Santa Only:  Sew the hair just below the Hat Brim. Sew the Beard below the tissue slot. Sew Nose and Moustache above the slot, tacking the Moustache ends to the Beard.
Sew Tongue to bottom edge of slot, offset to the right. Sew Eyes and Rosy Cheeks to face and Ears to sides. Sew Arms to sides below Body Trim.
Elf Only: Sew 2 pieces of the ears tog. Sew Ears to sides so tips point to the back top corner of Head. Sew Hair just below Hat Brim. Sew Nose above tissue slot. Sew Mouth below slot. Sew Eyes, Eyebrows and Freckles to face. Sew Arms to sides below Body Trim.
Reindeer Only: Sew 2 Small Antlers to the Main Antler – one at the end and one at the midpoint. Sew Antlers to front of Cover above the Hat Trim. Sew Arms below bottom row of trim on sides of Cover. Sew Ears hanging downward just below Hat Trim at sides of Cover. Sew Nose above tissue slot. Sew Eyes to face. Sew Bells evenly spaced to C color band around front 3 sides of Cover.
All Versions: Sew the Candy Dish/Pot of Gold to the mittens so it appears to be held.

abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Egg measures 3½" (9 cm) in diameter.
gauge: 11 sts = 4" [10 cm]; 12 rows = 4" [10 cm] in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
EGG COVER
Note: Egg cover is worked in the round without joining. Place marker at beginning of round and move marker up to beginning of next round as work progresses.
Beginning at tip of egg cover and with color of your choice, ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring. Mark beginning of round with st marker. 
Round 1 (Right Side): 4 sc in ring – 4 sc. 
Round 2: 2 sc in each sc around – 8 sc. 
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 4 times – 12 sc.
Round 4: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 4 times – 16 sc.
Round 5: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 4 times – 20 sc.
Round 6: [Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 4 times – 24 sc.
Round 7: [Sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 4 times – 28 sc.
Rounds 8-9: Sc in each sc around. 
Round 10: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 13 sc] twice – 30 sc.
Rounds 11–14: Sc in each sc around. 
Round 15: [Sc2tog, sc in next 13 sc] twice – 28 sc.
Round 16: [Sc2tog, sc in next 5 sc] 4 times – 24 sc.
Insert Styrofoam® Egg: Pull up a large loop (to mark your place) and remove hook. Turn cover inside-out and position wrong side of beginning ch-4 ring at tip of egg. Roll cover down over egg. Insert hook back into large loop. Tighten loop.
Round 17: [Sc2tog, sc in next 4 sc] 4 times – 20 sc.
Round 18: [Sc2tog, sc in next 2 sc] 5 times – 15 sc.
Round 19: [Sc3tog] 5 times – 5 sc. 
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. 
FINISHING
With yarn needle, thread tail through sts of last round and pull to close opening. Weave in all loose ends.

pattern_name: Striped Placemats, Coasters and Napkin Rings
materials: Main color (MC) (Blue) 2 (4) balls for place mats
Contrast A (Green)  2 (3) balls for place mats
Contrast B (Orange) 2 (3) balls for place mats
Contrast C (Pink) 2 (3) balls for place mats
Main color (MC) (Blue) 1 (2) ball(s) for napkin rings and coasters
Contrast A (Green) 1 (1) ball for napkin rings and coasters
Contrast B (Orange) 1 (1) ball for napkin rings and coasters
Contrast C (Pink) 1 (1) ball for napkin rings and coasters
Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: PLACE MAT: Approx 12 x 18 ins [30.5 x 45.5 cm]. COASTER: Approx 5 ins [12.5 cm] diameter.
gauge: 14 sc and 16 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions:
Note: When changing colors, work to last 2 loops on hook of last st, then draw new color through rem 2 loops and proceed. 
Place Mat
With MC, ch 43. 
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each ch across. 41 sts. Join A. Turn.
2nd row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each dc across. Join MC. Turn.
3rd row: With MC, ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each sc across. Join A. Turn.
4th row: As 2nd row. Join B. Turn.
5th row: With B, as 3rd row. Join C. Turn.
6th row: With C, as 2nd row. Join B. Turn.
7th row: As 5th row.
8th row: With C, as 2nd row. Join A. Turn.
9th row: With A, as 3rd row. Join MC. Turn.
10th row: With MC, as 2nd row. Join A. Turn.
11th row: As 9th row.
12th row: With MC, as 2nd row. Join C. Turn.
13th row: With C, as 3rd row. Join B. Turn.
14th row: With B, as 2nd row. Join C. Turn.
15th row: As 13th row.
16th row: With B, as 2nd row. Join MC. Turn.
17th row: With MC, as 3rd row. Join A. Turn.
Rep 2nd to 17th rows for Stripe Pat until work from beg measures approx 18 ins [45.5 cm] ending on a 4th or 8th row of pat. Fasten off.
Edging: 1st rnd: With RS facing, join MC with sl st to any corner of Mat and work 1 row of sc evenly around outer edge, working 3 sc in corners. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right, instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
NAPKIN RING
With A, ch 21.
1st row: (WS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch across. 20 sts. Join MC. Turn.
2nd row: With MC, ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in each sc across. Join A. Turn.
3rd row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each dc across. Join MC. Turn.
4th row: As 2nd row.
5th row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each dc across. 
Fasten off. 
Sew sides tog to form ring.
COASTER
With B, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc. Fasten off.
FLOWER
First Petal: 1st row: Join MC with sl st to front loop only of any sc. *Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as sl st. 2 sc in front loop only of next sc. 4 sc for petal. Turn.
Next 3 rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc of petal. Turn.
Next row: Ch 1. [Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops – sc2tog made] twice. Fasten off, leaving a long end.*
Second Petal: **Rejoin MC with sl st to front loop of next unworked sc of 2nd rnd. Rep from * to * once.**
Third to Sixth Petals: Rep from ** to ** 4 times more.
6 petals.
3rd rnd: Join A with sl st to rem back loop of any sc of 2nd rnd. Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as sl st. 2 dc in each rem back loop around. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 24 dc.
4th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. *1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last dc. 1 dc in last dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 36 dc.
5th rnd: Ch 3. 1 dc in next dc. *2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in next dc. Rep from * to last 4 dc. 2 dc in next dc. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. 2 dc in last dc. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 50 dc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. Working from left to right instead of from right to left as usual, work 1 reverse sc in each dc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Using yarn ends from each petal, sew around outer edges of petals.

materials: three 6" x 9" (15 x 23 cm) white adhesive back foam sheets
Susan Bates® Easy Wrap Pompon Maker or 2½" (6.5 cm) piece of cardboard
felt pieces in assorted bright colors
12" lengths of dowel measuring 3/16" (4.76 mm) diameter
abbreviations: sc2tog = [Insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and pull up a loop] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
measurements: Skull measures: 4" wide x 5¼" long (10 x 13.5 cm).
gauge: 12 sts = 4" (10 cm); 15 rows = 4" (10 cm) in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SKULL
Top
With A, ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, 6 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st around; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in next st, *2 sc in next st, sc in next st; repeat from * 4 times; join with slip st in first sc—18 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in first st, *2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts; repeat from * 4 times, 2 sc in next st, sc in last st; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, 2 sc in first st, sc in next 3 sts, *2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts; repeat from * 4 times; join with slip st in first sc—30 sc.
Round 6: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sts, *2 sc in next st, sc in next 4 sts; repeat from * 4 times, 2 sc in next st, sc in last 2 sts; join with slip st in first sc—36 sc. Do not fasten off. Continue in turned rows.
Bottom
Row 1 (right side): Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in next 6 sts, sc2tog; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—8 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in each st across, turn. 
Row 3: Ch 1, sc2tog, sc in next 4 sts, sc2tog, turn—6 sc.
Rows 4 and 5: Repeat Row 2. 
Do not fasten off. Continue in rounds. 
Border
Round 1: Ch 1, working in ends of rows, sc in each row across first edge of bottom; working in unworked sts of Round 6, sc in next st, *2 sc in next st, sc in next 5 sts; repeat from * 3 times, 2 sc in next st; working in ends of rows, sc in each row across other edge of bottom, ch 1, sc in each st of Row 5, ch 1; join with slip st in first sc—47 sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING 
Print template shown below. For each skull, cut forehead flower, nose, and 2 eyes from felt pieces, changing color pattern for each skull. Apply a small amount of glue on center back of each piece. Referring to photo as a guide, position pieces on skull and, with B and straight stitches, sew each piece in place. With B, embroider straight stitch teeth.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® Ombres™ (2 oz/56.7 g; 95 yds/86 m) Contrast A Rickrack Ombre (02751) 1 ball or 90 yds/82 m
OR Contrast A Terra Firma Ombre (02013) 1 ball or 90 yds/82 m
Lily® Sugar’n Cream® Solids™ (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m) Contrast B Ecru (00004) 1 ball or 4 yds/3.5 m
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Optional: Purchased pair of sheer stockings to enclose stuffing.
abbreviations: Scbl = Single crochet in back loop only
measurements: Approx 4" [10 cm] tall x 5" [12.5 cm] in diameter.
gauge: 15 sc and 17 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
SIDE MOTIF (Make 4)
See diagram on page 2.
With Contrast A, ch 4. Join with sl st to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 2 dc in ring. Ch 2. (3 dc in ring. Ch 2) 3 times more. Join with sl st to top of beg ch 3.
2nd rnd: Sl st in each of next 2 dc and ch-2 sp. Ch 6 (counts as 1 tr. Ch 2). 3 tr in same ch-2 sp. *Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (3 tr. Ch 2. 3 tr) in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 2. 3 dc) in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. 2 tr in next (beg) ch-2 sp. Join to 4th ch of beg ch 6.
3rd rnd: Sl st in ch-2 sp. Ch 6 (counts as tr. Ch 2). 3 tr in same ch-2 sp. *Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. 3 hdc in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1.** (3 tr. Ch 2. 3 tr) in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * to ** once. 2 tr in next ch-2 sp. Join with sl st to 4th ch of beg ch 6. Fasten off.

4th rnd: Join B with sl st in ch-2 sp (top of Motif). Ch 4 (counts as dc. Ch 1). 2 dc in ch-2 sp. Work 19 sc down left side (1 sc in each st and ch-1 sp to next ch-2 sp). (2 dc. Ch 1. 2 dc) in next ch-2 sp (bottom of Motif). Work 19 sc up right side (1 sc in each st and sp) to beg ch-2 sp. 1 dc in ch-2 sp. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of beg ch 4. Sl st in ch-1 sp. Fasten off, leaving a length of yarn approx 40" [101.5 cm] long for joining during finishing.

FINISHING
Join Motifs
With WS of 2 Motifs held tog, join tail of Motif on left with sl st through both ch-1 sps at top of Motifs. Working through both thicknesses, sl st in back loops only of each of next 23 sts, working last sl st in bottom ch-1 sp to join Motifs. Fasten off.
Rep for rem Motifs, leaving last side edge open for stuffing.
Optional: To keep shape, and prevent stuffing from poking through, use a pair of sheer stockings as a casing by stuffing stocking to fit inside Pumpkin, cutting to size and securing with a knot.
Join rem side edge as before, working last sl st through all ch-1 sps of 4 Motifs to close up bottom. Fasten off.

STEM
With B, ch 10.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 9 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 scbl in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last row 5 times more. Do not fasten off.
Fold piece to align foundation ch with last row worked.
Ch 1. Working through both thicknesses, join with sl st through back loop of last row and rem loop of foundation ch. Fasten off, leaving a long end.
Thread end through top end of Stem and secure tightly to close.
Sew Stem to Pumpkin at center top.

pattern_name: Aunt Lydia’s Halloween Tree of Spookiness
materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 1 ball 210 Antique White A
Susan Bates® Steel Crochet Hook: 1.5 mm [US 7]
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C
( ) = work all directions in parentheses in the indicated stitch or space
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Ghost ball measures 3.5” (9 cm) in diameter; Floaty Ghost measures 4” (10 cm) wide x 6” (15 cm) long; Double Ball Ghost measures 3” (7.5 cm) wide by 5” (12.5 cm) long; Big Jack-o-Lantern measures 3” (7.5 cm) in diameter; Medium Jack-o-lantern measures 2.5” (6.5 cm) in diameter; Small Jack-o-Lantern measures 2” (5 cm) in diameter.
gauge: Gauge is not critical for these projects.
instructions:
GHOST BALL
With A, ch 41.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in second ch from hook, sc in next 4 ch, dc in next 20 ch, sc in last 15 ch; turn—40 sts.
Row 2: Working in back loops only, ch 1, sc in same beginning sc, sc in next 14 sc, dc in next 20 dc, sc in last 5 sc; turn—40 sts.
Row 3: Working in back loops only, ch 1, sc in same beginning sc, sc in next 4 sc, dc in next 20 dc, sc in last 15 sc; turn—40 sts.
Rows 4-30: Repeat Rows 2-3 13 times, then Row 2 once.
Row 31: Work a row of sc joining Row 30 to Row 1 as follows: Holding the two rows together with Right Side facing, ch 1, insert hook under the first loop of the opposite side of the foundation ch and under the front loop of the first sc of Row 30, draw up a loop, complete sc; continue in this fashion, working a sc over each set of two stitches across—40 sc.
Ghost Eyes (Make 2)
With B, make a Magic Loop. Ch 3 (counts as first dc), 16 dc in ring; slip st in top of ch-3 to join; fasten off—17 dc.
Finishing
Using needle, sew one of the end of the ornament closed. Fill the ornament with polyester fiberfill, then sew the other end closed. Join A to the middle of the ornament at the top; ch 20, slip st in first ch to form a loop. Referring to photograph for placement, sew the Loop to the top of the Ghost Ball; place the buttons on the Eyes and sew the Eyes to the Ghost Ball; sew the Mouth to the Ghost Ball, not too close to the Eyes. Fasten off and weave in all ends.
Special Technique
Adjustable ring: Wrap yarn into a ring, ensuring that the tail falls behind the working yarn. Grip ring and tail firmly between middle finger and thumb. Insert hook through center of ring, yarn over (with working yarn) and draw up a loop. Work stitches of the first round in the ring. After the first round of stitches is worked, pull gently, but firmly, on the tail to tighten the ring.

FLOATY GHOST
With A, ch 51.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in second ch from hook, sc in next 4 ch, dc in next 15 ch, sc in next 5 ch, dc in last 25 ch; turn—50 sts.
Row 2: Working in back loops only, ch 3 (counts as first dc), dc in next 24 dc, sc in next 5 sc, dc in next 15 dc, sc in last 5 sc; turn—50 sts.
Row 3: Working in back loops only, ch 1, sc in same beginning sc, sc in next 4 sc, dc in next 15 dc, sc in next 5 sc, dc in last 25 dc; turn—50 sts.
Rows 4-30: Repeat Rows 2-3 13 times, then Row 2 once.
Row 31: Work a row of sc joining Row 30 to Row 1 as follows: Holding the two rows together with Right Side facing, ch 1, insert hook under the first loop of the opposite side of the foundation ch and under the front loop of the first sc of Row 30, draw up a loop, complete sc; continue in this fashion, working a sc over each set of two stitches across—50 sc.
Ghost Eyes and Ghost Mouth
Make same as for Ghost Ball.
Finishing
Using needle, sew one of the end of the ornament closed. Fill the ornament with polyester fiberfill, then sew the other end closed. Join A to the middle of the ornament at the top; ch 20, slip st in first ch to form a loop. Referring to photograph for placement, sew the Loop to the top of the Floaty Ghost; place the buttons on the Eyes and sew the Eyes to the Floaty Ghost; sew the Mouth to the Floaty Ghost, not too close to the Eyes. Fasten off and weave in all ends.

DOUBLE BALL GHOST
With A, ch 46.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in second ch from hook, sc in next 4 ch, dc in next 10 ch, sc in next 5 ch, dc in next 20 ch, sc in last 5 ch; turn—45 sts.
Row 2: Working in back loops only, ch 1, sc in same beginning sc, sc in next 4 sc, dc in next 20 dc, sc in next 5 sc, dc in next 10 dc, sc in last 5 sc; turn—45 sts.
Row 3: Working in back loops only, ch 1, sc in same beginning sc, sc in next 4 sc, dc in next 10 dc, sc in next 5 sc, dc in next 20 dc, sc in last sc; turn—45 sts.
Rows 4-28: Repeat Rows 2-3 12 times, then Row 2 once.
Row 29: Work a row of sc joining Row 28 to Row 1 as follows: Holding the two rows together with Right Side facing, ch 1, insert hook under the first loop of the opposite side of the foundation ch and under the front loop of the first sc of Row 28, draw up a loop, complete sc; continue in this fashion, working a sc over each set of two stitches across—45 sc.
Ghost Eyes and Ghost Mouth
Make same as for Ghost Ball.
Finishing
Using needle, sew one of the end of the ornament closed. Fill the ornament with polyester fiberfill, then sew the other end closed. Join A to the middle of the ornament at the top; ch 20, slip st in first ch to form a loop. Referring to photograph for placement, sew the Loop to the top of the Double Ball Ghost; place the buttons on the Eyes and sew the Eyes to the Double Ball Ghost; sew the Mouth to the Double Ball Ghost, not too close to the Eyes. Fasten off and weave in all ends.

BIG JACK O’ LANTERN
With C, ch 31.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in second ch from hook, sc in next 4 ch, dc in next 20 ch, sc in last 5 ch; turn—30 sts.
Row 2: Working in back loops only, ch 1, sc in same beginning sc, sc in next 4 sc, dc in next 20 dc, sc in last 5 sc; turn—30 sts.
Rows 3-40: Repeat Row 2.
Row 41: Work a row of sc joining Row 40 to Row 1 as follows: Holding the two rows together with Right Side facing, ch 1, insert hook under the first loop of the opposite side of the foundation ch and under the front loop of the first sc of Row 40, draw up a loop, complete sc; continue in this fashion, working a sc over each set of two stitches across—30 sc.

MEDIUM JACK O’ LANTERN
With C, ch 26.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in second ch from hook, sc in next 4 ch, dc in next 15 ch, sc in last 5 ch; turn—25 sts.
Row 2: Working in back loops only, ch 1, sc in same beginning sc, sc in next 4 sc, dc in next 15 dc, sc in last 5 sc; turn—25 sts.
Rows 3-36: Repeat Row 2.
Row 37: Work a row of sc joining Row 36 to Row 1 as follows: Holding the two rows together with Right Side facing, ch 1, insert hook under the first loop of the opposite side of the foundation ch and under the front loop of the first sc of Row 36, draw up a loop, complete sc; continue in this fashion, working a sc over each set of two stitches across—25 sc.

SMALL JACK O’ LANTERN
With C, ch 21.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in second ch from hook, sc in next 4 ch, dc in next 10 ch, sc in last 5 ch; turn—20 sts.
Row 2: Working in back loops only, ch 1, sc in same beginning sc, sc in next 4 sc, dc in next 10 dc, sc in last 5 sc; turn—20 sts.
Rows 3-30: Repeat Row 2.
Row 31: Work a row of sc joining Row 30 to Row 1 as follows: Holding the two rows together with Right Side facing, ch 1, insert hook under the first loop of the opposite side of the foundation ch and under the front loop of the first sc of Row 30, draw up a loop, complete sc; continue in this fashion, working a sc over each set of two stitches across—20 sc.

FOR ALL SIZES
Jack-o-Lantern Topper
With B, ch 6, join with slip st in first ch to form ring.
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as first dc), 11 dc in ring; slip st in top of ch-3 to join—12 dc.
Round 2: Ch 1, (sc, ch 3, sc) in same beginning dc, [sc in next dc, (sc, ch 3, sc) in next dc] 5 times, sc in last dc; join with slip st in top of first sc—18 sc, 6 ch-3 loops.
Join B to the middle of the Topper; ch 20, slip st in first ch to form a loop. Sew Topper to the top of the Pumpkin; fasten off.
Finishing
Using needle, sew one of the end of the ornament closed. Fill the ornament with polyester fiberfill, then sew the other end closed. Sew the Pumpkin Topper to the ornament and weave in all ends. Referring to photograph for placement, embroider the Eyes, Nose, and Mouth to make the Jack O’ Lantern.

materials: Caron® One Pound™ (16 oz/453.6 g; 812 yds/742 m)
Size U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Small amount of black worsted weight yarn for eyes.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = draw up a loop in each of next 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Approx 20" [51 cm] square, excluding Arms, Legs and Leaves.
gauge: 12 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
BODY
With A, ch 132. Join with sl st to first ch, being careful not to twist ch. See diagram on page 3.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. 132 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. Skip next 2 sc. 5 dc in next sc. *Skip next 2 sc. 1 sc in next sc. Skip next 2 sc. 5 dc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. Skip last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. 5 dc in first sc. 1 sc in 3rd dc of next shell. *5 dc in next sc. 1 sc in 3rd dc of next shell. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first dc.
4th rnd: Sl st in each of next 2 dc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same st as last sl st (3rd dc of 5-dc shell). 5 dc in next sc. *1 sc in 3rd dc of next shell. 5 dc in next shell. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc.

Rep 3rd and 4th rnds for pat until piece from beg measures 20" [51 cm]. Fasten off, leaving a long end.
Sew bottom edge of piece tog. Insert Pillow form. Using long end, sew top edge.
Using length of A, run yarn through sts of top edge and cinch to create top of Pineapple. Fasten tightly to secure.

LEAVES
Large Leaf (make 2)
**With C, ch 11.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 10 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.**
Rep last row until piece measures 6" [15 cm], ending on a RS row.
***Shape top: 1st row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 8 sts.
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 4 rows twice more. 4 sts.
Next row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. Turn. 2 sts.
Next row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Fasten off.
With RS facing, join C with sl st to bottom right corner of Leaf. Ch 1. Work sc evenly up side edge of Leaf to top. Work (1 sc. 1 dc. 1 sc) in st at top. Work sc evenly down opposite side edge of Leaf. Fasten off.***

Small Leaf (make 2)
Work from ** to ** as given for Large Leaf.
Rep last row until piece measures 4" [10 cm], ending on a RS row.
Work from *** to *** as given for Large Leaf.
Overlap Leaves as shown in photo, with Large Leaves behind and Small Leaves in front. Use C to tack Leaves tog to secure.
Sew group of Leaves to center top of Pineapple.

Note: Join all rnds of Legs, Arms, Glasses with sl st to first st.

LEGS (make 2)
Foot
Beg at Front of Foot, with B, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
5th to 14th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Beg working in rows to form Foot.
1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 20 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd to 9th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
10th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. (Sc2tog) 4 times. 1 sc in each of last 6 sc. 16 sts. Fasten off, leaving a long end.
Join back of Foot: Fold piece in half. Using long end, sew back Foot seam.

Leg
1st rnd: (RS). Join B with sl st at center back of Foot. Ch 1. Work 8 sc evenly along left top edge of Foot. Work 1 sc in each of the next 10 unworked sc (14th rnd of Foot). Work 8 sc evenly along right top edge of Foot. Join. 26 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Rep last rnd until Leg, from bottom of foot, measures a total of 6" [15 cm]. Fasten off at end of last rnd leaving a long tail for seaming and attaching to Body.
Stuff Foot. Stuff Leg. Sew top edge of Leg closed. Sew Legs to Pineapple along bottom edge of Pillow, approx 4" [10 cm] in from either side edge.

ARMS (make 2)
Thumb: With B, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join.
2nd and 3rd rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. Fasten off at end of 3rd rnd. Sew bottom of thumb closed.

Hand: With B, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 20 sc.
4th to 9th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
10th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog. Rep from * around. Join. 15 sc.
11th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
Rep last rnd until Arm measures 7" [18 cm]. Fasten off at end of last rnd leaving a long tail for seaming and attaching to Body.
Sew Thumb to Hand at 9th rnd of Hand.

GLASSES
Flower Frames (make 2)
With C, ch 36. Join with sl st to first ch, being careful not to twist ch. 
1st rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as hdc). 2 hdc in first ch. *1 hdc in each of next 2 ch. 2 hdc in next ch. Rep from * to last 2 ch. 1 hdc in each of last 2 ch. Join. 48 hdc.
2nd rnd: Skip first 2 hdc. *6 dc in next hdc. Skip next 2 hdc. Sl st in next hdc. Skip next 2 hdc. Rep from * around. Join. Fasten off.

Bridge
With C, ch 4.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. Turn. 3 sc.
2nd to 4th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Fasten off.

Right Arm
With C, ch 17.
1st row: (RS). 3 dc in 4th ch from hook. 3 dc in next ch. 1 dc in each ch to end of ch. Fasten off.

Left Arm
With C, ch 17.
1st row: 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each of next 10 dc. 3 dc in each of next 2 ch. 1 dc in last ch. Fasten off.
Connect Frames by sewing Bridge to either Frame in center. Sew Right and Left Arms to either side of Frames, aligned with Bridge.
Position Glasses on Body, with Arms of Glasses just above Pineapple Arms. Using C, sew into place, being sure not to pull too tightly so they lay flat. 

EYES (make 2)
With black worsted weight yarn, ch 4. 7 dc in 4th ch from hook. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of first dc. Fasten off. 
Sew Eyes to Body, positioning in center of each Frame.

MOUTH
With B, ch 17.
1st row: 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (counts as 2 dc). 1 dc in each ch to end of ch. Fasten off, leaving a long end.
Using long end, attach Mouth to Body, giving it a slight curve, and aligning it with Bridge of Glasses.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 1 ball 001 White
The Anchor Hocking Co™, 1½” (3.8 cm) ribbon
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
v-st = (tr, ch 3, tr) all in st or ch specified.
cl group (cluster group) = (5 tr, ch 3, dtr, ch 3, 5 tr) all in specified st.
cl (cluster) = * [yo] twice, draw up a loop in next tr, [yo and draw through 2 loops] twice; repeat from * 4 more times; yo and draw through all 6 loops on hook.
picot = ch 6, slip st in 5th ch from hook.
measurements: Doily measures 16” (40.6 cm) in diameter.
gauge: Rounds 1-7 = 4½” across. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions: Ch 8; join with a slip st in first ch to form a ring. Round 1: Ch 3, 23 dc in ring; join with a slip st to top of ch-3 – 24 sts. Round 2: Ch 1, sc in joining, [ch 5, skip next 2 dc, sc in next dc] 7 times; ch 2, dc in first sc to join and form last loop. Round 3: Ch 1, sc over dc, [ch 7, sc in next ch-5 loop] 7 times; ch 3, tr in first sc to join and form last loop. Round 4: Ch 3, 2 dc in joining tr, [ch 3, 5 dc in 4th ch of next ch-7 loop] 7 times; ch 3, 2 dc in joining tr; join with a slip st to top of ch-3. Round 5: Ch 1, sc in joining, * ch 5, sc in ch-3 space **, ch 5, skip next 2 dc, sc in next dc; repeat from * around, end at **; ch 2, dc in first sc to join and form last loop. Round 6: Ch 1, sc over dc, [ch 7, sc in next ch-5 loop] 15 times; ch 3, tr in first sc to join and form last loop. Round 7: Ch 7, tr in joining tr, * ch 5, tr in 4th ch of next ch-7 loop, ch 5 **, v-st in 4th ch of next ch-7 loop; repeat from * around, end at **; end round. Round 8: Start round, * ch 4, skip next tr, cl group in next tr, ch 4 **, v-st over v-st; repeat from * around, end at **; end round. Rounds 9 and 10: Start round, * ch 4, cl, ch 3, cl group in dtr, ch 3, cl, ch 4 **, v-st over v-st; repeat from * around, end at **; end round. Round 11: Start round, * ch 5, cl, ch 3, cl group in dtr, ch 3, cl, ch 5 **, v-st over v-st; repeat from * around, end at **; end round. Round 12: Start round, * (ch 3, tr) all in same ch-space, ch 5, cl, ch 3, cl group in dtr, ch 3, cl, ch 5 **, v-st over v-st; repeat from * around, end at **; end round. Round 13: Start round, * ch 3, v-st in next ch-3 space, ch 5, cl, ch 3, (5 tr, ch 2, tr, ch 2, 5 tr) all in dtr, ch 3, cl, ch 5 **, v-st in next ch-3 space; repeat from * around, end at **; end round. Round 14: Start round, * (ch 3, v-st] twice) all in next ch-3 space, ch 3, v-st over v-st, ch 6, cl, ch 3, 5 tr in tr, ch 3, cl, ch 6 **, v-st over v-st; repeat from * around, end at **; end round. Round 15: Start round, * [ch 3, v-st over v-st] 3 times, ch 7, sc in next tr, ch 4, work cl over 5 tr including same tr as sc was made, ch 4, sc in same tr as last leg of cl, ch 7 **, v-st over v-st; repeat from * around, end at **; end round. Round 16: Start round, * [v-st in next ch-3 space] 6 times, ch 7, sc in top of cl, ch 7 **, v-st over v-st; repeat from * around, end at **; end round. Round 17: Slip st in next ch, slip st in ch-space, ch 11, slip st in 5th ch from hook, ch 2, dtr in same ch-space, * [dtr in next ch-3 space, picot, ch 2, dtr in same ch-space] 6 times, ch 6, sc in sc, ch 6 **, (dtr, picot, ch 2, dtr) all in next ch-3 space; repeat from * around, end at **; slip st in 5th ch of ch-11. Fasten off. Weave in ends. Finishing: With the ribbon, run in and out of every other stitch of the Doily until you have made it all the way around. Lay the doily flat and place the vase in the center. Evenly wrap the Doily around the vase and tie ribbon in a bow to hold it in place.

materials: Aunt Lydia’s “Fashion Crochet Thread”: 1 ball each of 0032 Candy Pink A, 0325 Tangerine B, 0264 Lime C, 0036 Lilac D, 0423 Maize E and 0365 Coffee F.
Polyester Fiberfill, round paper clip for each card holder, yarn needle.
abbreviations: sc2tog: [Insert hook next st, yo, draw yarn through st] twice, yo, draw yarn through 3 loops on hook.
sc3tog: [Insert hook next st, yo, draw yarn through st] 3 times, yo, draw yarn through 4 loops on hook.
measurements: Bird Appliqué Measures 4” (from tip of beak to tail) x 3½” tall. Bird Place Card Holder Measures 4” (from tip of beak to tail) x 2” tall.
gauge: 7 sts and 6 rows sc = 1”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
NOTE: Instructions are for two sets as shown in photograph.

BIRD APPLIQUÉ 
Body (make 1 each with A and D)
Ch 6.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across, turn – 5 sc. 
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn – 8 sc.
Rows 3-5: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each sc across to last sc, 2 sc in last sc, turn – 14 sc.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc in each sc across to last sc, 2 sc in last sc, ch 1 turn – 15 sc.
Row 7: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each sc across, turn – 16 sc.
Rows 8- 9: Repeat rows 6-7 – 18 sc at end of last row.
Row 10: Ch 1, sc2tog in first 2 sc, sc in each sc across, turn – 17 sc. Do not fasten off.

Head
Row 11: Ch 1, sc in first 4 sc, sc2tog in next 2 sc, turn, leaving remaining sts unworked – 5 sc.
Row 12: Ch 1, sc2tog in first 2 sc, sc in next sc, sc2tog in next 2 sc, turn – 3 sc.
Row 13: Ch 1, sc3tog in next 3 sts, turn.

Tail
Row 14: Working across side edge of head, slip st in each of next 3 row-end sts, working across top of row 10, sc in each of next 9 sc, 2 sc in each of last 2 sc, turn – 13 sc.
Row 15: Ch 1, 2 sc in each of next 3 sc, turn – 6 sc.
Row 16: Ch 2 (does not count as a st), hdc in first 2 sc, sl st in each of next 2 sc, hdc in each of last 2 sc, turn – 6 sts. 

Edging
Round 1: Ch 1, 3 sc in first hdc, sc in next hdc, slip st in each of next 2 slip sts, sc in each of next 2 hdc, 3 sc in top of ch-2, sc evenly around remainder of bird, working sc in each st, and sc in each row-end st; join. Fasten off leaving a sewing length.

Beak (make 1 each with B and E)  
Ch 5.
Row 1: Slip st in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch, hdc in next ch, dc in last ch. Fasten off leaving a sewing length.

Wing (make 1 each with B and C) 
Ch 4.
Row 1: 5 dc in 4th ch from hook, turn – 6 dc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each dc across, turn – 12 sc.
Row 3: Ch 2 (counts as dc), 2 dc in first sc, *dc in next sc, 2 dc in next sc; repeat from * 5 times, dc in last sc – 18 dc.

Fasten off leaving a sewing length. 

Foot (make 1 each with B and E) 
Ch 12, sl st in 2nd ch from hook and next 3 ch, [ch 5, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and next 3 ch] twice, slip st in remaining 7 ch of beg ch-12. Fasten off leaving a sewing length.

FINISHING
Embroider French knot eye with F. Sew C wing and B beak and foot to A body. Sew B wing and E beak and foot to D body. Sew each appliqué to napkin or placemat.

BIRD PLACE CARD HOLDER
Head and Body (make 1 each with A and D)
Ch 2. Do not join rounds, Work in a spiral, marking first st of each round, moving marker up as work progresses.
Round 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Round 2: 2 sc in each sc around – 12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times – 18 sc.
Rounds 4-6: Sc in each sc around.
Round 7: [sc2tog in next 2 sc] 6 times, 2 sc in each of next 6 sc – 18 sc.
Round 8: Sc in next sc, 2 sc in each of next 4 sc, sc in remaining 13 sc – 22 sc.
Round 9: Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in each of next 2 sc, sc in last 17 sc – 24 sc.
Rounds 10-12: Sc in each sc around.
Round 13: Sc in next 4 sc, ch 4, skip next 4 sc, sc in last 16 sc.
Round 14: Sc in each sc and ch around – 24 sc.
Round 15: Sc in each sc around.
Round 16: Sc in next 12 sc, [sc2tog in next 2 sc] 6 times – 18 sc.
Round 17: Sc in each sc around.
Round 18: [Sc2tog in next 2 sc] twice, sc in next 6 sc, [sc2tog in next 2 sc] 4 times – 12 sc. Stuff head and body with polyester fiberfill.
Round 19: [Sc2tog in next 2 sc] 6 times – 6 sc. Fasten off, weave yarn length through sts in last row, gather and secure. Slip bottom of paper clip into opening on back and sew opening closed around clip. Embroider French knot eyes with F.

Wing (make 2 each with B and C) 
Ch 2. Do not join rounds, Work in a spiral, marking first st of each round, moving marker up as work progresses.
Round 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Round 2: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times – 9 sc.
Round 3: Sc in each sc around.
Round 4: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times – 12 sc.
Rounds 5-6: Sc in each sc around. Fasten off, leaving a sewing length. Do not stuff, flatten Round 6 and sew into side of body as pictured.

Tail (make 1 each with A and D)
Ch 9. Do not join rounds, Work in a spiral, marking first st of each round, moving marker up as work progresses.
Round 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 6 ch, 3 sc in last ch, working across opposite side of foundation ch sc in next 6 ch, 2 sc in last ch – 18 sc.
Round 2: Sc in each sc around.
Round 3: (Sc in next sc, dec over next 2 sc) around. (12 sc).
Rounds 4-7: Sc in each sc around. Fasten off, leaving a sewing length.  Stuff lightly. Shape tail by sewing in center of tail down 3 rounds and pulling tightly. Sew in place on body as pictured.

Beak (make 1 each with B and E)  
Ch 4.
Row 1: Slip st in 2nd ch from hook, sc next ch, hdc last ch, turn.
Row 2: Ch 1, hdc in first hdc, sc in next sc, slip st in next slip st, turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, slip st in first slip st, sc in next sc, hdc in next hdc. Fasten off, leaving a sewing length. Fold beak in half lengthwise and sew bottom seam. Sew in place,

Foot (make 2 each with B and E)  
[Ch 5, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across] 3 times Fasten off, leaving a sewing length. Gather together at heel and sew in place as pictured.

AUNT LYDIA’S® “Fashion Crochet Thread”, Size 3, Art. 182 available in solid color 150 yd (137 m) and metallic 100 yd (91 m) balls.

materials: RED HEART® With Love®: 1 skein each 1308 Tan A, 1401 Pewter B, and 1502 Iced Aqua C
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Hanger measures 17” wide by 9¼” long (43 x 23.5 cm).
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
HANGER (make 1 in each color)
Work as many covering sc as needed around diagonal and horizontals bars, pushing stitches together to ensure complete coverage; join with slip st in first stitch. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
APPLIQUES
Star (make 2)
With A, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, 6 sc in ring—6 sc. Work in continuous rounds. Place marker on first stitch and move up as each round is completed. Pull gently, but firmly, on tail to tighten ring.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: *Work 2 sc in next 2 sc, sc in next sc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc—20 sc.
Continue in rows for each point.
Row 1: Ch 1, hdc in first 3 sc, slip st in next sc, turn—3 hdc.
Row 2: Ch 2, skip slip st, hdc in first 2 hdc, slip st in last hdc, turn—3 hdc.
Row 3: Ch 2, skip slip st, dc2tog (point made), ch 1; working across ends of rows, 2 slip st in first row, slip st in next 2 rows, slip st in last sc work of Round 3¬—1 point.
Repeat Rows 1–3 four times; join with slip st in beginning ch of Row 1. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing on one star.
Heart (make 2)
With B, ch 2.
Row 1 (right side): Work 2 hdc in 2nd ch from hook, turn—2 hdc.
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 hdc in each hdc, turn—4 hdc.
Rows 3–5: Ch 1, 2 hdc in first hdc, hdc in each st across to last hdc, 2 hdc in last hdc, turn—10 hdc.
First Arch
Row 6: Ch 1, hdc in first 4 hdc, slip st in next hdc; leave remaining sts unworked, turn—4 hdc.
Row 7: Ch 2, skip slip st, hdc in first 3 hdc, slip st in last hdc, turn—3 hdc.
Row 8: Ch 2, skip slip st, hdc in first 2 hdc, slip st in last hdc; holding piece with ends of rows facing, slip st in end of first 2 rows—2 hdc.
Second Arch
Row 6: Working in end of Row 6 of first arch, slip st in last hdc, ch 1, working in unworked sts, hdc in next 5 hdc, turn—5 hdc.
Row 7: Ch 1, hdc in first 4 hdc, slip st in last hdc, turn—4 hdc.
Row 8: Ch 2, skip slip st, hdc in first 2 hdc, slip st in next hdc, leave last hdc unworked, do not turn—2 hdc.
Edging
Round 1: Ch 1, working in ends of rows, sc 11 sts evenly down first side; work 3 sc in opposite side of foundation ch, sc 11 sts evenly up other side, 2 sc in next 2 hdc of first arch; sc in end of next 3 rows, slip st in center slip st (between arches); sc in end of next 3 rows up second arch, 2 sc in next 2 hdc; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing on one heart.
Flower (make 2)
With C, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Work in continuous rounds. Place marker on first stitch and move up as each round is completed. Pull gently, but firmly, on tail to tighten ring.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, *sc in next sc, ch 5, working in back bumps only, dc in 3rd ch from hook, dc in next ch, hdc in next ch, sc in next sc (petal made); repeat from * 5 times—6 petals.
Round 4: *Working in opposite side of ch, slip st in first ch, sc in next 2 ch, 2 sc in next ch, 2 sc in ch-2 space (at top of petal), 2 sc in first dc, sc in next dc, slip st in next hdc, slip st in next sc, skip next sc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first slip st. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing on one flower.
FINISHING
Pair each applique and hanger as follows: heart on A-colored hanger, flower on B-colored hanger, and star on C-colored hanger.
With wrong sides held together and working through both sets of loops, begin whipstitching pairs of appliques together but do not complete. Using photograph as a guide, center each applique over base of hanger hook, positioning over first and last stitches on bars. Continue whipstitching around, threading yarn as needed through wrong side of stitches to close gaps around bars and hook. Secure ends. Repeat for each hanger.
Weave in ends.

materials: Bernat® Felted™ (9.2 oz/260 g; 249 yds/228 m)
Contrast A Ecru Fleck (80012) 1 ball or 55 yds/50 m
Contrast B Buff (80006) 1 ball or 88 yds/80 m
Contrast C Sienna Fleck (80015) 1 ball or 45 yds/40 m
Contrast D Amber Fleck (80021) 1 ball or 132 yds/120 m
Contrast E Lake (80010) 1 ball or 77 yds/70 m
Contrast F Cabernet (80007) 1 ball or 22 yds/20 m
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Dtr = (Double treble crochet). (Yoh) 3 times. Insert hook in next stitch and pull up a loop. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 4 times
Hdcbl = Half double crochet through back loop
Puff St = (Yoh and draw up a loop) 3 times in next hdc. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook. Ch 1 to close stitch
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
Scbl = Single crochet through back loop only
measurements: Beet: Approx 3½" [9 cm] diameter; 4½" [16.5 cm] root long excluding leaves; 8" [20.5 cm] long leaves. Small Pumpkin : Approx 5" [12.5 cm] diameter; 3" [7.5 cm] tall excluding stem. Large Pumpkin : Approx 6½" [16.5 cm] diameter; 3½" [9 cm] tall excluding stem. Small Butternut Squash: Approx 2½" [6 cm] diameter; 5" [12.5 cm] long excluding stem. Large Butternut Squash: Approx 3" [7.5 cm] diameter; 6½" [16.5 cm] long excluding stem.
gauge: 8 sc and 9 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
BEET
Note: Join all rnds with sl st in first sc. 
With C, ch 2.
See diagram on page 4.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 6 sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st.*1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. 18 sc. Join F with sl st to first sc. Break C.
4th rnd: With F, ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join. 24 sc. 
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 
6th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 3 sc. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Join. 30 sc.
7th and 8th rnds: As 5th rnd. 
9th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * 4 times more. Join. 25 sc. 
10th rnd: As 5th rnd.
11th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * 4 times more. Join. 20 sc.
12th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 
13th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * 4 times more. Join. 15 sts. 
14th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * 4 times more. Join. 10 sts. 
Stuff Beet.
15th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 5 times. Join. 5 sts. 
16th to 18th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
19th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. 1 sc in last sc. Join. 3 sts. Fasten off.

Leaves (make 3).
With C, ch 26.
See diagram on page 4.
1st rnd: 1 sl st in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 10 ch. Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. 1 tr in each of next 3 ch. 1 dtr in each of next 3 ch. 1 tr in each of next 2 ch. 1 dc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working along opposite side of ch into rem loops, 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in next ch. 1 tr in each of next 2 ch. 1 dtr in each of next 3 ch. 1 tr in each of next 3 ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. Ch 3. Sl st in each of last 10 ch. Fasten off, leaving a long end.

PUMPKINS
The instructions are written for Small Pumpkin. If changes are necessary for Large Pumpkin the instructions will be written Small Pumpkin (Large Pumpkin). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to both sizes. 
**Note: Ch 2 does not count as hdc at beg of rnd.
With E (A), ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring.
See diagrams on page 4.
1st rnd: Ch 2. 8 (9) hdc in ring. Join with sl st to first hdc. 8 (9) hdc.
2nd rnd: Ch 2. 2 hdc in first hdc. 2 hdc in each hdc around. Join with sl st to first hdc. 16 hdc.
3rd rnd: Ch 2. *Puff st. 1 sc in next hdc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of first puff st. 8 (9) puff sts.
4th rnd: Ch 2. *2 puff sts in next puff st. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of first puff st. 16 (18) puff sts.
5th rnd: Ch 2. *1 puff st in next puff st. 1 sc in sp between 2 puff sts. 1 puff st in next puff st. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of first puff st. 16 (18) puff sts. 
6th rnd: Ch 2. *1 puff st in next Puff st. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of first puff st. 16 (18) puff sts.** 
Rep last rnd 3 (5) times more. 
***Next rnd: Ch 2. *1 puff st in next puff st. Skip next sc. 1 puff st in next puff st. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of first puff st.

Next rnd: Sl st in sp between first 2 puff sts. Ch 2. Puff st in same sp as last sl st. *1 sc in next sc. Puff st in sp between next 2 puff sts. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to top of first puff st. 8 (9) puff sts.

Next rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next puff st. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 (18) sc. 
Stuff Squash. 
Next rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 8 (9) times. Join with sl st to first st. 8 (9) sts. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Thread end through rem sts. Pull tightly and fasten securely. 

Stem (make 1).
With C, ch 2.
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. Working in both loops, ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Rep last rnd 3 (4) times more.
Next rnd: Ch 1. *(1 hdc. 1 dc. 1 hdc) in next sc. Sl st in next sc. Rep from * 2 (3) times more. Join with sl st to sp where first st was worked. Fasten off.

BUTTERNUT SQUASH
The instructions are written for Small Butternut Squash. If changes are necessary for Large Butternut Squash the instructions will be written thus Small Butternut Squash (Large Butternut Squash). Numbers for each size are shown in the same color throughout the pattern. When only one number is given in black, it applies to both sizes. 
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first sc. 
With B (D), ch 2. 
See diagrams on page 5. 
1st rnd: 6 (7) sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 6 (7) sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as sl st. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 (14) sc. 
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as sl st. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Join. 18 (21) sc. 
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join. 
5th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as sl st. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from* to last 1 (4) sc. 1 sc in each of last 1 (4) sc. Join. 23 (26) sc. 
Next 6 (8) rnds: As 4th rnd. 
Next rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as sl st. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from* to last 1 (4) sc. 1 sc in each of last 1 (4) sc. Join. 31 (34) sc.
Next 5 (7) rnds: As 4th rnd. 
Next rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 (3) sc. Rep from * to last 3 (4) sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of last 1 (2) sc. Join. 23 (27) sts.
