Round 8: (Slip st, ch 2, dc) in the join space (formed by the join ch 7, dc), dc in next dc (top of beginning ch-2), *dc in next space between sts, dc in next dc, 2 dc in next ch-9 space (lower jaw made), ch 5 **, 2 dc in same ch-9 space, dc in next dc; repeat from * around ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2—8 lower jaws and 8 ch-5 spaces.
Round 9: Ch 3 (counts as dc, ch 1), skip next dc, dc in next dc, *[ch 1, skip next dc, dc in next dc] twice (teeth made), ch 7 **, dc in next dc, ch 1, skip next dc, dc in next dc; repeat from * around ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in 2nd ch of beginning ch-3—8 teeth and 8 ch-7 spaces.
Round 10: Ch 2, 2 dc in same st as join, *[dc in next ch-1 space, dc in next dc] twice, dc in next ch-1 space, 3 dc in next dc (upper jaw made), ch 5 **, 3 dc in next dc; repeat from * around ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2—8 upper jaws and 8 ch-5 spaces.
Round 11: Ch 2, dc in same st as join, *dc in next dc, 3 dc in next dc, skip next 2 dc, Fpdc around next dc, skip next 2 dc, 3 dc in next dc, dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc (nose made), ch 4 **, 2 dc in next dc; repeat from * around ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2—8 noses and 8 ch-4 spaces.
Round 12: Ch 2, dc in next 2 dc, *ch 2, slip st in next 3 dc, slip st in space before next Fpdc, ch 2, Fpdc around next Fpdc, ch 2, slip st in space following Fpdc, slip st in next 3 dc, ch 2, dc in next 3 dc (eye base made), ch 5 **, dc in next 3 dc; repeat from * around ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2—eye bases for 8 skulls and 8 ch-5 spaces.
Round 13: Ch 2, dc in next 2 dc, *dc in top of next ch-2, ch 6, dc in top of next ch-2, dc in next Fpdc, dc in top of next ch-2, ch 6, dc in top of next ch-2, dc in next 3 dc, ch 2, dc in next ch-5 space, ch 2 **, dc in next 3 dc; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2.
Round 14: Ch 1, dc in next dc (beginning ch-1 and following dc count as first dc2tog), *dc in next 2 dc, 2 sc in next ch-6 space, dc in next 3 dc, 2 sc in next ch-6 space, dc in next 2 dc, dc2tog, ch 4, dc in next dc, ch 4 **, beginning in next dc work dc2tog; repeat from * around ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in first dc.
Round 15: Ch 1, beginning in next dc work dc2tog (beginning ch-1 and following dc2tog count as first dc3tog), *dc in next 7 sts, dc3tog, ch 6, 2 dc in next dc, ch 6 **, beginning in next dc work dc3tog; repeat from * around ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in first dc.
Round 16: Ch 1, beginning in same st as join work sc2tog, *sc in next dc, hdc in next 3 dc, sc in next dc, sc2tog, ch 10, 2 dc in space between sts of next 2-dc group **, ch 10, beginning in next dc, sc2tog; repeat from * around ending last repeat at **; join with ch 8, dc in first sc (join ch 8, dc count as ch-10 space)—8 skulls completed.
Round 17: Ch 10 (counts as dc, ch 8), *dc in next ch-10 space, ch 6, 2 dc in same ch-10 space, dc in next dc, dc in next space between sts, dc in next dc, 2 dc in next ch-10 space, ch 6 **, dc in same ch-10 space, ch 8; repeat from * around ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in 2nd ch of beginning ch-10—8 lower jaws, 8 ch-8 spaces and 16 ch-6 spaces.
Round 18: Slip st in first ch-8 space, ch 4 (counts as dc, ch 2), *(dc, ch 3, dc, ch 2, dc) in same ch-8 space, ch 7, skip next dc, dc in next dc, [ch 1, skip next dc, dc in next dc] 3 times, ch 7 **, dc in next ch-8 space, ch 2; repeat from * around ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in 2nd ch of beginning ch-4.
Round 19: Ch 6 (counts as dc, ch 4 here and throughout), skip next dc, sc in next ch-3 space, *ch 4, skip next dc, dc in next dc, ch 6, 3 dc in next dc, [dc in next ch-1 space, dc in next dc] twice, dc in next ch-1 space, 3 dc in next dc, ch 6 **, dc in next dc, ch 4, skip next dc, sc in next ch-3 space; repeat from * around ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in 2nd ch of beginning ch-6.
Round 20: Ch 6, tr2tog over same dc as join and next dc (skipping the 2 ch-sps between the dc sts), *ch 4, dc in same dc as last leg of tr2tog just made, ch 6, 2 dc in next dc, dc in next dc, 3 dc in next dc, skip next 2 dc, Fpdc around next dc, skip next 2 dc, 3 dc in next dc, dc in next dc, 2 dc in next dc, ch 6 **, dc in next dc, ch 4, tr2tog over last dc worked into and next dc; repeat from * ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in 2nd ch of beginning ch-6.
Round 21: Ch 6, *sc in space between legs of next tr2tog, ch 4, dc in next dc, ch 7, dc in next 3 dc, ch 2, slip st in next 3 dc, slip st in space before next Fpdc, ch 2, Fpdc around next Fpdc, ch 2, slip st in space following Fpdc, slip st in next 3 dc, ch 2, dc in next 3 dc, ch 7 **, dc in next dc, ch 4; repeat from * around ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in 2nd ch of beginning ch-2.
Round 22: Ch 6, tr2tog over same dc as join and next dc, *ch 4, dc in same dc as last leg of tr2tog, ch 7, dc in next 3 dc, dc in top of next ch-2, ch 6, dc in top of next ch-2, dc in next Fpdc, dc in top of next ch-2, ch 6, dc in top of next ch-2, dc in next 3 dc **, ch 7, dc in next dc, ch 4, tr2tog over same dc and next dc; repeat from * around ending last repeat at **; join with ch 3, tr in 2nd ch of beginning ch-6 (joining ch 3, tr count as ch-7 space).
Round 23: Ch 6, *sc in next dc, ch 4, dc in space between legs of next tr2tog, ch 4, sc in next dc, ch 4, dc in next ch-7 space, ch 5, dc2tog, dc in next 2 dc, 2 sc in next ch-6 space, dc in next 3 dc, 2 sc in next ch-6 space, dc in next 2 dc, d2c2tog, ch 5 **, dc in next ch-7 space, ch 4; repeat from * around ending last repeat at ** join with slip st in 2nd ch of beginning ch-6.
Round 24: Ch 6, tr2tog over same dc as join and next dc, *ch 4, dc in same dc as last leg of tr2tog just made, ch 4, tr2tog over same dc as last leg of tr2tog and next dc, ch 4, dc in same dc as last leg of tr2tog just made, ch 7, dc3tog, dc in next 7 sts, dc3tog **, ch 7, dc in next dc, ch 4, tr2tog over same dc and next dc; repeat from * around ending last repeat at **; join with ch 3, tr in 2nd ch of beginning ch-6.
Round 25: Ch 6, sc in next dc, *[ch 4, dc in space between legs of next tr2tog, ch 4, sc in next dc] twice, ch 4, dc in next ch-7 space, ch 6, sc2tog, sc in next dc, hdc in next 3 dc, sc in next dc, sc2tog, ch 6 **, dc in next ch-7 space, ch 4, sc in next dc; repeat from * around ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in 2nd ch of beginning ch-6.
FINISHING
Weave in ends. Block doily as desired.

materials: Fabric stiffener (or 2 cups sugar, 1 cup water, tongs and 2-qt saucepan)
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Stiffened bowl is 10” diameter x 4” high.
gauge: Rnd 1 and 2 = 2 1⁄2” diameter. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
BOWL: Ch 7; join with a slip st to form a ring.
Rnd 1: Ch 5 (counts as first dc and ch-2 space), [dc in ring, ch 2] 7 times; join with a slip st in 3rd ch of ch-5—8 dc and 8 ch-2 spaces.
Rnd 2: Slip st in next dc, ch 3 (counts as first dc), 4 dc in next ch-2 space, * dc in next dc, 4 dc in next ch-2 space; repeat from * around; join in top of ch-3—40 dc.
Rnd 3: Ch 3, sc in next 2 dc, dc in next dc, ch 5, skip next dc, * dc in next dc, sc in next 2 dc, dc in next dc, ch 5, skip next dc; repeat from * around; join—16 dc, 16 sc and 8 ch-5 spaces.
Rnd 4: * Ch 5, skip next 2 sc, slip st in next dc, (sc, 5 dc, sc) all in next ch-5 space (petal made) **, slip st in next dc; repeat from * around, end at **; join with slip st in joining slip st on Rnd 3—8 petals and 8 ch-5 spaces.
Rnd 5: Slip st in next 3 ch, ch 9 (counts as first dc and ch-6 space), sc in 3rd dc of next petal, ch 6, * dc in 3rd ch of next ch-5 space, ch 6, sc in 3rd dc of next petal, ch 6; repeat from * around; join in 3rd ch of ch-9—8 dc, 8 sc and 16 ch-6 spaces.
Rnd 6: Slip st in next 3 ch, ch 1, sc in same ch-space, ch 10, * sc in next ch-6 space, ch 10; repeat from * around; join in first sc—16 sc and 16 ch-10 spaces.
Rnd 7: Ch 1, * (sc, 3 dc, ch 1, 3 dc, sc) all in next ch-10 space (large petal made); repeat from * around; join—16 large petals.
Rnd 8: Ch 8 (counts as first tr and ch-4 space), skip next 3 sts, sc in next ch-1 space, ch 4, * skip next 4 sts, tr in space between 2 petals, ch 4, skip next 4 sts, sc in next ch-1 space, ch 4; repeat from * around; join in 4th ch of ch-8—16 tr, 16 sc and 32 ch-4 spaces.
Rnd 9: Slip st in next ch-4 space, ch 3, 3 dc in same space, * 4 dc in next ch-4 space; repeat from * around; join in top of ch-3—128 dc.
Rnd 10: Ch 4 (counts as first dc and ch-1 space), skip next dc, * dc in next dc, ch 1, skip next dc; repeat from * around; join in 3rd ch of ch-4—64 dc and 64 ch-1 spaces.
Rnd 11: Ch 1, sc in same ch as joining, sc in next ch, sc in next dc, sc in next ch, * ch 6, skip next dc and next ch **, [sc in next dc, sc in next ch] 3 times; repeat from * to last 2 sts, end at **; sc in next dc, sc in next ch; join in first sc—96 sc and 16 ch-6 spaces.
Rnd 12: Slip st in next 2 sc, * ch 1, [dc, ch 1] 5 times all in next ch-6 space (edge petal made), skip next sc, slip st in next sc, ch 4 **, skip next 2 sc, slip st in next sc; repeat from * around, end at **; join in next slip st—16 edge petals and 16 ch-4 spaces. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
FINISHING-Stiffening: To stiffen bowl, you may use a commercial fabric stiffener and follow the instructions on the label, or use the homemade sugar-and-water method below. To start, cover your work surface with plastic wrap or a garbage bag and several sheets of newspaper. Place large mixing bowl upside-down on top of paper and cover bowl with plastic wrap to make clean-up easier. Experiment with placement of crocheted bowl on top of mixing bowl before you get started – a smaller/taller bowl will yield a bowl that ruffles at the top, a larger/wider bowl will yield a bowl that is flatter and shorter.
Homemade Stiffener: Combine 2 cups sugar and 1 cup water in saucepan. Heat on stove just until sugar is dissolved. Be careful as solution is very hot! Remove pan from heat and soak crocheted bowl in solution. Let cool slightly. With tongs, remove crocheted bowl from saucepan and drape over mixing bowl, shaping as desired. Once piece has sufficiently cooled, shape bowl further with fingers. Let dry for at least 3 days. When thread returns to normal color, bowl is stiffened and ready for use.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 360 Cafe Latte A, 321 Gold B, 256 Carrot C, 319 Cherry Red D, and 312 Black E.
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C etc
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Turkey measures 7” (18 cm).
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
Find more ideas & inspiration: www.redheart.com and www.crochettoday.com

Tom Turkey
You can’t help smiling when you see this Tom Turkey on your Thanksgiving table! So easy to make, you can have a flock of them.
Round 22: Ch 1, [sc in next 2 sts, sc2tog] 6 times; join with slip st in first st – 18 sc.
Round 23: Ch 1, [sc in next st, sc2tog] 6 times; join with slip st in first st – 12 sc.
Round 24: Ch 1, sc2tog around; join with slip st in first st – 6 sc. 
Fasten off.
TAIL FEATHERS
With A, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in second ch from hook; join with slip st in first st – 6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, [2 sc in next st] 6 times; join with slip st in first st – 12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, [sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] 6 times; join with slip st in first st – 18 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, [sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st] 6 times; join with slip st in first st – 24 sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, [sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st] 6 times; join with slip st in first st – 30 sc.
Note: Work progresses in rows from this point.
Row 6: Fold piece in half; working through both thicknesses, sc in next st, [ch 5, sc in next st] 14 times – 14 ch-5 spaces.
Fasten off A.
Row 7: Join B with sc in first ch-5 space of Row 6, [ch 5, sc in next st] 13 times – 13 ch-5 spaces.
Fasten off B.
Row 8: Join D with sc in first ch-5 space of Row 7, [ch 5, sc in next st] 12 times – 12 ch-5 spaces.
Fasten off D.
Row 8: Join C with sc in first ch-5 space of Row 8, [ch 5, sc in next st] 11 times – 11 ch-5 spaces.
Fasten off C.
BEAK
With B, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in second ch from hook; join with slip st in first st – 6 sc.
Beginning at top of head with A, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in second ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc – 6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each st around; join with slip st in first st – 12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, [sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] 6 times; join with slip st in first st – 18 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, [sc in each of next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st] 6 times; join with slip st in first st – 24 sc.
Rounds 5-8: Ch1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first st.
Round 9: Ch 1, [sc in next 2 sts, sc2tog] 6 times; join with slip st in first st – 18 sc.
Round 10: Ch 1, [sc in next st, sc2tog] 6 times; join with slip st in first st – 12 sc.
Round 11: Ch 1, sc2tog around; join with slip st in first st – 6 sc.
Round 12: Ch1, [2 sc in next st] 6 times; join with slip st in first st – 12 sc.
Round 13: Ch 1, [sc in next st, 2 sc in next st] 6 times; join with slip st in first st – 18 sc.
Round 14: Ch 1, [sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st] 6 times; join with slip st in first st – 24 sc.
Round 15: Ch 1, [sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st] 6 times; join with slip st in first st – 30 sc.
Rounds 16-20: Ch 1, sc in each st around; join with slip st in first st.
Round 21: Ch 1, [sc in next 3 sts, sc2tog] 6 times; join with slip st in first st – 24 sc.
Using photo as a guide, sew Beak to middle front of Head. Sew the snood to side of Beak. Sew Tail Feather piece to back side of Body. Sew Arms three rows down from neck. Sew Legs to bottom of Body. With E, whipstitch eyes. Weave in all ends.

materials: RED HEART® “Soft Yarn®”: 1 Ball each 9925 Really Red A, 4422 Tangerine B, and 9779 Berry C.
Split-ring stitch marker, yarn needle, 3/8” red ribbon.
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Heart measures 3” tall x 4¼” across widest without ribbon.
gauge: 17 sc = 4”; 16 rows = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HEART
With A, ch 17.
Round 1: 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next 6 ch, skip next 2 ch, sc in next 6 ch, 3 sc in next ch; turn to work in unused loops of beginning ch, sc in next 6 ch, (sc, ch 2, sc) all in ch-2 space, sc in last 6 ch – 32 sts.
Round 2: [2 sc in next st] 3 times; sc in next 5 sts, skip next 2 sts, sc in next 5 sts, [2 sc in next st] 3 times, sc in next 7 sts, (sc, ch 2, sc) all in ch-2 space, sc in last 7 sts – 38 sts.
Round 3: [2 sc in next st, sc in next st] 3 times, sc in next 4 sts, skip next 2 sts, sc in next 5 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next st] 3 times; sc in next 7 sts, (sc, ch 2, sc) all in ch-2 space, sc in last 8 sts – 44 sts.
Round 4: Sc in next st, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts] 3 times; sc in next 2 sts, skip next 2 sts, sc in next 4 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts] 3 times; sc in next 8 sts, (sc, ch 2, sc) all in ch-2 space, sc in last 9 sts – 50 sts.
Round 5: Sc in next 2 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts] 3 times; skip next 2 sts, sc in next 3 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts] 3 times; sc in next 9 sts, (sc, ch 2, sc) all in ch-2 space, sc in last 10 sts – 56 sts. Fasten off.
Repeat Rounds 1-5.
Joining-Round 6: With Wrong Sides together and A, slip st around, working through Round 5 of both pieces until 1” remains open on Heart; stuff with fiberfill, slip st closed. Fasten off.
Repeat Rounds 1-6 with B and C. Weave in ends.
FINISHING
Cut ribbon into 3 24” pieces. Thread ribbon into top center of each heart and tie ends into a bow.

materials: Red Heart® Amigurumi™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 239 yds/219m) Santa (9962)
Green – is not used for this design
Size U.S. B/1 (2.25) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
¼" [1 cm] wooden bead for nose.
4" [10 cm] piece of cardboard for beard.
Knee high stockings for weighted stuffing.
Weighted stuffing (such as aquarium gravel, plastic pellets or rice).
Pet brush or comb for fluffing beard.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: Approx 5" [12.5 cm] tall, excluding hat.
gauge: 22 sc and 24 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
Note
Before start, separate the different color sections of the yarn as follows: Push the rings of color out from center. Find the point where the color changes and Break the yarn. Rep this process for the rem yarn colors. Wind each color into a separate ball.
BODY and HEAD
Notes: To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops and proceed, keeping color change to WS of work. Do not join at end of rnd. Work in continuous rnds (spiral). Move marker up as each rnd is completed.
Body
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join. PM for beg of rnd. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each of next 6 sc. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: (1 sc next sc. 2 sc in each of next sc) 6 times. 18 sc.
4th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. 24 sc.
5th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. 30 sc.
6th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. 36 sc.
7th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. 42 sc.
8th rnd: Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around.
9th rnd: Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Change to B at end of rnd. Fasten off A.
10th to 12th rnds: With B, 1 sc in each st around.
13th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Sc2tog) 6 times. 36 sts.
14th rnd: As 10th rnd.
15th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 16 sts) twice. 34 sts.
16th rnd: As 10th rnd.
17th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 15 sts) twice. 32 sts. Stuff with weighted stuffing placed in toe of a knee high. Start stuffing piece firmly. Cont stuffing piece as work progresses.
18th rnd: As 10th rnd.
19th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 14 sts) twice. 30 sts.
20th to 24th rnds: As 10th rnd.
25th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 13 sts) twice. 28 sts.
26th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts) 4 times. 24 sts.
27th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sts) 6 times. Change to C at end of rnd. 18 sts. Fasten off B.
Head
28th rnd: With C, as 10th rnd.
29th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. 24 sc.
30th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. 30 sc.
31st to 35th rnds: As 10th rnd.
36th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Sc2tog) 6 times. 24 sts.
37th to 39th rnds: As 10th rnd.
40th rnd: (Sc2tog) 12 times. 12 sts.
Finish stuffing piece.
41st rnd: (Sc2tog) 6 times. 6 sts.
Fasten off, leaving a long end. Thread end through rem sts. Pull tightly. Fasten securely.
ARMS 
With B, ch 6, leaving a long end. Join with sl st in first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. 1 sc in each ch around. Do not join. PM for beg of rnd. 6 sc.
2nd to 12th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around. Join A at end of last rnd. Fasten off B. Stuff arms lightly.
13th to 15th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around. Fasten off. Thread end through sts of last rnd. Pull tightly. Leave end for sewing to body. 
HAT
With B, ch 36, leaving a long end. Join with sl st in first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st and each ch around. Do not join. PM for beg of rnd. 36 sc.
2nd and 3rd rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
4th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts) 6 times. 30 sts.
5th to 11th rnds: 1 sc in each st around.
12th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 13 sts) twice. 28 sts.
13th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 12 sts) twice. 26 sts.
14th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 11 sts) twice. 24 sts.
15th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 10 sts) twice. 22 sts.
16th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 9 sts) twice. 20 sts.
17th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 8 sts) twice. 18 sts.
18th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 7 sts) twice. 16 sts.
19th to 21st rnds: 1 sc in each st around.
22nd rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 6 sts) twice. 14 sts.
23rd rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 5 sts) twice. 12 sts.
24th to 28th rnds: 1 sc in each st around.
29th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts) twice. 10 sts.
30th to 49th rnds: 1 sc in each st around.
50th rnd: (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each st) 3 times. 1 sc in last st. 7 sts. Fasten off, leaving a long end. Thread end through rem sts. Pull tightly. Fasten securely.
Bend end of chenille stem approx ½" [1.5 cm] to prevent sharp tip from poking through hat. Cut chenille stem to fit inside Hat. Insert chenille stem into Hat. Stuff long thin top end of hat lightly, leaving bottom of hat unstuffed.
BOOTS
Note: Boots are made in one piece, stuffed then shaped to resemble 2 boot toes.
Beg at bottom of boots with A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join. PM for beg of rnd. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each of next 6 sc. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: (1 sc in next sc. 2 sc next sc) 6 times. 18 sc.
4th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. 24 sc.
5th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. 30 sc.
6th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc) 6 times. 36 sc.
7th and 8th rnds: 1 sc in each sc around.
9th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 4 sts. Sc2tog) 6 times. 30 sts.
10th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Sc2tog) 6 times. 24 sts.
11th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Sc2tog) 6 times. 18 sts.
Stuff lightly, beg with weighted stuffing placed in toe of a knee high.
12th rnd: (Sc2tog) 9 times. 9 sts. Fasten off, leaving long end. Thread end through rem sts. Pull tightly. Thread rem end of yarn through needle and shape boot toes as follows:
1. Insert needle straight down through center of 12th rnd and out of bottom of piece.
2. Wrap yarn out across piece and around outer edge, inserting needle back through center of 12th rnd.
3. Pull tightly to pucker front edge of piece, giving the appearance of rounded boot toes.
4. Rep steps 2 and 3 to ensure a secure hold. Leave end of yarn for sewing boots to bottom of body.
BEARD
Wrap C around 4" [10 cm] piece of cardboard 40 times. Tie securely at one end. Cut across other end. With pet brush or comb, comb out the strands of yarn to fluff out beard. 
Sew Beard to Head at 35th and 36th rnds.
FINISHING
Referring to photograph as a guide to placement, sew the following pieces together using yarn ends.
1. Sew wooden bead to head for Nose, placing it on top of beard and working over tie knot.
2. Sew arms to body approx 2 rnds down from first C-colored rnd of Head and approx 10 sts apart. (Make sure that arms are far enough apart so that they will not be hidden by beard).
3. Place hat on head so that none of the head shows except nose. Sew hat in place.
With gnome standing, trim beard into a rounded shape as desired or leave uneven.

materials: Aunt Lydia’s® Fashion™ Crochet Thread size 3 (150 yds/137 m) Silver (0435) or Warm Teal (0065) or Soft Mauve (1040) 1 ball
Size C/2 (2.75 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume Crochet Hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: Approx 3½" x 5½"  [9  x 14 cm], excluding hanging loop
gauge: 22 sc and 28 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
Make 3 Trees in the same color.
RIGHT SIDE OF TREE
See Diagram on page 3. 
Ch 7. 
1st row: Ch 1. 1 sc in 2nd ch from 
hook and each ch to end of chain. 
Turn. 6 sc. 
2nd and 3rd rows:  Ch 1. 1 sc in 
each sc to end of row. Turn 
4th row: Ch 6. Working in back of 
chain, 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook 
and each of next 4 ch. 1 sc in each 
of next 3 sc. Turn. Leave rem 3 sts 
unworked. 
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 
6 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 7 sts. 
6th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each 
of next 5 sc. Turn. 6 sts. 
7th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 
4 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 5 sts. 
8th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each 
of next 3 sc. Turn. 4 sts. 
9th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 
4 sts. Turn. 
10th row: Ch 4. 1 sc in 2nd ch from 
hook and each of next 2 ch. 1 sc in 
each of next 4 sc. Turn. 7 sc. 
11th row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in each of 
next 5 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 6 sts. 
12th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each 
of next 4 sc. Turn. 5 sts. 
13th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 
3 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 4 sts. 
14th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each 
of next 2 sc. Turn. 3 sts. 
15th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 
3 sts. Turn. 
16th row: Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd ch from 
hook and next ch. 1 sc in each of 
next 3 sc. Turn. 5 sc. 
17th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 
3 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 4 sts. 
18th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each 
of next 2 sc. Turn. 3 sts. 
19th row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in next sc. 
Sc2tog. Turn. 2 sts. 
20th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Fasten off, 
leaving a 16" [40.6 cm] tail.
LEFT SIDE OF TREE
With RS facing join yarn with sl st at 
last unworked sc of 3rd row. 
1st row: Ch 6. Working in back of 
chain, 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook and 
each of next 4 ch. 1 sc in each of 
next 3 sc. Sl st to corresponding sc 
of 4th row of RIGHT SIDE OF TREE. 
Turn.
 
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 
6 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 7 sts. 
3rd row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each 
of next 5 sc. Sl st to corresponding 
sc of 6th row of RIGHT SIDE OF 
TREE. Turn. 6 sts. 
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 
4 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 5 sts. 
5th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each 
of next 3 sc. Sl st to corresponding 
sc of 8th row of RIGHT SIDE OF 
TREE. Turn. 4 sts. 
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 
4 sts. Turn. 
7th row:  Ch 4. 1 sc in 2nd ch 
from hook and each of next 2 ch. 
1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Sl st to 
corresponding sc of 10th row of 
RIGHT SIDE OF TREE. Turn. 7 sc. 
8th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 
5 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 6 sts. 
9th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each 
of next 4 sc. Sl st to corresponding 
sc of 12th row of RIGHT SIDE OF 
TREE. Turn. 5 sts. 
10th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 
3 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 4 sts. 
11th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each 
of next 2 sc. Sl st to corresponding 
sc of 14th row of RIGHT SIDE OF 
TREE. Turn. 3 sts. 
12th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 
3 sc. Turn. 3 sts. 
13th row: Ch 3. 1 sc in 2nd ch from 
hook and next ch. 1 sc in each of 
next 3 sc. Sl st to corresponding sc 
of 16th row of RIGHT SIDE OF TREE. 
Turn. 5 sc. 
14th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of next 
3 sc. Sc2tog. Turn. 4 sts. 
15th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each 
of next 2 sc. Sl st to corresponding 
sc of 18th row of RIGHT SIDE OF 
TREE. Turn. 3 sts. 
16th row:  Ch 1. 1 sc in next sc. 
Sc2tog. Turn. 2 sts. 
17th row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Sl st to top 
of RIGHT SIDE OF TREE. Fasten off, 
leaving a 16" [40.6 cm] tail.
Stiffen Trees
Cover top and sides of a box with 
waxed paper.  Pin left side of Tree 
to top and fold right side of Tree 
over edge at center line and pin it 
to side of box.
Use white glue or glitter glue mixed 
with water. ¼ water to ¾ glue. Paint 
glue mixture onto Tree saturating 
it well. Let dry for at least 10 hours 
before removing pins.
Assemble 3D Tree
Note from designer:  Be careful 
when pressing glued halves 
together as crochet fabric is porous 
and glue may seep through.
Using a hot glue gun, run a thin 
line of glue up center of Tree. Fold 
second Tree in half and press to line 
of glue. Pay particular attention to 
alignment of the bottom if you 
want to stand Tree up.  Repeat with 
third Tree.
Braid strands left at top of trees and 
tie ends to make a tassel.

materials: RED HEART® Holiday: 1 ball each 9090 Red/Red A, 6060 Green/Green B and 140 White/Silver C
Two pieces of cardboard 3” x 2½” (8 x 6 cm)
Two photos 13⁄8” (3.3 cm) wide x 1¾” (4.4 cm) high
Small amount of wide clear mailing tape
Two ½” (3 cm) buttons – one green and one white
abbreviations: A, B, C = color A, B, C
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Frame Ornaments measure 3¼” (8 cm) across x 3¾” (10 cm) high
gauge: 6 sts = 1¼” (3 cm); 6 rows = 1¾” (4.4 cm) in sc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Join Front and Back
Hold front and back with wrong sides together; ch 1, working through both layers sc evenly down side edge, 3 sc in corner, sc across bottom edge, 3 sc in corner, sc up other side edge (do not sc across top edge), ch 20 for hanger, slip st in opposite top corner. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
Sew button to top center front. Insert picture and button closed.
Flower for Red Frame
Round 1: With C, ch 2; 6 sc in 2 ch from hook.
Round 2: Working in back loops only * (slip st, ch 1, dc, ch 1) in next sc; repeat from * around; join. Fasten off. Sew to frame. Weave in ends.
Trim for Green Frame
Holding frame up side down join A with a slip st in left bottom corner sc; * ch 6, 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across, slip st in next sc on frame; repeat from * across bottom. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
ORNAMENT
Tape a photo to center of each cardboard with mailing tape. Set aside.
Front (Make 1 with A and one with B)
Row 1 (Wrong Side): Ch 11; sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 10 sc.
Rows 2 and 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, turn.
Divide for Right Side Edge-Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sc; turn leaving 8 sc unworked.
Rows 5-10: Ch 1, sc in 2 sc; turn. Fasten off at end of Row 10.
Left Side Edge: With right side facing, skip next 6 sc of Row 3; join yarn with sc in next sc, sc in last sc; turn.
Repeat Rows 5-10 same as for right side except do not fasten off; turn.
Join for Top Edge-Row 11: Ch 1, sc in next 2 sc, ch 6, sc across 2 sc of Right Side Edge; turn.
Row 12: Ch 1, sc in 2 sc, sc in 6 ch, sc in next 2 sc; turn – 10 sc.
Rows 13 and 14: Ch 1, sc in each sc across. Fasten off.
Back (Make 1 with A and 1 with B)
Row 1 (Right Side): Ch 11; sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 10 sc.
Rows 2-13: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 14: Ch 1, sc in first 5 sc, ch 6 for button loop, sc in last 5 sc; turn.

materials: 1 ball each of Solids A and D makes 23 Acorns.
Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Small amount of stuffing for acorns.
Grape vine wreath 13 ins [33 cm] in diameter.
measurements: Measurements provided as needed in the instructions.
gauge: 16 sc and 16 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions:
LEAF (Make 4 each in A and C. Make 2 in B)
Ch 2. 
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in sc. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in sc. Turn. 
4th row: Ch 1. 2 sc in each of next 2 sc. Turn. 4 sc.
5th to 8th rows: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 12 sc at end of 8th row.
9th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
10th row: 1 hdc in first st. 1 dc in next st. 1 hdc in next st. Sl st in next st. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. Sl st in next st. 1 sc in each of last 3 sts. Turn.
11th row: Ch 1. Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sts. Yoh and draw a loop through all loops on hook - Sc2tog made. 1 sc in next st. Sl st in next st. 1 sc in each of next 4 sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
12th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sts. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
13th to 16th rows: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. 1 sc in each sc to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. 12 sc at end of 16th row.
17th to 19th rows: Rep 10th to 12th rows.
20th row: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) twice. Turn.
21st row: Ch 1. Sc2tog. Fasten off. 
Edging: With RS facing, join yarn at stem end. Ch 1. Sc evenly around, working 3 sc in each outside curve and working 2 sl st at each inside corner.
Stem: With RS facing, join yarn to ch at base of stem end of Leaf. Ch 6. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. Sl st in each ch across. Sl st in sc at base of Stem. Fasten off.
Finishing: Fold Leaf in half lengthways, with RS tog. Sew a seam ¼ inch [5 mm] from fold, along center 3½ ins [9 cm] of Leaf. 
ACORN (make 9)
Acorn Body: With D, ch 2. 
1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st in first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc. 
4th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 8 times. Join with sl st in first sc. 8 sc. Fasten off.
Stuff lightly.
Acorn Cap:With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: (RS). 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st in first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc. 16 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc. Fasten off, leaving a long end for sewing Cap to Body.
Stem:With A, ch 4.
Sl st in 2nd ch from hook. Sl st in each of next 2 ch.
Fasten off.
FINISHING
With WS of Cap showing, sew Acorn Cap to top of Acorn Body. Attach Stem.
ASSEMBLY
Using photo as a guide, glue Leaves to Wreath as shown in picture. Glue on Acorns in clusters as shown in picture. Glue on dried berries.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 1 ball each 431 Pumpkin A, 1 ball 001 White B, 1 ball 012 Black C
Artificial pumpkins: 6½” (16.5 cm) white, 9” (23 cm) black, 13” (33 cm) orange
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C etc
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Fits decorative pumpkins sizes 6½” (16.5 cm), 9” (23 cm), and 13” (33 cm) tall.
gauge: 32 tr = 4” [10 cm]; 8 rounds tr = 4” [10 cm]. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
Rounds 4-11: Slip st in the next dc and ch-3 space, work Beginning Shell in same ch-3 space, * ch 5; skip next 2 dc, 3 chs and 2 dc**; work Shell in next ch-3 space; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; slip st in top of ch-3 to join—16 Shells and 16 ch-5 spaces.
Rounds 12-13: Slip st in the next dc and ch-3 space, work Beginning Shell in same ch-3 space, * ch 3; skip next 2 dc, 5 chs and 2 dc**; work Shell in next ch-3 space; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; slip st in top of ch-3 to join—16 Shells and 16 additional ch-3 spaces.
Round 14: Slip st in the next dc and ch-3 space, ch 1, sc in same space, * ch 5; skip next 2 dc, 3 chs, and 2 dc**; sc in next ch-3 space; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; slip st in first sc to join—16 sc and 16 ch-5 spaces. Place the Pumpkin inside the crocheted piece.
Round 15: Slip st in the next 3 chs, ch 1, sc in same ch, * ch 3, skip next sc, sc in the next ch-5-space; repeat from * around, ch 3, slip st in first sc to join—16 sc and 16 ch-3 spaces. Fasten off; weave in ends.
COVER FOR 9” PUMPKIN
With B, ch 40; being careful not to twist, slip st in top of beginning ch to join into a ring.
Round 1 (Right side): Ch 1, work 45 sc in ring; slip st in first sc to join—45 sc.
Round 2: [Ch 15, skip next 2 sc, sc in next sc] 14 times, ch 7, skip last 2 sc, dtr in first ch to join—15 loops.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in same st, [ch 7, sc in next ch-15-space] 14 times, ch 7, slip st first sc to join—15 ch-7 loops.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in same st, [ch 8, sc in next sc] 14 times, ch 8, slip st in first sc to join—15 ch-8 loops.
Round 5: Ch 13, [tr into next sc, ch 9] 14 times, slip st in 4th ch of beginning ch-13 to join—15 ch-9 loops.
Round 6: Ch 1, sc in same st, [ch 10, sc in next tr] 14 times, ch 10, slip st in first sc to join—15 ch-10 loops.
Round 7: Ch 15, [tr into next sc, ch 11] 14 times, slip st in 4th ch of beginning ch-15 to join—15 ch-11 loops.
Round 8: Ch 1, sc in same st, [ch 12, sc in next tr] 14 times, ch 12, slip st in first sc to join—15 ch-12 loops.
Round 9: Ch 16, [tr into next sc, ch 12] 14 times, slip st in 4th ch of beginning ch-16 to join—15 ch-12 loops.
Round 10: Ch 1, sc in same st, [ch 13, sc in next tr] 14 times, ch 13, slip st in first sc to join—15 ch-13 loops.
Rounds 11-22: Repeat Rounds 9-10. Place the Pumpkin inside the crocheted piece.
Round 23: Ch 10, *insert hook underneath the next space created by both ch-13 loops from Rounds 21 and 22, ch 6**, tr in next sc, ch 6; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **, slip st in 4th ch of beginning ch-10 to join—15 ch-6 loops.
Round 24: Ch 1, sc in same st, [ch 8, sc in next tr] 14 times, ch 8, slip st in first sc to join—15 ch-8 loops.
Round 25: Ch 1, sc in same st, [ch 6, sc in next sc] 14 times, ch 6, slip st in first sc to join—15 ch-6 loops. Fasten off; weave in ends.
COVER FOR 6½” PUMPKIN
With A, ch 40; being careful not to twist, slip st in top of beginning ch to join into a ring.
Round 1 (Right side): Work Beginning Shell in first ch, [ch 3, skip next 4 chs, work Shell in next ch] 7 times, ch 3, skip next 4 chs; slip st in top of ch-3 to join—8 Shells and 8 additional ch-3 spaces.
Round 2: Slip st in the next dc and ch-3 space, work Beginning Shell in same ch-3 space, * ch 3, skip next 2 dc and next ch, work Shell in next ch, ch 3**, skip next ch and 2 dc, work Shell in next ch-3 space; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; slip st in top of ch-3 to join—16 Shells and 16 additional ch-3 spaces.
Round 3: Slip st in the next dc and ch-3 space, work Beginning Shell in same ch-3 space, * ch 3; skip next 2 dc, 3 chs and 2 dc**; work Shell in next ch-3 space; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; slip st in top of ch-3 to join—16 Shells and 16 additional ch-3 spaces.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in same st, * ch 5; skip next 2 dc, 3 chs, and 2 dc**; sc in next ch-3 space; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; slip st in first sc to join—16 sc and 16 ch-5 spaces.
Round 5: Ch 4, 2 tr in same st, [ch 5, skip next 4 chs, 3 tr in next ch] 7 times, ch 5, skip next 4 chs; slip st in top of ch-4 to join—8 3-tr groups and 8 ch-5 spaces.
Rounds 6-7: Ch 4, tr in each of next 8 tr, * ch 15, skip next 15 chs**, tr in each of next 9 tr; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; slip st in top of ch-4 to join—8 9-tr groups and 8 ch-15 spaces.
Round 8: Ch 4, tr in same st, * tr in each of next 7 tr, 2 tr in next tr, ch 17, skip next 15 chs**, 2 tr in next tr; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; slip st in top of ch-4 to join—8 11-tr groups and 8 ch-17 spaces.
Rounds 9- 23: Ch 4, tr in each of next 10 tr, * ch 17, skip next 17 chs**, tr in each of next 11 tr; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; slip st in top of ch-4 to join—8 11-tr groups and 8 ch-17 spaces. Place the Pumpkin inside the cover.
Round 24: Ch 4, *2-tr-cluster in next 2 tr, tr in each of next 5 tr, 2-tr-cluster in next 2 tr, tr in next tr, ch 15, skip next 17 chs**, tr in next tr; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; slip st in top of ch-4 to join—8 9-tr groups and 8 ch-15 spaces.
Round 25: Ch 4, *2-tr-cluster in next 2 tr, tr in each of next 3 tr, 2-tr-cluster in next 2 tr, tr in next tr, ch 13, skip next 15 chs**, tr in next tr; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; slip st in top of ch-4 to join—8 7-tr groups and 8 ch-13 spaces.
Round 26: Ch 9, skip 5 trs, *tr in last tr of the group, ch 5, tr in the center of next ch-13-space, ch 5**, tr in the first tr of the next group, ch 5; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; slip st in 4th ch of beginning ch-9 to join—24 ch-5 spaces.
Round 27: *Ch 7; skip next ch-5 space, tr, and ch-5 space**; slip st in next tr; repeat from * around, ending last repeat at **; slip st in first ch to join—12 ch-7 spaces. Fasten off; weave in ends.

materials: Aunt Lydia® Classic™ Crochet Thread size 10 (White: 400 yds/367 m; Colors: 350 yds/320 m)
Size U.S. 7 (1.5 mm) Susan Bates® Steelite® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
White glue or spray starch for stiffener.
measurements: Snowflake 1: Approx 4" [10 cm] diameter. Snowflake 2: Approx 4" [10 cm] diameter. Snowflake 3: Approx 4¼" [10.5 cm] diameter.
gauge: 36 sc and 40 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Snowflake 1
See Diagram on page 3.
Ch 6. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd:  *Ch 4. [(Yoh) twice and draw up a loop in ring. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice] twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook - Tr cluster made.
Ch 4. Sl st in ring. Rep from * 5 times more. Fasten off.
2nd rnd: Ch 3. Join yarn with sl st to first Tr cluster. (Ch 9. Sl st in same sp as previous sl st. Ch 3. Sl st in next Tr cluster) 5 times.
Ch 9. Sl st in same sp as previous sl st. Join with sl st to first ch.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 ch. [(3 sc. Ch 3) 3 times. 3 sc] in next ch-9 loop. Rep from * 5 times more. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

Snowflake 2
See Diagram on page 3.
Ch 7. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. (3 sc. Ch 9) 6 times in ring. Join with sl st to first sc.  Fasten off.
2nd rnd: Join yarn with sl st to any ch-9 loop. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in same sp as sl st. [Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-9 loop] 5 times. Ch 1. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
3rd rnd: Sl st back into last ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as sl st. *Ch 1. 6 dc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 6. Sl st to first ch. Turn. (Ch 4. 2 tr. Ch 4. Sl st) 3 times in last ch-6 sp made  – top cluster made. Turn. 6 dc in same ch-3 sp as last 6 dc. Ch 1.** 1 sc in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * 4 times more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

Snowflake 3
See Diagram on page 3.
Ch 6. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd:  Ch 6 (counts as dc and ch 3). (1 dc. Ch 3) 11 times in ring. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 6. 12 ch-3 sps.
2nd rnd: Sl st in next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice in same sp as last sl st. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook  – beg cluster made. [Ch 5. (Yoh and draw up a loop. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) 3 times in next ch-3 sp. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – cluster made ] 11 times. Ch 5. Join with sl st to top of first cluster.
3rd rnd: (Sl st. Ch 1. 1 sc. Ch 5. 1 sc) in next ch-5 sp. *(Sl st. Ch 3. Cluster) in next cluster. (Ch 3. Cluster in top of cluster just made) twice. (Ch 3. Sl st. Ch 6. Sl st. Ch 3. Sl st) all in top of last cluster. Working down towards 2nd rnd, (Ch 3. Sl st to base of cluster) 3 times. (1 sc. Ch 5. 1 sc) in next ch-5 sp. (Sl st. Ch 3. Cluster) in next cluster. (Ch 3. Sl st. Ch 6. Sl st. Ch 3. Sl st) all in top of cluster. Working down towards 2nd rnd, ch 3. Sl st to base of cluster.** (1 sc. Ch 5. 1 sc) in next ch-5 sp. Rep from * 4 times more, then from * to ** once. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Pin Snowflake to measurements. Apply spray starch if desired and steam iron lightly.
Optional: Stiffening ornaments
Use white glue or glitter glue mixed with water. ¼ water to ¾ glue.  Pin snowflakes to measurements on a piece of cardboard covered with waxed paper.  Paint the glue mixture onto the snowflake, saturating well.  Let dry for at least 10 hours before removing the pins. Carefully remove the snowflake from the paper.
Caution: Colored Glitter Glue may not dry clear on white and may stain.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver™ (7 oz/198 g; 364 yds/333 m)
Size U.S. H/8 [5 mm] hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Scbl = Single crochet in back loop only
Splsc = Split single crochet: work sc between ‘legs’ of stitch (splitting stitch) instead of through top loops

Splsc2tog= Split single crochet 2 together: Working between ‘legs’ of stitch (splitting stitch) instead of through top loops, draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 21" [53.5 cm] long from cuff to toe.
gauge: 13 split sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Cuff: With A, ch 20.
1st row: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 18 hdc.
2nd row: Ch 2. 1 hdc in horizontal bar created below st in previous row (bar is below loops normally worked on WS-see diagram) in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep 2nd row until Cuff measures 14" [35.5 cm] when slightly stretched.
Join Cuff: With WS facing, working through both thicknesses of foundation ch and last row of Cuff, work 1 sc in each st to end of row. Break A. Join B.
Note: Rnds are worked in a spiral. Do not join at end of rnds. Place marker on first st of each rnd and move marker up each following rnd.
LEG
1st rnd: Ch 1. Turn Cuff sideways and work 46 sc evenly around long edge of Ribbing. Do not join.
2nd rnd: 1 splsc in each st around. Rep last rnd until Stocking from base of Cuff measures 10" [25.5 cm]. Join last rnd to first st of rnd with sl st. Break B.
Heel Flap
1st row: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 22 sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 23 sc.
2nd row: (WS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Working back and forth in rows across 23 sc, rep last row for 2" [5 cm], ending on a WS row.
Shape Heel: 1st row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 15 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 17 sts.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 9 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Turn. 11 sts.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 10 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Turn. 12 sts.
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 11 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Turn. 13 sts.
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 12 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Turn. 14 sts.  
6th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 13 sts. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. Turn. 15 sts.
7th and 8th rows: Ch 1.1 sc in each of first 14 sts. Sc2tog. Turn. 15 sts. Fasten off.
Foot
Joining rnd: (RS). Join C with sl st at left side of Heel Base. Ch 1. 1 splsc in each of next 23 sc of instep. PM. Work 7 sc up right side of Heel. Work 1 splsc in each of next 15 sc across end of Heel and work 7 sc down left side of Heel. 52 sts.
2nd rnd: 1 splsc in each sc to marker. Splsc2tog. 1 splsc in each sc to last 2 sc. Splsc2tog. 50 sts.
3rd to 5th rnds: As 2nd rnd. 44 sts.
6th rnd: 1 splsc in each st around. Rep 6th rnd until work from join measures 5" [12.5 cm]. Break C. Join A.
Next 3 rnds: With A, 1 splsc in each st around.
Shape toe: 1st rnd: (1 splsc in each of next 9 sc. Splsc2tog) 4 times. Join. 40 sts.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. (1 splsc in each of next 8 sts. Splsc2tog) 4 times. Join. 36 sts.
3rd to 8th rnds: Cont in same manner, dec 4 sts on every rnd until 12 sts rem.
Break yarn, leaving a long end. Draw end tightly through rem sts and fasten securely.

materials: RED HEART® "Soft Yarn®: 1 ball each 9925 Really Red A
3/8” wide red ribbon (18” length for each heart).
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Heart measures 3” tall x 4¼” across widest without ribbon.
gauge: 17 sc = 4”; 16 rows = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
NOTE: Do not join rounds; instead, mark the beginning of each round with a stitch marker, move marker up each round.
HEART
With A, ch 17.
Round 1: 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next 6 ch, skip next 2 ch, sc in next 6 ch, 3 sc in next ch; turn to work in unused loops of beginning ch, sc in next 6 ch, (sc, ch 2, sc) all in ch-2 space, sc in last 6 ch – 32 sts.
Round 2: [2 sc in next st] 3 times; sc in next 5 sts, skip next 2 sts, sc in next 5 sts, [2 sc in next st] 3 times, sc in next 7 sts, (sc, ch 2, sc) all in ch-2 space, sc in last 7 sts – 38 sts.
Round 3: [2 sc in next st, sc in next st] 3 times, sc in next 4 sts, skip next 2 sts, sc in next 5 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next st] 3 times; sc in next 7 sts, (sc, ch 2, sc) all in ch-2 space, sc in last 8 sts – 44 sts.
Round 4: Sc in next st, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts] 3 times; sc in next 2 sts, skip next 2 sts, sc in next 4 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 2 sts] 3 times; sc in next 8 sts, (sc, ch 2, sc) all in ch-2 space, sc in last 9 sts – 50 sts.
Round 5: Sc in next 2 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts] 3 times; skip next 2 sts, sc in next 3 sts, [2 sc in next st, sc in next 3 sts] 3 times; sc in next 9 sts, (sc, ch 2, sc) all in ch-2 space, sc in last 10 sts – 56 sts. Fasten off.
Repeat Rounds 1-5.
Joining-Round 6: With Wrong Sides together and A, slip st around, working through Round 5 of both pieces until 1” remains open on Heart; stuff with fiberfill, slip st closed. Fasten off.
Repeat Rounds 1-6 with B and C. Weave in ends.
FINISHING
Cut 18” length of ribbon for each heart. Thread ribbon into top center of each heart and tie ends into a bow.

materials: Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 3.75mm [US F-5] or 4mm [US G-6]
Sewing needle and white thread (to sew down ends), yarn needle
1½ yds (1.5 m) of burlap in color of your choice (shown in: Wedgewood blue)
Hot glue gun and glue sticks
Framing supplies (optional): Acid free foam core backing, sewing needle and thread to match burlap, large picture frame
abbreviations: () = work directions in parentheses into same st
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Framed doily tree shown measures about 28½ x 42½” [72.5 x 108 cm]
gauge: See instructions for each doily for gauge. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
MINI SNOWFLAKE DOILY (make 10)
Finished Size: About 3¼” (8.5 cm) diameter.
Gauge: Rounds 1-2 = 2” (5 cm) across.
Ch 6; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 12 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc.
Round 2: Ch 5, skip same sc as joining, skip next sc, slip st in next sc, [ch 5, skip next sc, slip st in next sc] 4 times, ch 5, skip last sc; join with slip st in joining slip st of Round 1—6 ch-5 spaces.
Round 3: (Slip st, ch 1, 2 sc, ch 3, sc, ch 5, sc, ch 3, 2 sc) in first ch-5 space, (2 sc, ch 3, sc, ch 5, sc, ch 3, 2 sc) in each remaining ch-5 space around; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.

SMALL SNOWFLAKE DOILY #1 (make 2)
Finished Size: About 5” (12.5 cm) tip to tip.
Gauge: Rounds 1-3 = 2¾” (7 cm) across.
Ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, [sc in ring, ch 2] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc and 6 ch-2 spaces.
Round 2: (Slip st, ch 1, sc, ch 2, sc) in first ch-2 space, [ch 2, (sc, ch 2, sc) in next ch-2 space] 5 times, ch 2; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc and 12 ch-2 spaces.
Round 3: (Slip st, ch 1, sc, ch 3, sc) in first ch-2 space, (sc, ch 3, sc) in next 11 ch-2 spaces; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc and 12 ch-3 spaces.
Round 4: (Slip st, ch 1, sc) in first ch-3 space, [ch 5, sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space] 5 times, ch 5, sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc, 6 ch-5 spaces and 6 ch-3 spaces.
Round 5: Ch 2, (sc, ch 5, sc) in first ch-5 space, [ch 2, slip st in next sc, ch 1, sc in next ch-3 space, ch 1, slip st in next sc, ch 2, (sc, ch 5, sc) in next ch-5 space] 5 times, ch 2, slip st in next sc, ch 1, sc in next ch-3 space, ch 1; join with slip st in joining slip st of Round 4. Fasten off.

SMALL SNOWFLAKE DOILY #2 (make 2)
Finished Size: About 5” (12.5 cm) tip to tip.
Gauge: Rounds 1-3 = 2¾” (7 cm) across.
Special Stitch
shell = (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in indicated space.
Ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 12 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in same sc as joining, [ch 1, sc in next sc] 11 times, ch 1; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc and 12 ch-1 spaces.
Round 3: Slip st in first ch-1 space, ch 6 (counts as dc, ch 3), skip next sc, dc in next ch-1 space, [ch 3, skip next sc, dc in next ch-1 space] 10 times, ch 3, skip last sc; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-6—12 dc and 12 ch-3 spaces.
Round 4: (Slip st, ch 1, sc, ch 2, sc) in first ch-3 space, [skip next dc, shell in next ch-3 space, skip next dc, (sc, ch 2, sc) in next ch-3 space] 5 times, skip next dc, shell in last ch-3 space; join with slip st in first sc—6 shells.
Round 5: (Slip st, ch 1, sc, ch 3, sc) in first ch-2 space, [ch 3, (sc, hdc, ch 4, hdc, sc) in ch-2 space of next shell, ch 3, (sc, ch 3, sc) in next ch-2 space] 5 times, ch 3, (sc, hdc, ch 4, hdc, sc) in ch-2 space of last shell, ch 3; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.

MEDIUM SNOWFLAKE DOILY #1 (make 2)
Finished Size: About 6” (15 cm) tip to tip.
Gauge: Rounds 1-3 = 3¼ (8.5 cm) across.
Special Stitches
beg-Cl (beginning cluster) = Ch 3, *Yarn over, insert hook in indicated space, yarn over and draw up a loop, yarn over and draw through 2 loops on hook; repeat from * once more, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
Cl (3 double crochet cluster) = Yarn over, insert hook in indicated space, yarn over and pull up loop, yarn over, draw through 2 loops on hook (2 loops remain on hook); [yarn over, insert hook in same space, yarn over and pull up loop, yarn over, draw through 2 loops] twice, yarn over, draw through all 4 loops on hook.
V-st (V-stitch): (Dc, ch 5, dc) in indicated space.
Ch 6; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Beg-Cl in ring, [ch 3, Cl in ring] 5 times, ch 3; join with slip st in top of beg-Cl—6 clusters and 6 ch-3 spaces.
Round 2: (Slip st, ch 1, sc, ch 3, sc) in first ch-3 space, [ch 3, (sc, ch 3, sc) in next ch-3 space] 5 times, ch 3; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc and 12 ch-3 spaces.
Round 3: (Slip st, ch 1, sc) in first ch-3 spaces, [ch 7, skip next ch-3 space, sc in next ch-3 space] 5 times, ch 7, skip last ch-3 space; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc and 6 ch-7 spaces.
Round 4: Ch 5 (counts as dc, ch 2), V-st in next ch-7 space, [ch 2, dc in next sc, ch 2, V-st in next ch-7 space] 5 times, ch 2; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-5—6 V-sts.
Round 5: Ch 3, slip st in next dc, ch 3, (sc, ch 5, sc) in next ch-5 space, ch 3, slip st in next dc, [ch 3, (slip st, ch 2, slip st) in next dc, ch 3, slip st in next dc, ch 3, (sc, ch 5, sc) in next ch-5 space, ch 3, slip st in next dc] 5 times, ch 3, (slip st, ch 2, slip st) in joining slip st. Fasten off.

MEDIUM SNOWFLAKE DOILY #2 (make 2)
Finished Size: About 6” (15 cm) tip to tip.
Gauge: Rounds 1-3 = 3 (7.5 cm) across.
Special Stitches
small-shell = 3 dc in indicated stitch.
Ch 6; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, 12 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in same st as joining, [small-shell in next st, sc in next st] 5 times, small-shell in last st; join with slip st in first sc—6 small-shells.
Round 3: Ch 7 (counts as tr, ch 3), dc in center st of first small-shell, [ch 3, tr in next sc, ch 3, dc in center st of next small-shell] 5 times, ch 3; join with slip st in 4th ch of beginning ch-7—6 tr, 6 dc, and 12 ch-3 spaces.
Round 4: (Slip st, ch 1, 2 sc, ch 3, 2 sc) in first ch-3 space, [ch 1, (2 sc, ch 3, 2 sc) in next ch-3 space] 11 times, ch 1; join with slip st in first sc—12 (2 sc, ch 3, 2 sc) groups and 12 ch-1 spaces.
Round 5 (wrong side): Ch 1, TURN, sc in first ch-1 space, [ch 6, sc in next ch-1 space] 11 times, ch 6; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc and 12 ch-6 spaces.
Round 6 (right side): Ch 3, TURN, (sc, ch 5, sc) in first ch-6 space, [ch 3, slip st in next sc, ch 3, (sc, ch 3, sc) in next ch-6 space, ch 3, slip st in next sc, ch 3, (sc, ch 5, sc) in next ch-6 space] 5 times, ch 3, slip st in next sc, ch 3, (sc, ch 3, sc) in last ch-6 space, ch 3; join with slip st in same sc as joining of Round 5. Fasten off.

LARGE SNOWFLAKE DOILY #1 (make 2)
Finished Size: About 7” (18 cm) tip to tip.
Gauge: Rounds 1-3 = 3” (7.5 cm) across.
Special Stitches
shell = 5 dc in indicated stitch or space.
V-st (V-stitch) = (Dc, ch 3, dc) in indicated stitch.
Ch 5; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, [sc in ring, ch 4] 5 times, sc in ring; join with ch 1, dc in first sc (joining ch 1 and dc count as ch-4 space here and throughout)—6 sc and 6 ch-4 spaces.
Round 2: Ch 1, (sc, ch 4, sc) in first ch-4 space (the ch-4 space formed by the ch 1, dc joining), [ch 4, (sc, ch 4, sc) in next ch-4 space] 5 times; join with ch 1, dc in first sc—12 sc and 12 ch-4 spaces.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in first ch-4 space, [shell in next ch-4 space, sc in next ch-4 space] 5 times, shell in last ch-4 space; join with slip st in first sc—6 shells and 6 sc.
Round 4: Ch 6 (counts as dc, ch 3), dc in same sc as joining (first V-st made), [ch 3, sc in center dc of next shell, ch 3, V-st in next sc] 5 times, ch 3, sc in center dc of next shell, ch 3; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-6—6 sc, 6 V-sts, and 12 ch-3 spaces.
Round 5: (Slip st, ch 1, sc) in ch-3 space of first V-st, [ch 3, shell in next sc, ch 3, sc in ch-3 space of next V-st] 5 times, ch 3, shell in next sc, ch 3; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc, 6 shells, and 12 ch-3 spaces.
Round 6: Ch 1, ([sc, ch 2] twice, sc) in same sc as joining, *ch 3, (sc, ch 3, sc, ch 7, sc, ch 3, sc) in center dc of next shell, ch 3, ([sc, ch 2] twice, sc) in next sc; repeat from * 4 more times, ch 3, (sc, ch 3, sc, ch 7, sc, ch 3, sc) in center dc of last shell, ch 3; join with slip st in first sc. Fasten off.

LARGE SNOWFLAKE DOILY #2 (make 2)
Finished Size: About 7½” (19 cm) tip to tip.
Gauge: Rounds 1-3 = 3½” (9 cm) across.
Special Stitches
shell = (3 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in indicated space.
Ch 6; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 12 sc in ring; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc.
Round 2: Ch 5 (counts as dc, ch 2), dc in next sc, [ch 2, dc in next sc] 10 times, ch 2; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-5—12 dc and 12 ch-2 spaces.
Round 3: Slip st in first ch-2 space, ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), (2 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in same ch-2 space (first shell made), [sc in next ch-2 space, shell in next ch-2 space] 5 times, sc in next ch-2 space; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—6 sc and 6 shells.
Round 4: Slip st in next 2 dc, (slip st, ch 3, 2 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in ch-2 space of first shell, [ch 5, shell in ch-2 space of next shell] 5 times, ch 5; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—6 shells and 6 ch-5 spaces.
Round 5: Slip st in next 2 dc, (slip st, ch 3, 2 dc, ch 2, 3 dc) in ch-2 space of first shell, [ch 4, sc in next ch-5 space, ch 4, shell in ch-2 space of next shell] 5 times, ch 4, sc in next ch-5 space, ch 4; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—6 shells, 6 sc, and 12 ch-4 spaces.
Round 6: Ch 4, (slip st, ch 6, slip st) in ch-2 space of first shell, *ch 4, skip next 2 dc of same shell, slip st in last dc of same shell, [ch 4, slip st in next ch-4 space] twice, ch 4, slip st in first dc of next shell, ch 4, (slip st, ch 6, slip st) in ch-2 space of same shell; repeat from * 4 more times, ch 4, skip next 2 dc of same shell, slip st in last dc of same shell, [ch 4, slip st in next ch-4 space] twice, ch 4; join with slip st in joining of previous round. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Weave in tails and, using sewing needle and white sewing thread, sew down ends on back side of doilies. Block each doily, if desired. Lay burlap flat and iron out any wrinkles. Arrange doilies on burlap, following layout diagram. Using hot glue, glue doilies to burlap.
Frame Tree
Cut foam core into a rectangle that extends about 3” (7.5 cm) beyond the tree on all sides and will fit into your picture frame. Carefully stretch the burlap over the foam core and pin, sew, or glue the edges to the back side. You may prefer to remove any glass from the frame before inserting the piece into the frame. Insert the piece into the picture frame. The piece could also be professionally framed.

materials: Size 5 mm (U.S. H or 8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
7 buttons ½ inch [15 mm] in diameter.
measurements: Approx 10 ins [25.5 cm] wide x 15 ins [38 cm] high.
gauge: 15 sc and 17 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions:
BACK and FRONT (make alike).
Beg at bottom of trunk, ch 11.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end of ch. Turn. 10 sc.
2nd to 6th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
7th row: Ch 15. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 13 ch. 1 sc in each of next 10 sc. Turn. 24 sc.
8th row: Ch 15. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 13 ch. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn. 38 sc.
9th and 10th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
11th row: (Dec row). Ch 1. Draw up a loop in each of first 2 sts. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook - Sc2tog made. 1 sc in each sc to last 2 sts. Sc2tog over last 2 sts. Turn.
12th to 14th rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 4 rows 8 times more. 20 sc.
Next row: As 11th row.
Next 2 rows: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 3 rows twice more. 14 sts.
Next row: As 11th row.
Next row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows 4 times more. 4 sts.
Work 2 rows even. Do not fasten off. Ch 1. Work 1 rnd of sc around outside edge of piece. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Following tracing diagram, cut star from yellow felt and sew as shown in picture. Sew garland as shown in picture. Sew buttons randomly to RS of front of tree for ornaments.
Place marker 4 ins [10 cm] down from top of tree on each side of Front and Back. Sew outside edges of Front and Back tog between markers.
Hanging Loop: With RS facing, join yarn with sl st at top of Back. Ch 24. Sl st in same sp as joining stitch. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Soft®: 1 ball each 4422 Tangerine A, 4601 Off White B, 4614 Black C, and 9522 Leaf D
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Fox measures 7” (18 cm) tall
gauge: 19 sc = 4” (10cm); 22 rows = 4” (10cm) in single crochet
instructions:
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in ring; do not join, work in continuous rounds (spiral)—6 sc. 
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc] 6 times—18 sc.
Round 4: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 5: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc] 6 times—30 sc.
Round 6: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 4 sc] 6 times—36 sc.
Rounds 7–18: Sc in each sc around.
Round 19: [Sc2tog, sc in next 4 sc] 6 times—30 sc.
Round 20: [Sc2tog, sc in next 3 sc] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 21: [Sc2tog, sc in next 2 sc] 6 times—18 sc.
Rounds 22 and 23: Sc in each sc around.
Round 24: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc] 6 times—24 sc. 
Round 25: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc] 6 times—30 sc.
Round 26: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 4 sc] 6 times—36 sc. Place stitch marker on this round for placement of nose.
Round 27: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 5 sc] 6 times—42 sc.
Round 28: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 6 sc] 6 times—48 sc.
Rounds 29–31: Sc in each sc around. Place stitch marker on Round 31 for placement of nose.
Round 32: [Sc2tog, sc in next 6 sc] 6 times—42 sc. Place stitch marker between Rounds 31 and 32 for placement of safety eyes.
Round 33: [Sc2tog, sc in next 5 sc] 6 times—36 sc.
Round 34: Sc in each sc around.
Round 35: [Sc2tog, sc in next 4 sc] 6 times—30 sc.
Round 36: [Sc2tog, sc in next 3 sc] 6 times—24 sc. 
Round 37: [Sc2tog, sc in next 2 sc] 6 times—18 sc.
Round 38: [Sc2tog, sc in next sc] 6 times—12 sc.
Round 39: Sc2tog 6 times—6 sc. 
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. 
Attach safety eyes between Rounds 31 and 32, 10 sts apart. Insert more stuffing as needed for a firm head. Weave tail through remaining sts and pull tightly. 

Nose
With B, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in ring; do not join, work in continuous rounds (spiral)—6 sc. 
Round 2: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc] twice—8 sc.
Round 3: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc] twice—10 sc.
Round 4: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 4 sc] twice—12 sc.
Round 5: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc] 4 times; join with slip st in first sc—16 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Insert stuffing. Using photograph as a guide for shape, with C and short stitches, embroider a snout to top of nose. Sew nose to head between Rounds 26 and 31.

Belly patch
Working from bottom up, with B, ch 6.
Row 1 (right side): Work 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next 3 ch, 2 sc in last ch, turn—7 sc. 
Rows 2–14: Ch 1, sc in each sc, turn.
Row 15: Ch 1, skip first sc, sc in next 5 sc, slip st in last sc—4 sc. 
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Sew belly patch to front of body.

Paws (make 2)
With C, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in ring; do not join, work in continuous rounds (spiral)—6 sc. 
Rounds 2–9: Sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc at end of Round 9—6 sc. 
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. 
Position paws downward diagonally over body and sew to body a few rows below neck.

Feet (make 2)
Work same as Rounds 1-4 of paws; join with slip st in first sc at end of Round 4.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Insert stuffing firmly. Sew feet to bottom of body.

Ears (make 2)
With C, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in ring; do not join, work in continuous rounds (spiral)—6 sc. 
Rounds 2 and 3: Sc in each sc around; change to A at end of Round 3. Fasten off C.
Round 4: Sc in each sc around.
Rounds 5 and 6: Work same as Rounds 2 and 3 of nose; join with slip st in first sc at end of Round 6—10 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Insert stuffing firmly. Using photograph as a guide for placement, sew ears to head.

Tail 
Note: Insert stuffing firmly every few rounds.
With B, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1 (right side): Work 4 sc in ring; do not join, work in continuous rounds (spiral)—4 sc. 
Round 2: Sc in each sc around.
Round 3: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc] twice—6 sc.
Round 4: Sc in each sc around.
Round 5: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc] twice—8 sc.
Round 6: Sc in each sc around; change to A. 
Fasten off B.
Round 7: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc] twice—10 sc.
Round 8: Sc in each sc around.
Round 9: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 4 sc] twice—12 sc.
Round 10: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 5 sc] twice—14 sc.
Round 11: Sc in each sc around.
Round 12: [Sc2tog, sc in next 5 sc] twice—12 sc.
Round 13: [Sc2tog, sc in next 4 sc] twice—10 sc.
Round 14: [Sc2tog, sc in next 3 sc] twice—8 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Insert more stuffing as needed for a firm tail. With edges of last round held together, sew tail closed. Holding tail horizontally, sew to right backside of body a few rows above beginning rounds.

Scarf 
With D, ch 51.
Row 1: Hdc in 3rd ch from hook (beginning ch count as first hdc), hdc in each ch across—50 hdc. 
Fasten off. Cut 8 lengths of D, each 3” (7.5 cm) long. *Hold 4 lengths together and fold them in half forming a loop at the fold. Insert crochet hook in end of scarf, place fold of strands on hook and draw loop through. Insert ends of folded strands into loop and pull to tighten; repeat from * to attach remaining 4 strands to other end. Trim fringe to even length. Wrap scarf around neck and, if desired, secure in place.

FINISHING
To make hanging loop, cut a length of A 15” (38 cm) long, thread through top of head, and tie ends in a knot.
Weave in ends.

materials: Peaches & Crème® (Solids: 2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m; Stripey: 2 oz/56.7 g; 102 yds/93 m)
Contrast A Gold (11605) 2 balls or 220 yds/200 m
Contrast B White (11005) 1 ball or 95 yds/86 m
Contrast A Bright Blue (11742) 2 balls or 220 yds/200 m
Contrast B Spring Blue Stripes (17008) 1 ball or 95 yds/86 m
Size U.S. J/10 (6 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Splsc = Split single crochet: work sc between ‘legs’ of stitch (splitting stitch) instead of through top loops
measurements: Approx 7½" [19 cm] diameter x 4 [10 cm] high (with cuff).
gauge: 11.5 sts and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm] with 2 strands of yarn held tog in Body Pat.
instructions:
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first st.
With 2 strands of A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 30 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 36 sc.
7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 42 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 48 sc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * around. Join. 54 sc.
10th rnd (ridge): Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join.
Proceed in Body Pat as follows:
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 splsc in each st around. Join.
Rep last rnd for Body Pat until Basket from ridge rnd measures 3" [7.5 cm], joining 2 strands of B at end of last rnd. Turn. Break A.
Edging: 1st rnd: (WS). With 2 strands of B, ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each st around. Join. Turn.
2nd rnd: (RS). Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each st around. Join. Turn.
Rep last 2 rnds twice more, then 1st rnd once (7 rnds of Edging in total).
Fasten off. Fold Edging to RS of Basket.
Handles (make 2): Cut 8 lengths of B 10" [25.5 cm] long.
Work around 4 strands of B for each Handle as follows:
With 2 strands of B, sl st around 4 strands (leaving approx 3" [7.5 cm] end). Work 14 sc tightly around 4 strands, leaving approx 3" [7.5 cm] free at opposite end.
Using yarn ends sew Handles securely to top edge of Basket (inside folded edge as shown).

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 4 skeins 316 Soft White A, 1 skein each 319 Cherry Red B, 774 Light Raspberry C, 373 Petal Pink D, and 624 Tea Leaf E.

Yarn needle, 3 bags polyester filler, stitch marker, straight pins, matching thread and hand-sewing needle, metallic cording or embroidery thread and embroidery needle for heart topper embellishment, red felt and cardboard cutout for lining heart topper, water soluble marker
Optional: 60” length Velcro® hook and loop fastener, 8”, 12” and 16” diameter round cardboard cake boards, quilt batting, white glue and waxed paper for stiffening small hearts.
abbreviations: sc2tog = [draw up a loop in next st] twice, yo and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
measurements: Cake measures 20” tall x 16” diameter.
gauge: 20 sts = 4”; 20 rounds = 4” in sc with larger hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
CAKE
Top Layer (8” Diameter)
Round 1: With larger hook and A, ch 2; 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with a slip st in first sc – 6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, [inc] 6 times; do NOT join – 12 sc. Work in continuous rounds until otherwise indicated. Mark beginning of each round and move marker up each round.
Round 3: [Inc, sc in next sc] 6 times – 18 sc.
Round 4: [Inc, sc in next 2 sc] 6 times – 24 sc.
Round 5: [Inc, sc in next 3 sc] 6 times – 30 sc.
Round 6: [Inc, sc in next 4 sc] 6 times – 36 sc.
Round 7: [Inc, sc in next 5 sc] 6 times – 42 sc.
Round 8: [Inc, sc in next 6 sc] 6 times – 48 sc.
Round 9: [Inc, sc in next 7 sc] 6 times – 54 sc.
Round 10: [Inc, sc in next 8 sc] 6 times – 60 sc.
Round 11: [Inc, sc in next 9 sc] 6 times – 66 sc.
Round 12: [Inc, sc in next 10 sc] 6 times – 72 sc.
Round 13: [Inc, sc in next 11 sc] 6 times – 78 sc.
Round 14: [Inc, sc in next 12 sc] 6 times – 84 sc.
Round 15: [Inc, sc in next 13 sc] 6 times – 90 sc.
Round 16: [Inc, sc in next 14 sc] 6 times – 96 sc.
Round 17: [Inc, sc in next 15 sc] 6 times – 102 sc.
Round 18: Sc in back loops only of each sc around; join with a slip st in first sc.
Rounds 19-33: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join.
Bobble Round 34: * [Yo and draw up a loop in front loop] 3 times in same front loop, yo and draw through all 7 loops on hook, ch 1 tightly, slip st in front loop of next sc; repeat from * around. Fasten off.
Top Layer Bottom Piece
Repeat Rounds 1-17 of Top Layer. Fasten off.
Middle Layer (12” Diameter)
Rounds 1-17: Repeat Rounds 1-17 of Top Layer.
Round 18: [Inc, sc in next 16 sc] 6 times – 108 sc.
Round 19: [Inc, sc in next 17 sc] 6 times – 114 sc.
Round 20: [Inc, sc in next 18 sc] 6 times – 120 sc.
Round 21: [Inc, sc in next 19 sc] 6 times – 126 sc.
Round 22: [Inc, sc in next 20 sc] 6 times – 132 sc.
Round 23: [Inc, sc in next 21 sc] 6 times – 138 sc.
Round 24: [Inc, sc in next 22 sc] 6 times – 144 sc.
Round 25: [Inc, sc in next 23 sc] 6 times – 150 sc.
Round 26: [Inc, sc in next 24 sc] 6 times – 156 sc.
Round 27: [Inc, sc in next 25 sc] 6 times – 162 sc.
Round 28: Sc in back loops only of each sc around; join with a slip st in first sc.
Rounds 29-44: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join.
Round 45: Repeat Bobble Round 34 of Top Layer.
Middle Layer Bottom Piece
Repeat Rounds 1-27 of Middle Layer. Fasten off.
Bottom Layer (16” Diameter)
Rounds 1-27: With C, repeat Rounds 1-27 of Middle Layer.
Round 28: [Inc, sc in next 26 sc] 6 times – 168 sc.
Round 29: [Inc, sc in next 27 sc] 6 times – 174 sc.
Round 30: [Inc, sc in next 28 sc] 6 times – 180 sc.
Round 31: [Inc, sc in next 29 sc] 6 times – 186 sc.
Round 32: [Inc, sc in next 30 sc] 6 times – 192 sc.
Round 33: [Inc, sc in next 31 sc] 6 times – 198 sc.
Round 34: [Inc, sc in next 32 sc] 6 times – 204 sc.
Round 35: [Inc, sc in next 33 sc] 6 times – 210 sc.
Round 36: [Inc, sc in next 34 sc] 6 times – 216 sc.
Round 37: [Inc, sc in next 35 sc] 6 times – 222 sc.
Round 38: [Inc, sc in next 36 sc] 6 times – 228 sc.
Round 39: Sc in back loops only of each sc around; join with a slip st in first sc.
Rounds 40-55: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join.
Round 56: Repeat Bobble Round 34 of Top Layer.
Bottom Layer Bottom Piece
Repeat Rounds 1-38 of Bottom Layer. Fasten off.
HEART TOPPER (Make 2)
Row 1 (Wrong Side): With smaller hook and B, ch 2; 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook; turn – 8 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, [inc] 8 times; turn – 16 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, [sc in next sc, inc] 3 times, sc in next 4 sc, [inc, sc in next sc] 3 times; turn – 22 sc.
Row 4: Ch 1, sc in first sc, [inc, sc in next 2 sc] twice, inc, sc in next 6 sc, [inc, sc in next 2 sc] twice, inc, sc in last sc; turn – 28 sc.
Row 5: Ch 1, [sc in 3 sc, inc] 3 times, sc in next 4 sc, [inc, sc in next 3 sc] 3 times; turn – 34 sc.
Row 6: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sc, [inc] twice, sc in next 12 sc, [inc] twice, sc in next 12 sc, [inc] twice, sc in last 2 sc; turn – 40 sc.
Row 7: Ch 1, skip first sc, sc in next 6 sc, [inc] twice, sc in next 22 sc, [inc] twice, sc in next 5 sc, skip next sc, sc in last sc; turn – 42 sc.
Row 8: Ch 1, skip first sc, sc in next 3 sc, [inc] 3 times, sc in next 28 sc, [inc] 3 times, sc in next 2 sc, skip next sc, sc in last sc; turn – 46 sc.
Row 9: Ch 1, skip first sc, sc in next 4 sc, inc, sc in next 2 sc, inc, sc in next 28 sc, inc, sc in next 2 sc, inc, sc in next 3 sc, skip next sc, sc in last sc; turn – 48 sc.
Row 10: Ch 1, skip first sc, sc in next 5 sc, inc, sc in next 3 sc, inc, sc in next 26 sc, inc, sc in next 3 sc, inc, sc in next 4 sc, skip next sc, sc in last sc; turn – 50 sc.
Row 11: Ch 1, skip first sc, sc in next 7 sc, inc, sc in next 2 sc, inc, sc in next 26 sc, inc, sc in next 2 sc, inc, sc in next 6 sc, skip next sc, sc in last sc; turn – 52 sc.
Row 12: Ch 1, skip first sc, sc in next 24 sc, [inc] twice, sc in next 23 sc, skip next sc, sc in last sc; do NOT turn; working across row ends, work 7 sc evenly to center of heart, slip st in middle of heart, work 7 sc evenly across next row ends; join with a slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
SMALL HEART (Make 8)
Row 1 (Right Side): With smaller hook and B, ch 2; 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; turn – 6 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, [inc] 6 times; turn – 12 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in first sc, [inc, sc in next sc] twice, 3 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc, [inc, sc in next sc] twice; do NOT turn; working across row ends, work 2 sc to center, slip st in center of heart, work 2 sc across next row ends; join with a slip st in first sc. Fasten off.
Optional Stiffening
To stiffen small hearts: soak in a mixture of 2 parts white glue and 1 part water; lay flat on waxed paper and allow to dry completely before handling.
ROSE (Make 15 each with C and D)
With smaller hook, ch 41.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 40 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, [inc, sc in next sc] 3 times, [2 hdc in next sc] 3 times, slip st in next 2 sc, [2 hdc in next sc, hdc in next sc] 3 times, slip st in next 2 sc, hdc in next sc, [2 dc in next sc] 8 times, slip st in next 2 sc, hdc in next 2 sc, dc in next 4 sc, hdc in next 4 sc; turn – 57 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in first 4 hdc, [2 hdc in next st] twice, [2 dc in next st] 3 times, sc in next 4 sts, hdc in next st, [2 hdc in next st] twice, [2 dc in next st] 3 times, slip st in next 2 sts, 2 hdc in next st, [2 dc in next st] 5 times, slip st in next st, skip next st, slip st in next st, 2 hdc in next st, [2 dc in next st] 7 times, slip st in next st, skip next st, [sc2tog] 3 times, [2 hdc in next st] 3 times, [sc2tog] 4 times; do NOT turn; rotate piece to work across row ends; work 3 sc across row ends, work sc2tog across foundation ch to gather. Fasten off leaving long tail for finishing.
ROSE BUD (Make 2 each with C and D)
With smaller hook, ch 16.
Row 1: Hdc in 3rd ch from hook and next 2 ch, dc in next 10 ch, 2 dc in last ch; turn – 15 sts.
Row 2: Ch 2, hdc in first dc, [2 hdc in next dc] twice, hdc in next dc, dc in next dc, [2 dc in next dc, dc in next dc] twice, dc in next 5 sts, 2 dc in last hdc; turn – 20 sts.
Row 3: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in first 2 dc, skip next dc, sc in next dc, sc2tog, sc in next 3 dc, [2 hdc in next dc] 3 times, [sc2tog] 4 times; do NOT turn; rotate piece to work across row ends; work 2 sc across row ends, work sc2tog across foundation ch to gather. Fasten off leaving long tail for finishing.
LEAVES (Make 21)
With smaller hook and E, ch 6; join with a slip st to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 2 sc in each ch around – 12 sc.
Rounds 2-6: Sc in each sc around.
Round 7: [Sc2tog, sc in next sc] 4 times – 8 sc.
Round 8: [Sc2tog] 4 times – 4 sc.
Round 9: [Sc2tog] twice – 2 sc. Fasten off, closing sts and weaving end. Leave long tail for finishing.
FINISHING
Place cake Layer top side down on a flat surface. Insert cardboard round, if using optional quilt batting, wrap cardboard round first, then place inside the piece. Sew Bottom Piece to Layer, whip-stitching through remaining loop of Bobble Round and both loops of last round of Bottom Piece until it is a little over half way attached. Insert 2nd cardboard round. Begin stuffing firmly. Continue to sew and stuff the piece, smoothing the stuffing along the sides of the cake. Make certain the first cardboard round and stuffing is evenly placed by re-arranging stuffing and cardboard as needed. Repeat for other 2 layers.
For optional Velcro to hold layers together, attach 4” lengths using sewing needle and thread: for heart topper and top layer use 3 lengths, middle use 5, and for bottom use 7 or more Velcro lengths.
HEART TOPPER
Using water soluble marker, sketch desired number onto crocheted heart. Embroider numbers onto heart topper using metallic embroidery thread and satin stitch or by sewing metallic cording into desired number shape. Lay crocheted heart on red felt, trace around heart and cut out. Make 2. Use felt cut out to trace heart onto cardboard and cut out. Sandwich crochet heart, felt heart, cardboard, felt heart and 2nd crocheted heart together. Join heart edges through the 2 layers; ch 1 and matching st for st, sc through both crocheted heart layers in each sc around; join. Fasten off, leaving one yarn tail.
FLOWERS
To form roses and buds, wind roses and buds into spirals, tack in place using long yarn tail. Attach leaves to underside of roses using yarn tail. Leave remaining yarn tail for attaching to cake. Stack and fasten the cake layers. Attach 4 roses and 4 buds in circular fashion in middle of the top layer. Sew the heart topper in place by anchoring to the rose petals, using yarn tails.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g; 120 yds/109 m)
Soil Contrast A Warm Brown (01130) 1 ball (Small Pot Version: 19 yds/17 m; Large Pot Version: 32 yds/30 m)
Aloe Vera Contrast B Mod Green (01223) 1 ball or 42 yds/39 m
