Snake Plant Contrast C Dark Pine (00016) 1 ball or 42 yds/39 m
Contrast D Hot Green (01712) 1 ball or 17 yds/16 m
Succulent Contrast E Teal (01133) 1 ball or 15 yds/14 m
Size U.S. G/6 (4 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: To fit into 31/8" [8 cm] or 37/8" [10 cm] plant pot. Aloe Vera: Approx 6" [15 cm] tall (excluding pot). Snake Plant: Approx 6" [15 cm] tall (excluding pot). Succulent: Approx 1½" [4 cm] tall (excluding pot).
gauge: 15 sc and 16 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
SOIL
Bottom
**With A, ch 2. 1st rnd: 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc. 3rd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in first sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc. 4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.** Large Size only: 5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sc. 6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sc. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * to last sc. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 48 sc.***
Both Sizes: Next rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Next 2 rnds: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off at end of 2nd rnd.
Top
Small Size only: Work from ** to ** as given above (4 rnds). Fasten off.
Large Size only: Work from ** to *** as given above (6 rnds). Fasten off.
Both Sizes: Sew Top to edge of Bottom, leaving opening for stuffing. Stuff lightly. Sew rem seam closed.

ALOE VERA
See chart on page 3.
With B, **ch 21. 1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 1 hdc in each of next 3 ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. 1 tr in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 2nd row: Ch 4 (counts as tr). Working in front loops only, 1 tr in each of next 10 tr. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Turn. 3rd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 1 tr in each tr to end of row.** 1 Triangle made. Do not fasten off. Rep from ** to ** once more. Do not fasten off.
***With B, ch 16. Next row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 1 hdc in each of next 3 ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. 1 tr in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 2nd row: Ch 4 (counts as tr). Working in front loops only, 1 tr in each of next 5 tr. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Turn. 3rd row: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each of first 3 sc. 1 hdc in each of next 3 hdc. 1 dc in each of next 3 dc. 1 tr in each tr to end of row. ***
Rep from *** to *** twice more. 5 Triangles total. Fasten off. Sew foundation ch and last row of each Triangle tog, forming Spikes. Stuff Spikes lightly. Sew Spikes to Soil as seen in picture.

SNAKE PLANT
See chart on page 3.
Large Leaf (make 4)
With C, ch 21.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 1 hdc in each of next 3 ch. 1 dc in each of next 8 ch. 1 hdc in each of next 3 ch. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working across opposite side of foundation ch, 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 1 hdc in each of next 3 ch. 1 dc in each of next 8 ch. 1 hdc in each of next 3 ch. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. Fasten off.
With RS facing, join D with sl st to first sc of 1st row.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 20 sts. (1 sc. Ch 2. Slip st in first ch. 2 sc) in next st. 1 sc in each of last 20 sts. Fasten off.

Small Leaf (make 2)
With C, ch 16.
1st row: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 1 hdc in each of next 3 ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. 1 hdc in each of next 3 ch. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working across opposite side of foundation ch, 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 1 hdc in each of next 3 ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. 1 hdc in each of next 3 ch. 1 sc in each of next 3 ch. Fasten off.
With RS facing, join D with sl st to first sc of 1st row.
2nd row: (RS). Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 15 sts. (1 sc. Ch 2. Slip st in first ch. 2 sc) in next st. 1 sc in each of last 15 sts. Fasten off.
Insert craft wire through center of each Leaf leaving a long end at base. Arrange Leaves inserting wires into Soil as seen in picture. Sew base of Leaves to Soil.

SUCCULENT
See chart on page 3.
With E, ch 73.
1st row: 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Ch 2. Sl st in same ch as last hdc. [Sl st in each of next 2 ch. (Ch 2. 1 hdc. Ch 2. Sl st) in same ch as last sl st] 7 times. [Sl st in each of next 3 ch. (Ch 3. 2 dc. Ch 3. Sl st) in same ch as last sl st] 8 times. [Sl st in each of next 4 ch. (Ch 3. 3 dc. Ch 3. Sl st) in same ch as last sl st] 8 times. Fasten off.
Coil work into spiral with beg of row at center. Sew into position on Soil as seen in picture.

materials: RED HEART® “Holiday”: 1 ball each 1360 Aran/Gold A
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Chirper is 7” long from tip of beak to tip of tail.
gauge: 16 sc = 4”; 16 rounds = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the specified gauge.
instructions:
BODY
With C, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Place marker for beginning of round.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around – 12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] around – 18 sc.
Round 4: Sc in each sc around.
Round 5: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] around – 24 sc.
Rounds 6-15: Sc in each sc around.
Round 16: [Sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog] around – 18 sc.
Round 17: Sc in each sc around.
Round 18: [Sc in next sc, sc2tog] around – 12 sc. Stuff with polyester filling.
Round 19: [Sc2tog] around. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Stuff tightly.
Thread tail through remaining sts and pull to close. Knot to secure.
HEAD
With B, ch 2.
Rounds 1-3: Work as for Body – 18 sc.
Rounds 4-9: Sc in each sc around.
Round 10: [Sc2tog] around – 9 sc.
Round 11: Working in front loops only, 2 sc in each sc around – 18 sc.
Round 12: Sc in next sc, hdc in next 2 sc, [2 hdc] in each of next 2 sc, hdc in next sc, [2 hdc] in each of next 2 sc, hdc in next 2 sc, sc in last 8 sc. Fasten off. Stuff tightly and sew onto Body.
WING
(Make 2) 
With A, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around – 12 sc.
Round 3: Sc in each sc around.
Round 4: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] around – 15 sc.
Round 5: Sc in each sc around.
Round 6: [Sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog] around – 12 sc.
Rounds 7-11: Sc across to last 2 sc, sc2tog – 7 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Thread tail through remaining sts and pull to close. Knot to secure.
TAIL
With C, ch 6.
Round 1: Work sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 3 ch, 3 sc in last ch, turn to work along opposite side of foundation ch, sc in next 3 ch, 2 sc in last ch – 12 sc.
Rounds 2-9: Sc in each sc around.
Round 10: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] around – 18 sc. Fasten off. Sew running stitches through both thicknesses at Round 4. Stuff lightly. Sew in place.
BEAK
With D, ch 4.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, hdc in next ch, dc in last ch.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in first 2 sts, slip st in last st. Fasten off. Fold in half and sew together. Sew in place.
FINISHING
Embroider eyes with French knot with D. Fold a length of ribbon in half and sew ends on Chirper for hanging. Weave in ends.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 1 ball each 494 Victory Red A, 487 Dark Royal B, 480 Delft C, 805 Blue Hawaii D, and 210 Antique White E.
abbreviations: A, B, C, etc. = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Doily measures about 13” [33cm] diameter.
gauge: 34 sts = about 4” [10 cm]; 15 rounds = 4” [10 cm] in double crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
With A, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 4 (counts as dc, ch 1), dc in ring, [ch 1, dc in ring] 8 times, ch 1; join with slip st in 3rd ch of beginning ch-4—10 dc and 10 ch-1 spaces.
Round 2: Ch 1, sc in same st as joining, [2 sc in next ch-1 space, sc in next dc] 9 times, 2 sc in last ch-1 space; join with slip st in first sc—30 sc.
Round 3: Ch 20, skip next st, slip st in next st, [ch 20, skip next st, slip st in next st] 13 times, ch 20, skip last st, slip st in same st as joining—15 ch-20 spaces.
Fasten off A.
Round 4: With right side facing, join B with sc in any ch-20 space, sc again in same ch-20 space, [ch 4, 2 sc in next ch-20 space] twice, *ch 7, 2 sc in next ch-20 space, [ch 4, 2 sc in next ch-20 space] twice; repeat from * 3 more times, ch 7; join with slip st in first sc—30 sc, 5 ch-7 spaces, and 10 ch-4 spaces (2 ch-4 spaces and 6 sc along each of 5 sides between ch-7 spaces).
Round 5: Ch 2 (does not count as a st), dc in last ch-7 space of Round 4 (you may need to angle the hook backwards slightly to reach the last ch-7 space), *[skip next 2 sc, 5 hdc in next ch-4 space] twice, skip next 2 sc, (7 dc, ch 3, 7 dc) in next ch-7 space (corner made); rep from * 3 more times, [skip next 2 sc, 5 hdc in next ch-4 space] twice, skip last 2 sc, (7 dc, ch 3, 6 dc) in same ch-7 space as first dc; join with slip st in first dc—Ten 5-dc groups and five (7 dc, ch 3, 7 dc) corners (two 5-hdc groups along each of 5 sides between corners).
Fasten off B.
Round 6: With right side facing, join C with slip st in any corner ch-3 space, ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout), (dc, ch 3, 2 dc) in same ch-3 space, *dc in next 3 dc, ch 2, skip next 4 dc, Fptr around next 2 sc 2 rounds below (work the Fptr all the way around the 2 sc held together, as if working around one stitch) , 2 dc in space between last skipped dc and next hdc, ch 2, skip next 5 hdc, Fptr around next 2 sc 2 rounds below, 2 dc in space between last skipped hdc and next hdc, ch 2, skip next 5 hdc, Fptr around next 2 sc 2 rounds below, 2 dc in space between last skipped hdc and next dc, ch 2, skip next 4 dc, dc in next 3 dc **, corner-shell in next corner ch-3 space; repeat from * 4 more times ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—15 (Fptr, 2 dc) groups, and 20 ch-2 spaces (3 (Fptr, 2 dc) groups and 4 ch-2 spaces along each of 5 sides).
Fasten off C.
Round 7: With right side facing, join D with slip st in any corner ch-3 space, ch 1, (2 sc, ch 3, 2 sc) in same ch-3 space, *sc in next 5 dc, [ch 2, skip next ch-2 space, Fphdc around next Fptr, sc in next 2 dc] 3 times, ch 2, skip next ch-2 space, sc in next 5 dc **, (2 sc, ch 3, 2 sc) in next ch-3 space; repeat from * 4 more times ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in first sc—15 Fphdc, and 20 ch-2 spaces (3 Fphdc and 4 ch-2 spaces along each of 5 sides).
Round 8: Ch 1, sc in same sc as joining, sc in next sc, (2 sc, ch 3, 2 sc) in next corner ch-3 space, *sc in next 7 sc, [ch 2, skip next ch-2 space, Fphdc around next Fphdc, sc in next 2 sc] 3 times, ch 2, skip next ch-2 space, sc in next 7 sc **, (2 sc, ch 3, 2 sc) in next corner ch-3 space; repeat from * 4 more times ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off.
Round 9: With right side facing, join B with slip st in any corner ch-3 space, ch 3, (dc, ch 3, 2 dc) in same ch-3 space, *dc in next 4 sc, ch 3, skip next 5 sc, V-st in next ch-2 space, [ch 1, skip next Fphdc, skip next 2 sc, V-st in next ch-2 space] 3 times, ch 3, skip next 5 sc, dc in next 4 sc **, corner-shell in next corner ch-3 space; repeat from * 4 more times ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—20 V-sts (4 V-sts along each of 5 sides).
Fasten off B.
Round 10: With right side facing, join C with slip st in any corner ch-3 space, ch 3, (dc, ch 3, 2 dc) in same ch-3 space, *dc in next 4 dc, ch 3, skip next 2 dc, skip next ch-3 space, sm-shell in ch-1 space of next V-st, [ch 1, sm-shell in ch-1 space of next V-st] 3 times, ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, skip next 2 dc, dc in next 4 dc **, corner-shell in next corner ch-3 space; repeat from * 4 more times ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—20 sm-shells (4 sm-shells along each of 5 sides).
Fasten off C.
Round 11: With right side facing, join D with slip st in any corner ch-3 space, ch 3, (dc, ch 3, 2 dc) in same ch-3 space, *dc in next 4 dc, ch 2, skip next ch-3 space, 4 dc in ch-1 space of next 4 sm-shells, ch 2, skip next ch-3 space, skip next 2 dc, dc in next 4 dc **, corner-shell in next corner ch-3 space; repeat from * 4 more times ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—140 dc, 10 ch-2 spaces (four 4-dc groups and 2 ch-2 spaces along each of 5 sides).
Fasten off D.
Round 12: With right side facing, join E with slip st in any corner ch-3 space, ch 3, (dc, ch 3, 2 dc) in same ch-3 space, *dc in next 4 dc, ch 2, skip next ch-2 space, dc in next 4 dc, [ch 1, dc in next 4 dc] 3 times, ch 2, skip next ch-2 space, skip next 2 dc, dc in next 4 dc **, corner-shell in next corner ch-3 space; repeat from * 4 more times ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—Four 4-dc groups, 2 ch-2 spaces, and 3 ch-1 spaces along each of 5 sides.
Fasten off E.
Round 13: With right side facing, join A with slip st in any corner ch-3 space, ch 4 (counts as tr), (tr, ch 3, 2 tr) in same ch-3 space, *tr in next 4 dc, ch 5, skip next 2 dc, slip st in next ch-2 space, [ch 10, skip next 4 dc, slip st in next ch-1 space] 3 times, ch 10, skip next 4 dc, slip st in next ch-2 space, ch 5, skip next 2 dc, tr in next 4 dc **, (2 tr, ch 3, 2 tr) in next corner ch-3 space; repeat from * 4 more times ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-4—4 ch-10 spaces and 2 ch-5 spaces along each of 5 sides.
Fasten off A.
Round 14: With right side facing, join E with slip st in any corner ch-3 space, ch 3, (dc, ch 3, 2 dc) in same ch-3 space, *dc in next 4 tr, ch 4, skip next 2 tr, dc in next ch-5 space, [ch 4, dc in next ch-10 space] 4 times, ch 4, dc in next ch-5 space, ch 4, skip next 2 tr, dc in next 4 tr **, corner-shell in next corner ch-3 space; repeat from * 4 more times ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—7 ch-4 spaces along each of 5 sides.
Round 15: Ch 1, sc in same st as join, sc in next dc, (2 sc, ch 3, 2 sc) in next corner ch-3 space, *sc in next 6 dc, ch 2, 3 sc in next ch-4 space, [ch 3, skip next dc, 3 sc in next ch-4 space] 6 times, ch 2 **, sc in next 6 dc, (2 sc, ch 3, 2 sc) in next corner ch-3 space; repeat from * 4 more times ending last repeat at **, sc in last 4 dc; join with slip st in first sc—Seven 3-sc groups along each of 5 sides.
Fasten off E.
Round 16: With right side facing, join B with slip st in any corner ch-3 space, ch 3, (dc, ch 3, 2 dc) in same ch-3 space, *dc in next 8 sc, ch 3, skip next ch-2 space, skip next 3 sc, 2 dc in next ch-3 space, Fptr around next dc 2 rounds below, [ch 3, skip next 3 sc, 2 dc in next ch-3 space, Fptr around next dc 2 rounds below] 5 times, ch 3, skip next 3 sc, skip next ch-2 space, dc in next 8 sc **, corner-shell in next corner ch-3 space; repeat from * 4 more times ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—6 (2 dc, Fptr) groups and 7 ch-3 spaces along each of 5 sides.
Fasten off B.
Round 17: With right side facing, join C with slip st in any corner ch-3 space, ch 3, (dc, ch 3, 2 dc) in same ch-3 space, *dc in next 8 dc, ch 4, skip next 2 dc, skip next ch-3 space, dc in next 2 dc, Fpdc around next Fptr, [ch 3, dc in next 2 dc, Fpdc around next Fptr] 5 times, ch 4, skip next ch-3 space, skip next 2 dc, dc in next 8 dc **, corner-shell in next ch-3 space; repeat from * 4 more times ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—6 (2 dc, Fpdc) groups, 5 ch-3 spaces, and 2 ch-4 spaces along each of 5 sides.
Fasten off C.
Round 18: With right side facing, join D with slip st in any corner ch-3 space, ch 3, (dc, ch 3, 2 dc) in same ch-3 space, *dc in next 8 dc, ch 4, skip next 2 dc, skip next ch-4 space, dc in next 2 dc, Fpdc around next Fpdc, [ch 4, dc in next 2 dc, Fpdc around next Fpdc] 5 times, ch 4, skip next ch-4 space, skip next 2 dc, dc in next 8 dc **, corner-shell in next corner ch-3 space; repeat from * 4 more times ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—6 (2 dc, Fpdc) and 7 ch-4 spaces along each of 5 sides.
Fasten off D.
Round 19: With right side facing, join B with slip st in any corner ch-3 space, ch 3, (dc, ch 3, 2 dc) in same ch-3 space, *dc in next 6 dc, ch 3, skip next 4 dc, sm-shell in next ch-4 space, [ch 1, sm-shell in next ch-4 space] 6 times, ch 3, skip next 4 dc, dc in next 6 dc **, corner-shell in next corner ch-3 space; repeat from * 4 more times ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—7 sm-shells along each of 5 sides.
Fasten off B.
Round 20: With right side facing, join C with slip st in any corner ch-3 space, ch 3, (dc, ch 3, 2 dc) in same ch-3 space, *dc in next 6 dc, ch 3, skip next 2 dc, skip next ch-3 space, lg-shell in ch-1 space of each of next 7 sm-shells, ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, skip next 2 dc, dc in next 6 dc **, corner-shell in next corner ch-3 space; repeat from * 4 more times ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—7 lg-shells along each of 5 sides.
Fasten off C.
Round 21: With right side facing, join D with slip st in any corner ch-3 space, ch 3, (dc, ch 3, 2 dc) in same ch-3 space, *dc in next 6 dc, ch 3, skip next 2 dc, skip next ch-3 space, 6 dc in ch-1 space of next lg-shells, [ch 2, 6 dc in ch-1 space of next lg-shell] 6 times, ch 3, skip next ch-3 space, skip next 2 dc, dc in next 6 dc **, corner-shell in next corner ch-3 space; repeat from * 4 more times ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—Seven 6-dc groups along each of 5 sides.
Fasten off D.
Round 22: With right side facing, join E with slip st in any corner ch-3 space, ch 3, (dc, ch 3, 2 dc) in same ch-3 space, *dc in next 6 dc, ch 4, skip next 2 dc, skip next ch-3 space, dc in next 6 dc, [ch 2, skip next ch-2 space, dc in next 6 dc] 6 times, ch 4, skip next ch-3 space, skip next 2 dc, dc in next 6 dc **, corner-shell in next corner ch-3 space; repeat from * 4 more times ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—Seven 6-dc groups along each of 5 sides.
Fasten off E.
Round 23: With right side facing, join A with slip st in any corner ch-3 space, ch 3, 6 dc in same ch-3 space, *dc in next 2 dc, ch 1, picot, ch 1, skip next 6 dc, 6 dc in next ch-4 space, ch 1, picot, ch 1, [skip next 6 dc, 4 dc in next ch-2 space, ch 1, picot, ch 1] 6 times, 6 dc in next ch-4 space, ch 1, picot, ch 1, skip next 6 dc, dc in next 2 dc **, 7 dc in next corner ch-3 space; repeat from * 4 more times ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—9 picots along each of 5 sides.
Fasten off A.
FINISHING
Weave in any ends. Block piece, using stiffener if desired.

materials: Lily® Sugar’n Cream (Solids: 70.9 g/2.5 oz/109 m/120 yds)
Lily® Sugar’n Cream (Ombres: 56.7 g/2 oz/86 m/95 yds)
Size 4 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge
abbreviations: Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 (3) sc. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Tomato: Approx 3 ins [7.5 cm] wide. Carrot: Approx 6 ins [15 cm] long (excluding leaves). Corn Cob: Approx 6 ½ ins [16.5 cm] long. Eggplant: Approx 7½ ins [19 cm] long. Radish: Approx 2 ins [5 cm] long.
gauge: 15 sc and 16 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions:
TOMATO
With A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Join with sl st in first sc. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join with sl st in first sc. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 3 sc. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Join with sl st in first sc. 30 sc.
7th and 8th rnds: As 5th rnd.
9th rnd: Ch 1. *Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook - sc2tog made. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * 4 times more. Join with sl st to first sc. 25 sc.
10th rnd: As 5th rnd.
11th rnd: Ch 1. *Sc2tog over next 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * 4 times more. Join with sl st to first sc. 20 sc.
12th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join MC with sl st to first sc. Break A. Stuff tomato.
13th rnd: With MC, ch 1. *Sc2tog over next 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * 4 times more. Join with sl st to first sc. 15 sc.
14th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loop only of each st, *Sc2tog over next 2 sts. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * 4 times more. Join with sl st to first sc. 10 sc.
15th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog over next 2 sts) 5 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 5 sc. Fasten off leaving a long end. Thread end onto tapestry needle and draw through final 5 sc tightly. Using same end, ch 4. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 2 ch. Sl st in same sp as where ch originated. Fasten off.
Leaves: With RS facing, join MC in any rem loop of 13th rnd. Ch 3. Sl st back into same sc as first sl st. *Sl st in each of next 2 loops. Ch 3. Sl st back into same sc as last sl st. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first loop. Fasten off.

CARROT
With D, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. 2 sc in each sc around. Join B with sl st in first sc. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Working in back loop only of each sc, ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. (2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) twice. 2 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 15 sc.
4th to 7th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. (Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook- Sc2tog made. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) twice. Sc2tog over next 2 sts. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
9th to 14th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
Stuff top end of Carrot. Cont stuffing as you work to end.
15th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in next sc. (Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) twice. Sc2tog over next 2 sts. Join with sl st to first sc. 9 sc.
16th to 20th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
21st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. (Sc2tog over next 2 sts. 1 sc in next sc) twice. Sc2tog over next 2 sts. Join with sl st to first sc. 6 sc.
22nd to 24th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
25th rnd: Ch 1. ( Draw up a loop in each of next 3 sc. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook- Sc3tog made) twice. Join with sl st in first st. Fasten off.
Leaves (make 2).
With MC, ch 13.
Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 6 ch, placing a marker on last ch. Ch 10. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 8 ch. Sl st in marked ch. Ch 7. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 5 ch. Sl st in marked ch. Sl st in each of last 5 ch. Fasten off. Sew leaves to top of carrot.

CORN COB
With C, ch 20.
1st row: (WS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each ch to end. 19 sc. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. Sl st in first sc. *1 tr in next sc. Sl st in next sc. Rep from * across. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st across. Turn.
Rep last 2 rows 5 times more, then 2nd row once. Fasten off leaving a long end. Sew foundation row to final row. Thread end onto tapestry needle and weave tightly through one end of Cob and fasten securely. Stuff Cob. Weave yarn tightly through opposite end and fasten securely.
Leaves (make 3).
With MC, ch 25.
1st row: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. 1 tr in each of next 12 ch. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 sc in each of last 3 ch. Fasten off. Sew leaves to corn cob.

EGGPLANT
With D, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. *1 sc in next sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last sc. 1 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 18 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 5 sc. 1 sc in each of last 5 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 28 sc.
7th rnd: As 5th rnd.
8th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 6 sc. 1 sc in each of last 6 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.
9th rnd: As 5th rnd.
10th rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. *1 sc in each of next 7 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Rep from * to last 7 sc. 1 sc in each of last 7 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 36 sc.
11th to 14th rnds: As 5th rnd.
15th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. (Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook- Sc2tog made. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc) 3 times. Sc2tog over next 2 sts. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc.
16th rnd: As 5th rnd.
17th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. (Sc2tog over next 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc) 3 times. Sc2tog over next 2 sts. Join with sl st to first sc. 28 sc.
18th rnd: As 5th rnd.
19th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. (Sc2tog over next 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc) 3 times. Sc2tog over next 2 sts. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc.
20th to 24th rnds: As 5th rnd.
25th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. (Sc2tog over next 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc) twice. Sc2tog over next 2 sts. Join with sl st to first sc. 20 sc.
26th rnd: As 5th rnd. Join MC with sl st in first sc. Break D.
27th rnd: With MC, as 5th rnd.
Stuff eggplant.
28th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loop only of each st, 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. (Sc2tog over next 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc) 3 times. Sc2tog over next 2 sts. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc.
29th rnd: As 5th rnd.
30th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in next sc. (Sc2tog over next 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc) twice. Sc2tog over next 2 sts. Join with sl st to first sc. 12 sc.
31st rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog over next 2 sts) 6 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 6 sc. Fasten off leaving a long end. Thread end onto tapestry needle and draw through final 6 sc tightly. Using same end, ch 5. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and each of next 3 ch. Sl st in same sp as where ch originated. Fasten off.
Stem Edging: With RS facing, join MC in any rem loop of 28th rnd. Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp. *Miss next sc. Sl st in next sc. Ch 3. 1 dc in same sp. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first st. Fasten off.

RADISH
With D, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join A with sl st to first sc. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: With A, ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc. 12 sc.
3rd and 4th rnds: Ch 1. 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st in first sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. ( Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook- sc2tog made. 1 sc in next sc) 3 times. Sc2tog over next 2 sts. Join with sl st in first sc. 8 sc.
Stuff radish.
6th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog over next 2 sts) 4 times. Join with sl st to first sc. 4 sc. Fasten off leaving a long end. Thread end onto tapestry needle and draw through final 4 sc tightly. Using same end, ch 3. Sl st in 2nd ch from hook and next ch. Sl st in same sp as where ch originated. Fasten off.
Leaves (make 2).
With MC, ch 16.
1st rnd: 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. 1 tr in each of next 4 ch. Ch 4. Sl st back into last ch. Sl st in next ch. Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 sc in next ch. 3 sc in last ch (placing a marker on center sc). Working along opposite side of ch into rem loops, 1 sc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. Ch 3. Sl st back into last ch. Sl st in next ch. Ch 4. 1 tr in same sp. 1 tr in each of next 3 ch. 1 dc in each of next 3 ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 sc in last ch. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Stem: Join MC with sl st in marked sc. Ch 8. Sl st in top of Radish. Sl st in each ch back to Leaf. Fasten off.

materials: YARN MEDIUM 4 • Red Heart® All in One™ Granny Square™ (8.8 oz/250 g; 417 yds/381 m)
COLORS Quantity • Frigid (2004) 1 ball (4 Granny Squares) or 200 yds/183 m
Note: 1 ball will make 2 Arm Cozies.
TOOLS • Size U.S. I/9 (5.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: To fit square couch arm – Approx 6" [15 cm] wide by 10" [25.5 cm] long.
gauge: Motif = Approx 6" [15 cm] square.
instructions: USING THIS GUIDE Click on the underlined words throughout the pattern to access our library of helpful tools. NOTES • Motifs begin with Color 1 (shortest color rep) from center of pull-skein, leaving a 4" [10 cm] tail to weave in. • Each color aligns with 1 round (rnd) in the Motif with 5 colors in total. If too much color is left at end of rnd, pull back some stitches (sts) and slightly loosen gauge to re-work sts and finish at color change. If too little color is left, pull back some sts and slightly tighten gauge to re-work sts and finish at color change. • When Motif is complete, cut yarn where Color 5 (longest color rep) ends, leaving a tail for weaving in. Begin next Motif with Color 1 and repeat 5 rnds for each Motif. • How-to Stitch a Red Heart All-in-One  Granny Square. MOTIF Make 4. With Color 1, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring. 1st rnd:  (RS). Ch 6. (3 dc. Ch 3) 3 times in ring. 2 dc in ring. Join. 2nd rnd:  Sl st in ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join. 3rd rnd:  Sl st in ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *Ch 1. 3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more. Ch 1. 3 dc in last ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join. 4th and 5th rnds:  Sl st in ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same ch-3 sp. *(Ch 1. 3 dc) in each ch-1 sp to next ch-3 sp. Ch 1.** (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * twice more, then from * to ** once. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join. Fasten off. Granny Corner: With yarn needle, join Motifs tog as shown in assembly diagram using whip stitch. Granny Corner made. Edging Note:  To work Edging and Extension, use yarn as ‘self-striping’ yarn, allowing colors to change as they appear. 1st rnd:  (RS). Join yarn with sl st to ch-3 sp at bottom right of Granny Corner. Ch 6. 3 dc in same sp as sl st. Ch 1. *(3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) to next ch-3 sp.** (3 dc. Ch 1) in each of next 2 ch-3 sps. Rep from * once more, then from * to ** once.*** (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) all in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * to *** once. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join. 2nd rnd:  Sl st into ch-3 sp. Ch 6. 3 dc in same sp as sl st. Ch 1. *(3 dc in next ch-1 sp. ch 1) to next ch-3 sp.** (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) all in next ch-3 sp. Ch 1. Rep from * to ** once more. 2 dc in first ch-3 sp. Join with sl st into next ch-3 sp. CONTINUE working in rows as follows for Extension: 1st row:  (RS). Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch-1). (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) to next ch-3 sp. 1 dc in next ch-3 sp. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked. 2nd row:  (WS). Ch 3. 2 dc in first ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) to last ch-1 sp. 2 dc in last ch-1 sp. 1 dc in last dc. Turn. 3rd row:  Ch 4 (counts as dc and ch-1). (3 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1) to last ch-1 sp. 3 dc in last ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 1 dc in last dc. Turn. Rep last 2 rows 4 times more. Fasten off.

materials: Aunt Lydia® Classic™ Crochet Thread size 10 (350 yds/320 m)
Size U.S. 7 (1.5 mm) Susan Bates® Steelite® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Sewing Needle and Dual Duty XP® thread in colors to match: 550 Dark Silver, 5845 Seafoam and 1040 Soft Mauve.
measurements: Approx 3.5" [9 cm] wide
gauge: Hook size 7/1.5 mm hook 36 SC x 40 rows = 4" [10 cm]
instructions:
See Diagram on page 3, Start at one narrow edge.
Ch 27.
1st row: (RS). 1 dc in 4th ch from hook (3 skipped ch count as dc). 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. (Ch 2. Skip next 2 ch. 1 dc in next ch) 6 times. 1 dc in next 2 ch. (1 dc. Ch 2. 1 tr) in last ch. Turn. 1 tr. 13 dc. and 7 ch-2 sps.

2nd row: Ch 6 (counts as tr, ch 2 here and throughout). 3 dc in first ch-2 sp. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in next dc. (Ch 2. Skip next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in next dc) 5 times. Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in top of beg ch-3. Turn. 1 tr, 14 dc and 8 ch-2 sps.

3rd row: Ch 3 (counts as dc here and throughout). 2 dc in first ch-2 sp. 1 dc in next dc. (Ch 2. Skip next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in next dc) 4 times. 2 dc in next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 3. Skip next 3 dc. 1 tr in next ch-2 sp. Ch 3. Skip next 3 dc. 1 dc in next dc. (3 dc. Ch 2. 1 tr) in last ch-6 sp. Turn. 2 tr. 15 dc. 5 ch-2 sps and 2 ch-3 sps.

4th row: Ch 6. 3 dc in first ch-2 sp. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next tr. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. Skip next 3 dc. 1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in next dc. (Ch 2. Skip next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in next dc) 3 times. Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in top of beg ch-3. Turn. 1 tr. 12 dc. 3 sc. 5 ch-2 sps, and 2 ch-3 sps.

5th row: Ch 3. 2 dc in first ch-2 sp. 1 dc in next dc. (Ch 2. Skip next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in next dc) twice. 2 dc in next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 4. Skip next 3 dc. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. 1 sc in next 3 sc. 1 sc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 4. Skip next 3 dc. 1 dc in next dc. (3 dc. Ch 2. 1 tr) in last ch-6 sp. Turn. 1 tr. 13 dc. 5 sc. 3 ch-2 sps and 2 ch-4 sps.

6th row: Ch 3. Skip first ch-2 sp. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. Ch 5. Skip next ch-4 sp. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Ch 5. Skip next ch-4 sp. 1 dc in each of next 4 dc. (Ch 2. Skip next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in next dc) twice. Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in top of beg ch-3. Turn. 12 dc. 5 sc. 3 ch-2 sps and 2 ch-5 sps.

7th row: Ch 3. 2 dc in first ch-2 sp. (Ch 2. Skip next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in next dc) twice. Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in next dc. 3 dc in next ch-5 sp. Ch 4. Skip next sc. 1 sc in next 3 sc. Ch 4. Skip next sc. 3 dc in next ch-5 sp. 1 dc in next dc. Skip next 2 dc. 1 tr in top of beg ch-3. Turn. 1 tr. 14 dc. 3 sc. 3 ch-2 sps and 2 ch-4 sps.

8th row: Ch 3. Skip first 4 sts. 1 dc in next dc. 3 dc in next ch-4 sp. Ch 3. Skip next sc. 1 tr in next sc. Ch 3. Skip next sc. 3 dc in next ch-4 sp. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in next dc. (Ch 2. Skip next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in next dc) 3 times. Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in top of beg ch-3. Turn. 1 tr. 14 dc. 5 ch-2 sps and 2 ch-3 sps.

9th row: Ch 3. 2 dc in first ch-2 sp. 1 dc in next dc. (Ch 2. Skip next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in next dc) 4 times. Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in next dc. 3 dc in next ch-3 sp. Ch 2. Skip next tr. 3 dc in next ch-3 sp. 1 dc in next dc. Skip next 2 dc. 1 tr in top of beg ch-3. Turn. 1 tr. 16 dc and 6 ch-2 sps.

10th row: Ch 3. Skip first 4 sts. 1 dc in next dc. 2 dc in next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in next dc. Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in next dc. (Ch 2. Skip next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in next dc) 5 times. Ch 2. Skip next 2 dc. 1 dc in top of beg ch-3. Turn. 12 dc and 7 ch-2 sps.

11th row: Ch 3. 2 dc in first ch-2 sp. 1 dc in next dc. (Ch 2. Skip next ch-2 sp. 1 dc in next dc) 6 times. 1 dc in next 2 dc. (1 dc. Ch 2. 1 tr) in last dc. Turn. Leave rem ch-3 unworked. Turn. 1 tr. 13 dc and 7 ch-2 sps.

Rep Rows 2nd to 11th rows until piece measures desired length to fit across short end of guest towel, ending on a 10th row. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Trim
With RS facing, join thread at beg of shaped edge. Ch 1. * 3 sc in each of next 5 sps. Ch 2. 3 sc in each of next 5 sps. Rep from * across. Sl st in end of shaped edge. Fasten off.
Weave in ends.
Hand sew lace to towel.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 1 ball 1 White
3” diameter Styrofoam ball (for forming crochet piece)
abbreviations: () = work directions in parentheses into same st
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Each ornament measures about 3” across.
gauge: Each design fits a 3” diameter ball. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
CLUSTER STITCH ORNAMENT (Shown at lower left of photo)
Ch 36; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, sc in same ch as join and in each remaining ch around; join with slip st in first sc—36 sc.

Round 2 (Spoke Round): *Ch 6, 3-trtr-Cl in same st as last slip st made, ch 10, [yarn over] 6 times (7 loops on hook), 4-trtr-Cl in same st, [yarn over and draw through 2 loops on hook] 6 times (1 loop remains on hook); ch 6, slip st in 6th ch from hook (picot made), ch 17, incomplete-3-trtr-Cl in 7th ch from hook (4 loops on hook), [yarn over]10 times (14 loops on hook), insert hook in base of picot and draw up a loop (15 loops on hook), [yarn over and draw through 2 loops on hook] 10 times (long trtr made – 5 loops remain on hook), incomplete-3-trtr-Cl in 6th bar of long trtr (8 loops on hook), yarn over and draw through all 8 loops on hook, [ch 4, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 2 ch] twice, (slip st, ch 6, 3-trtr-Cl) in top of last cluster made, ch 10, slip st in base of picot, ch 6, slip st in 6th ch from hook (picot made), ch 10, (3-trtr-Cl, ch 6 slip st) in same sc as first 2 clusters (spoke completed), slip st in next 6 sc of ring; repeat from * around; join with slip st in same st as first cluster—6 spokes.
Fasten off and weave in ends.

DAISY CHAIN STITCH ORNAMENT (Shown at upper right of photo)
Round 1: Ch 2, 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc.

Round 2 (Spoke Round): Ch 3 (counts as dc), 2 dc in same sc as join, *ch 15, make daisy, ch 25, sc in 11th ch from hook and in next 14 ch, make daisy, sc in last 15 ch (spoke completed)**, 3 dc in next sc; repeat from * around ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—6 spokes.
Fasten off and weave in ends.

FINISHING
Cover 3” Styrofoam ball with plastic wrap. Saturate crochet in stiffener and shape around ball. Allow to dry. When piece is rigid, remove Styrofoam ball and insert satin ball. Tie or sew loops together at top. Using ribbon, tie a bow at the top of ornament and attach an ornament hanger.

materials: Bernat® Blanket Extra Thick™ (21.2 oz/600 g; 72 yds/66 m) Pumpkin (62086) or Vintage White (62008) 1 ball or 55 yds/51 m
Approx. ¼" [6 mm] diameter x 4" [10 cm] long stick or dowel for stem.
abbreviations: Sl stbl = Slip stitch through back loop only
measurements: Approximately (approx) 11" [28 cm] diameter x 8" [20.5 cm] tall, excluding stem.
gauge: 2 single crochet (sc) and 2 rows = 4" [10 cm] using Finger Crochet technique.
instructions:
Notes:
• Finger crochet technique is used. 
• No hook required. 
• Work stitches to fit thumb and first finger – making sure to not pull stitches tight. 
Chain (ch) 11.
1st row: (Right side [RS]). Using pointer finger and thumb: (Pull working yarn up through back loop of first ch and loop on your finger – Slip stitch through back loop (Sl stbl) made) in 2nd ch from last loop. 1 sl stbl in each ch to end of chain. Turn. 10 slip stitches (sl sts).
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sl stbl in each stitch (st) across. Turn.
Repeat (rep) 2nd row until work from beginning (beg) measures approx. 26" [66 cm]. Do not fasten off.
Joining row: Fold work in half, Wrong side (WS) together (tog), so first and last rows meet. Working through both thicknesses, in back loops of last row and remaining (rem) loops of foundation ch: Ch 1. 1 sl st in each st across. Fasten off.
Weave yarn through sts at end of rows on one edge of Pumpkin, pull tight to close bottom and secure on WS.
Stuff Pumpkin.
Weave yarn through sts at end of rows on rem (top) edge of Pumpkin. Insert 4" [10 cm] long stick in opening, leaving 3" [7.5 cm] outside for stem. Pull yarn tight to close opening around stick and tie off. Pull yarn tails inside Pumpkin.

materials: Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 5.0 mm [US H-8] and 3.75 mm [US F-5]
1"(2.5 cm) thick 14" x 10" (35 cm x 25 cm) foam rubber sheet (can substitute quilt batting)
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
( ) = work all directions in parentheses in the indicated stitch or space
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Finished size approximately 28" (71 cm) long, measured from bottom of Beard to tip of Hat.
gauge: 20 sc and 20 rows sc = 4" (10 cm) with larger hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
HAT
With larger hook and B, ch 67, join with slip st to form ring, being careful not to twist.
Round 1 (Right Side): Ch 1 (does not count as a st now and throughout), sc in back bump of in each ch around; do not turn or slip st, place marker (see Notes)—66 sc.
Rounds 2-9: Sc in each sc around.
Round 10: *Sc in 9 sc, Invisible decrease or sc2tog (see Special Stitches); repeat from * around—60 sts.
Round 11: Sc in each st around—60 sc.
Round 12: *Sc in 8 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * around—54 sts.
Round 13: Sc in each st around—54 sc.
Round 14: *Sc in 7 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * around—48 sts.
Rounds 15-19: Sc in each st around—48 sc.
Round 20: *Sc in 6 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * around—42 sts.
Rounds 21-25: Sc in each st around—42 sc.
Round 26: *Sc in 5 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * around—36 sts.
Rounds 27-31: Sc in each st around—36 sc.
Round 32: *Sc in 4 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * around—30 sts.
Rounds 33-37: Sc in each st around—30 sc.
Round 38: *Sc in 3 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * around—24 sts.
Rounds 39-43: Sc in each st around—24 sc.
Round 44: *Sc in 2 sc, sc2tog; repeat from * around—18 sts.
Rounds 45-49: Sc in each st around—18 sc.
Round 50: *Sc in sc, sc2tog; repeat from * around—12 sts.
Rounds 51-55: Sc in each st around—12 sc.
Round 56: *Sc in sc, sc2tog; repeat from * around—8 sts.
Rounds 57-61: Sc in each st around—8 sc.
Round 62: Sc2tog around—4 sts. Fasten off and weave in ends.

HAT BAND
Round 1 (Right Side): With larger hook and working in opposite side of foundation ch of Round 1 of Hat, attach A to any st; ch 1, sc in same st and each st around; do not join; turn—66 sc. 
Round 2 (Wrong Side): Ch 1, work Row 1 of Small loop st (see Special Stitches) around; turn—65 Loop sts.
Round 3: Ch 1, work Row 2 of Small loop st around; turn—66 sc.
Rounds 4-9: Repeat Rounds 2-3. Fasten off, leaving long end. Sew edges of Hat Band together with yarn end, weave in ends.

HEAD
Round 1 (Right Side): With larger hook, attach C to any st from Round 9 of Hat Band; ch 1, sc in same sc and in each sc around; do not turn or slip st, place marker (see Notes)—66 sc.
Rounds 2-12: Sc in each sc around. 
Round 13: Sc in each sc around to last 2 sc; slip st in last 2 sc. Fasten off and weave in ends.

BEARD POCKET STRIP 
(make 4)
With larger hook and A, ch 37.
Row 1 (Wrong Side): Starting in 2nd ch from hook and working in back bumps, work Row 1 of Small loop st (see Special Stitches); turn upside down—35 Loop sts.
Row 2 (Right Side): Working in opposite side of foundation ch, work Row 2 of Small loop st across; turn—36 sc.
Rows 3-8: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn. Fasten off and weave in ends.

BEARD FRONT
With larger hook and A, ch 14. (The ch-14 sections at the beginning and end of this row will be sewn to the side of the Face later.)
Row 1 (Right Side): Skip 17 sts from last st of Round 13 of Head; slip st in next 33 sc, ch 15; turn—29 ch, 33 slip sts.
Row 2 (Wrong Side): Working in second ch from hook and back loops of ch and sc, work Row 1 of Large loop st (see Special Stitches) across; turn—60 Loop sts.
Row 3: Work Row 2 of Large loop st across; turn—61 hdc.
Row 4: Work Row 1 of Large loop st across; turn—60 Loop sts.
Row 5: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in 14 sts, *hdc in 2 sts, 2 hdc in next st; repeat from * 10 times, sc in back loops of remaining 14 sts—72 sts. Fasten off, leaving long end.
Row 6 (Wrong Side): Turn work; skip first 14 sc, attach A to back loop of next st; work Row 1 of Large loop st in next 44 sts; skip last 14 sc; turn—43 Loop sts. 
Row 7: Ch 1, working in back loops only, hdc in each st across—44 hdc. Do not fasten off.
Sew side whiskers of Beard to Face. Sew one side of Strip to Right Side of Face, working through back of sts of Row 5. Tack random loops down as needed for fluffy, full Beard effect. Repeat for other side.
Row 8: (Wrong Side) Ch 1 sc in each st across; turn—44 sc.
Rows 9-14: Repeat Row 8.
Row 15 (Right Side): Attach Pocket Strip to Beard Front as follows: Ch 1, sc in first 4 sc of Beard Front; hold Row 8 of Pocket Strip together with Beard Front so that Wrong Side of Pocket Strip is next to Right Side of Beard Front and both pieces have Right Sides facing; sc in next 36 sts, working through both thicknesses; sc in last 4 sts of Beard Front only; turn—44 sc.
Rows 16-24: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 25: Repeat Row 15.
Rows 26-34: Repeat Rows 16-24.
Rows 35-44: Repeat Row 15.
Row 46: Ch 1, sc in each sc across. Fasten off and weave in ends.
Divide Pocket Strips into 6 Pockets per row. Beginning at left edge of Strip, smooth Pocket Strip down and pin using a straight pin. Sew left edge of Pocket Strip to Beard Front. Repeat with right edge of Strip. Using contrasting yarn scraps, count 6 stitches from left edge of Strip and weave yarn through horizontally to mark stitching line. Repeat across row until there are 6 Pockets that are 6 stitches wide each. Using A, sew the Pockets in place for each row. There should be 24 Pockets.

MUSTACHE (make 2)
Round 1 (Right Side): With larger hook and A, 6 sc in Adjustable ring (see Special Techniques); do not turn or slip st—6 sc.
Round 2: 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Rounds 3-7: Sc in each sc around.
Round 8: 2 sc in sc, sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog, sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in last sc—13 sts.
Round 9: 2 sc in sc, sc in next 5 sc, sc2tog 2 times, sc in last 3 sc—12 sts. 
Round 10: Sc in each st around—12 sc. 
Round 11: Sc in 5 sc, sc2tog, sc in last 5 sc—11 sts.
Round 12: 2 sc in sc, sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog 2 times, sc in last 3 sc—10 sts. 
Round 13: 2 sc in sc, sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog 2 times, sc in last 3 sts—9 sts. 
Round 14: 2 sc in sc, sc2tog, sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog, sc in last 2 sc—8 sts.
Round 15: Sc in 2 sc, sc2tog 2 times, sc in last 2 sc—6 sts. Fasten off, leaving long end for sewing. Weave yarn end through all stitches of Round 15 and pull taut.

EYEBROW (make 2)
With larger hook and A, ch 8; turn. 
Row 1 (Right Side): Working in back bumps, slip st in second ch from hook, sc in next ch, hdc in next ch, dc in next ch, hdc in next ch, sc in next ch, slip st in last ch. Fasten off, leaving long end for sewing.

NOSE
Round 1 (Right Side): With smaller hook and C, 6 sc in Adjustable ring (see Special Techniques); do not turn or slip st—6 sc.
Round 2: 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc. 
Round 3: *Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * around—18 sc.
Rounds 4-5: Sc in each sc around. 
Round 6: [Sc in next 7 sc, sc2tog] 2 times—16 sts. Fasten off, leaving long end for sewing.

Attach facial features before making Beard Edge. Referring to photo for placement, sew Mustache pieces to Face. Attach the wider sections only and tack down the tips to achieve 3-D effect. Sew Nose to middle of Mustache, stuffing lightly. Sew buttons in place as Eyes, and add slightly arched Eyebrows above Eyes.

BEARD EDGE
Row 1 (Right Side): With larger hook and A, ch 34; sc in first sc of Row 46 of Beard and in next 43 sc, ch 34; turn—68 ch, 44 sc.
Row 2 (Wrong Side): Work Row 1 of Small loop st (see Special Stitches) across; turn—111 Loop sts.
Row 3: Work Row 2 of Small loop st across; turn—112 sc.
Row 4: Repeat Row 2; turn.
Row 5: Repeat Row 3. Fasten off, leaving long end for sewing.
Sew Beard Edge to Beard. Beginning with the left side, hold Beard Edge together with the row edge of the Beard (with loops facing inwards towards the Beard), and sew edges together. Repeat for other side.

BEARD BACK
Row 1 (Right Side): With larger hook, attach A to first sc of the remaining sts from Row 13 of Head, ch 1, sc in same space and in next 31 sts across; turn—32 sc.
Rows 2-6: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 7: Ch 1, *sc in 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * 9 times, sc in last 2 sc; turn—42 sc.
Rows 8-45: Ch 1, sc in each sc across. Do not fasten off.
Stuff the lower half of the Hat and Face with polyester stuffing (see Notes). Insert foam sheet, cut to fit length and width of Beard Front, from Face to lowest row of Beard (see Notes).
Row 46: Holding bottom edges of Beard Front and Beard Back together, sc across, working through both thicknesses. Fasten off, leaving long ends for sewing. Sew Beard sides together, being careful not to catch loops in the seam.

HAT WREATH
With smaller hook and D, ch 7, join with slip st to form ring.
Round 1 (Right Side): Ch 2 (counts as hdc), 17 hdc in ring, join with slip st in top of ch-2—18 hdc. Fasten off and weave in ends. Cut a small strand of B, thread through top of Wreath and tie in a bow.

DAY MARKER POST
Round 1 (Right Side): With smaller hook and A, 6 sc in Adjustable ring (see Special Techniques); do not turn or slip st—6 sc.
Rounds 2-8: Sc in each sc around. 
Round 9: Cut piece of straw to fit and insert it into Post; sc in each sc around. Fasten off, leaving long end for sewing. Weave yarn end through all stitches of Round 9, pull taut and knot. Fasten off and weave in end.

DAY MARKER WREATH
Round 1 (Right Side): With smaller hook and A, ch 2 (counts as hdc), 26 hdc in Adjustable ring (see Special Techniques), join with slip st in top of ch-2—27 hdc. Pull yarn end to adjust Wreath opening as desired. Fasten off, leaving long end for sewing.
Bow: With smaller hook and B, ch 5; working in back bumps, sc in second ch from hook and each bump across—4 sc. Fasten off and weave in ends. Referring to photo for placement, tie a piece of B tightly around middle of Bow, gather and knot securely. Sew Bow to Wreath, and sew Wreath to Day Marker Post.

TETHER
With smaller hook and A, make a ch 16" (40.5 cm) long. Fasten off, leaving long end for sewing. Sew Day Marker Post to one end of Tether.

HANGER
With smaller hook and B, ch 15. Fasten off, leaving long end for sewing. Sew to upper area of back of Hat.

POMPOM
Cut empty paper towel roll in half, and hold the 2 pieces together. Wrap A around both rolls about 130-160 times; cut yarn. Tie an 18" (45 cm) length of A, folded in half, around the middle of the wraps between the 2 rolls. Carefully remove the rolls and knot the tie securely. Cut loops and trim Pompom, leaving long ends for sewing. Shake to fluff out, and sew to tip of Hat.

FINISHING
Referring to photo for placement, embroider numbers on Pockets. Using a length of B, split the yarn into two plies. With large needle and two plies of yarn, follow the number chart to embroider the numbers, centering them on each Pocket.

materials: Bernat® Satin™ (100 g/3.5 oz; 182 m/200 yds)
Size 5 mm (U.S. H/8) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Hdc2(3)tog = (Yoh and draw up a loop in next stitch) 2(3) times. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
Sc2(3)tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2(3) stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook.
measurements: Approx 14" [35.5 cm] around x 26" [66 cm] long (before cuff).
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
VERSION 1
With A, ch 55. Join in rnd with sl st in first ch, taking care not to twist ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. 55 sc.
2nd rnd: Sl st in each of first 2 sts. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. *3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around, ending with 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Miss last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
3rd rnd: Join B with sl st in next sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. *3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around, ending with 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Miss last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc.
4th rnd: Sl st in next sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. *3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around, ending with 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Miss last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
Rep last 2 rnds for pat, working in Stripe Pat as follows:
2 rnds C, 2 rnds D, 2 rnds E, 2 rnds F, 2 rnds A, 2 rnds B.
These 12 rnds form Stripe Pat.
Cont in Stripe Pat until work from beg measures approx 20" [51 cm] long, ending with 2 rnds of C. Place a marker at end of last rnd.
**Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, proceed as follows in rows:
Shape instep: 1st row: (RS). Miss next 4 sc. Join yarn with sl st in next sc (center sc of 3 sc group). Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 3 sc in next sc) twice. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Turn. Leave rem sts unworked.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first sc. (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 3 sc in next sc) twice. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn. Break yarn.
3rd row: Join yarn with sl st in first sc. Ch 1. 2 sc in same sc. (1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 3 sc in next sc) twice. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in last sc. Turn.
4th row: As 2nd row. Break yarn.
Rep 3rd and 4th rows twice more, working in Stripe Pat as before.
Note: When working Heel rows, side edges of Instep rows will be incorporated into each end of Heel. When all rows of Heel are complete, Heel will be level with Instep stitches. All rows of Heel are worked with A.
Heel: 1st row: With RS facing, join A with sl st to first missed sc of marked rnd. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in next sc. *Hdc2tog. 1 hdc in each of next 3 sc. Hdc2tog.* 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * to * once more. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Working into side edge of heel opening, work 1 sc in side of next row. 18 sts. Turn.
2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Working into side edge of heel opening, work 1 sc in side of next row. Turn.
3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 3 sts. 1 hdc in each of next 5 sts. Hdc3tog. 1 hdc in each of next 5 sts. 1 sc in each of last 3 sts. Working into side edge of heel opening, work 1 sc in side of next row. Turn.
4th to 11th rows: Rep 2nd and 3rd rows 4 times more.
12th row: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc3tog (place marker on this st). (1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc) twice. 1 sc in last sc. Working into side edge of heel opening, work 1 sc in side of next row. 21 sts. Fasten off. Heel is now level with Instep stitches.
Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, proceed as follows in rnds: 
Foot: 1st rnd: (RS). Join yarn with sl st in marked st of heel. Ch 1. 3 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc of heel. Miss next 2 sc of heel. 1 sc in each of last 4 sc of heel. Working into sts of instep, (3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc) 3 times. 3 sc in next sc. Working into rem sts of heel, 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 4 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 55 sts.
2nd rnd: Sl st in next sc. Ch 1. 3 sc in same sc. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 3 sc in next sc. Rep from * around, ending with 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 4 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
3rd rnd: Join yarn with sl st to center sc of first 3 sc group. Ch 1. 3 sc in same sc. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 3 sc in next sc. Rep from * around, ending with 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of last 4 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Keeping cont of Stripe Pat, rep last 2 rnds 4 times more, then rep 2nd rnd once, ending with 2 rnds of B.
Shape toe: 1st rnd: Join yarn with sl st to center sc of first 3 sc group. Ch 1. 3 sc in same sc. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Miss next 2 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 3 sc in next sc. Rep from * around, ending with 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Sc2tog. Miss next 2 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 45 sts.
2nd rnd: Sl st in next sc. Ch 1. 3 sc in same sc. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Miss next 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 3 sc in next sc. Rep from * around, ending with 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Miss next 2 sts. 1 sc in each of last 3 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
3rd rnd: Join yarn with sl st to center sc of first 3 sc group. Ch 1. 3 sc in same sc. *1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Miss next 2 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in next sc. 3 sc in next sc. Rep from * around, ending with 1 sc in next sc. Sc2tog. Miss next 2 sc. Sc2tog. 1 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 35 sts.
4th rnd: Sl st in next sc. Ch 1. 3 sc in same sc. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Miss next 2 sts. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 3 sc in next sc. Rep from * around, ending with 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Miss next 2 sts. 1 sc in each of last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.
5th rnd: Join yarn with sl st to center sc of first 3 sc group. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sc. 1 sc in next sc. Yoh and draw up a loop in next sc. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook. Miss next 2 sc. Yoh and draw up a loop in next sc. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook – dc2tog over 4 sts made. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Dc2tog over next 4 sts. Rep from * 3 times more. 1 sc in last sc. Join with sl st to first sc. 20 sts.
6th rnd: Ch 1. (Sc2tog) 10 times. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off leaving a long end. Thread end onto tapestry needle and draw tightly through rem 10 sts.
VERSION 2
Stripe Pat
1st to 6th rnds: With A.
7th and 8th rnds: With B.
9th and 10th rnds: With D.
11th to 16th rnds: With C.
17th and 18th rnds: With A.
19th and 20th rnds: With D.
21st to 26th rnds: With B.
27th and 28th rnds: With C.
29th and 30th rnds: With D.
These 30 rnds form Stripe Pat.
With A, ch 55. Join in rnd with sl st in first ch, taking care not to twist ch.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each ch around. Join with sl st to first sc. 55 sc.
2nd rnd: Sl st in each of first 2 sts. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. *3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around, ending with 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Miss last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd to 6th rnds: Sl st in next sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. *3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around, ending with 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Miss last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off at end of 6th rnd.
7th rnd: Join B with sl st in next sc. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. *3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Miss next 2 sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around, ending with 3 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Miss last 2 sc. Join with sl st to first sc. Zig-zag Pat and first 7 rnds of Stripe Pat are now in position.
Cont in Stripe Pat until work from beg measures approx 20" [51 cm] long, ending with 2 rnds of D. Place a marker at end of last rnd.
Keeping cont of Version 2 Stripe Pat, work from ** to ** as given for Version 1.

pattern_name: Aunt Lydia's Beautiful Lacy Snowflake Ornaments
materials: Aunt Lydia's® Fine Crochet Thread, Size 20: 1 ball 201 White
Aunt Lydia's® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 1 ball 001 White
Aunt Lydia's® Fashion Crochet Size 3: 1 ball 201 White
abbreviations: ( ) = work all directions in parentheses in the indicated stitch or space
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated.
measurements: Finished Size: 3.5" (8 cm) for Size 20 thread, 5.25" (14 cm) for Size 10 thread, 3.75" (9.5 cm) for Size 3 thread, not including hanger.
gauge: Check your gauge. Use any size hook to obtain the finished size.
instructions:
SNOWFLAKE #3 (All sizes)
With selected thread and hook, ch 5, slip st in first ch to form ring.
Round 1 (Right Side): Ch 1 (does not count as a stitch now and throughout), 12 sc in ring, slip st in first sc of round—12 sc.
Round 2: Ch 3, (counts as first dc and ch-1 space), *dc in next sc, ch 1; repeat from * around, slip st in 2nd ch of beginning ch-3—12 dc, 12 ch-1 spaces.
Round 3: Slip st in first ch-1 space, ch 2, (counts as first dc), (dc, ch 3, 2 dc) in same ch-1 space, ch 3, *skip next ch-1 space, (2 dc, ch 3, 2 dc) in next ch-1 space, ch 3; repeat from * around, slip st in top of beginning ch-2—24 dc, 12 ch-3 loops.
Round 4: Slip st in next dc and first ch-3 space, ch 3, (counts as first tr), (tr, ch 3, 2 tr) in same ch-3 space, ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, *(2 tr, ch 3, 2 tr) in next ch-3 space, ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space, ch 3; repeat from * around, slip st in top of beginning ch-3—24 tr, 18 ch-3 spaces.
Round 5: Ch 1, *sc in 2 tr, slip st in next ch-3 space, ch 5, slip st in 4th ch from hook (picot made), 3-tr cluster in same ch-3 space (see Special Stitches)**; Triple picot (see Special Stitches) in top of cluster just made, slip st around base of Triple picot; ch 5, slip st in 4th ch from hook, ch 1, slip st in same ch-3 space, sc in next 2 tr, [ (2 sc, Ch-3 picot in last sc made (see Special Stitches), sc) in next ch-3 space] 2 times; repeat from * 4 times then from * to ** once; turn, ch 7, slip st in 7th ch from hook to form ring; (turn, ch 1, 11 sc) in ring just made, slip st around base of ring; ch 5, slip st in 4th ch from hook, ch 1, slip st in same ch-3 space, sc in next 2 tr, [ (2 sc, Ch-3 picot in last sc made, sc) in next ch-3 space] 2 times; slip st in first sc of round. Fasten off and weave in ends.
Block and stiffen with stiffener of choice (see Note).

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein 390 Hot Red A.
¾ yard of bright green satin ribbon
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Ball measures 2¼” in diameter.
gauge: 7 sts = 2”; 3 rows = 1”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
BALL ORNAMENT
First Half
With A, ch 4; join with a slip st in form a ring. 
Round 1: Ch 1, 8 sc in ring; join with a slip st in first sc – 
8 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc around; join – 16 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, *sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat 
from * around; join with a slip st in first sc – 20 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, *sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat 
from * around; join with a slip st in first sc – 24 sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join with a slip st in 
first sc. Fasten off.
Second Half
Work same as First Half. Do not fasten off at end of Round 
5; ch 32 for hanging loop, slip st in first ch. Fasten off. 
Weave in ends. 
FINISHING
Place 2 halves over styrofoam ball. Beginning at the hanging 
loop, whipstitch halves together through the front loops of sts 
in last round with the ribbon; tie ends into a bow.

materials: Small amount of 1012 Black D for embroidery
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 6.0 mm [US J-10]
two- ⅝" [1.5 cm] black buttons for Eyes
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc
( ) = work all directions in parentheses in the indicated stitch or space
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Stocking measures 14" [35.5 cm] high; 9½" [24 cm] at widest part of Foot.
gauge: 14 sc and 16 rows of sc = 4" [10 cm]. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge given.
instructions:
STOCKING
Front
With A, ch 29.
Row 1 (Wrong Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook (beginning ch-1 does not count as a st, now and throughout), 2 sc in next sc, sc in each ch across to last 2 chs, 2 sc in next ch, sc in last ch; turn—30 sc. 
Row 2 (Right Side): Ch 1, sc in first sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc across to last 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc; sc in last sc, changing to C in last sc; turn—32 sc.
Rows 3-4: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, changing to A in last sc of Row 4; turn. 
Rows 5-6: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, changing to C in last sc of Row 6; turn. 
Rows 7-14: Repeat Rows 3-6 twice. 
Row 15: Ch 1, sc in first sc, sc2tog, sc across to end; turn—31 sc.
Row 16: Ch 1, sc across to last 3 sc, sc2tog; sc in last sc, change to A in last sc and fasten off C; turn—30 sc.
Row 17: Ch 1, sc in first sc, sc2tog, sc across to last 3 sc, sc2tog, sc in last sc; turn—28 sc.
Row 18: Ch 1, sc in first sc, sc2tog, sc across to last 3 sc, sc2tog, sc in last sc; turn—26 sc. Fasten off A.
Row 19: Join C in 8th sc from beginning, ch 1, sc in same sc, sc2tog, sc across; turn—18 sc.
Row 20: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, changing to A in last sc; turn.
Rows 21-24: Repeat Rows 5–8.
Rows 25-28: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn. At end of Row 28, change to C in last sc and fasten off A.
Rows 29-42: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn. At end of Row 42, change to B in last sc.
Row 43: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 44: Ch 1, working in remaining front loops of Row 43 only, sc in each sc across; turn.
Row 45: Ch 1, sc in each sc of Row 44 across; turn—18 sc.
Rows 46-58: Ch 1, sc in each sc across. At end of Row 58, do not turn.
Front Edge (see Note)
Round 1 (Right Side): Beginning at top left corner, ch 1; working in ends of rows, work 1 sc in each sc row, changing colors as needed; sc across top of Row 18, 3 sc in corner; continue working 1 sc in end of each sc row down side; working in opposite side of foundation ch, 3 sc in first ch, sc in each ch across to last ch, 3 sc in last ch; continue working 1 sc in end of each sc row up to top right corner; working across top of Row 58, (2 sc, ch 12, 2 sc) in first sc for Hanger, sc across to last sc, 3 sc in last sc, slip st in first sc to join. Fasten off B.
Back
With A, ch 29.
Rows 1-14: Same as Front Rows 1-14.
Row 15: Ch 1, sc across to last 3 sc, sc2tog, sc in last sc; turn—31 sc.
Row 16: Ch 1, sc in next sc, sc2tog, sc across to end, changing to A in last sc; turn—30 sc.
Rows 17-18: Repeat Front Rows 17-18. At end of Row 18, change to C in last sc and fasten off A.
Row 19: Ch 1, sc in 17 sc, sc2tog; turn—18 sc.
Rows 20-58: Repeat Front Rows 20-58.
Back Edge
Work same as Front Edge, reversing shaping; work 3 sc at top left corner instead of Hanger.
Nose
With B, ch 8.
Row 1 (Right Side): Slip st in 2nd ch from hook and next ch, sc next 2 ch, hdc in last 3 ch; fasten off, leaving long end for sewing. 
Scarf
With B, ch 6.
Row 1 (Wrong Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and each ch across; turn—5 sc. 
Rows 2-68: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each sc across; turn. At end of Row 68, fasten off, leaving long end for sewing.
FINISHING
Referring to photo for placement, attach buttons for Eyes, sew Nose in place, and embroider smile on Face. Holding Front and Back with wrong sides together and working through both layers, work through back loops only of Front Edge sts and both loops of Back Edge sts. Join B at top left corner, ch 1, sc in each sc around to top right corner. Fasten off, leaving top open. Tie Scarf loosely around Neck and tack in place. Weave in ends.

materials: Red Heart® Super Saver®: 1 skein each 332 Red A, 633 Dark Sage B, and 316 Soft White C.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = [draw up a loop in next st] twice, yo and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
A, B, C = color A, B, C
* or ** or *** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** or *** as indicated
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Stocking measures 16” long.
gauge: 14 sts = 4”; 10 rows = 4” in pattern with larger hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
With larger hook and A, ch 43.
Row 1 (Right Side): Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 42 sc. 
Row 2: Ch 3 (counts as dc), skip first sc, dc in next sc and in each sc across; turn.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each dc across, sc in top of ch-3; turn. 
Repeat Rows 2 and 3 for pattern until 10” from beginning, end by working Row 2. Fasten off.
Heel
With right side facing and larger hook, skip first 32 sts of last row, join B in next st; ch 1, sc in same st and in next 9 sts, bring other side of stocking around and sc in first 11 sts; turn – 21 sts.
Shape Heel
Work short rows as follows:
next Row: Ch 1, sc in first 14 sc; turn.
next Row: Ch 1, sc in first 7 sc; turn.
next Row: Ch 1, sc in first 7 sc, sc in next st of long row below; turn. – 8 sc.
next Row: Ch 1, sc in first 8 sc, sc in next st of long row below; turn – 9 sc. Continue in this manner until all 21 heel sts are worked. Fasten off.
Foot
With right side facing and larger hook, skip first 10 sc of heel, join A in next sc; ch 1, sc in same sc and in next 10 sc of heel, skip next 2 sts of stocking, sc in next 17 sts of stocking, skip next 2 sts, sc in next 10 sts of heel; turn – 38 sc.
Repeat pattern Rows 2 and 3 five more times, then Row 2 once more. Fasten off.
Toe
With right side facing and larger hook, join B in first st of foot; ** ch 1, sc2tog, sc in next 15 dc, sc2tog, turn – 17 sc. 
Continue in sc only and decrease 1 st each end of every row until 3 sts remain. Fasten off. **
With right side facing, join B in next st of last long row. 
Work same as first half of toe from ** to **.
FiniSHinG
Sew toe, foot and back seams. Sew openings closed at corners of heel.
Crochet Christmas Stocking
Is everyone asking for a Christmas stocking this year? You can make lots of them with this easy pattern. It’s a classic design that will make each one a treasured heirloom.
Cuff
With larger hook and C, ch 47. Work 11 rows of sc over 46 sts. Fasten off. Sew cuff seam.
Lower Cuff Edging
*** With right side facing and smaller hook, join C at back seam; ch 1, sc in first 2 sc, * skip next sc, (dc, [ch 1, dc] twice) all in next sc, skip next sc, sc in next sc; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in first sc. *** Fasten off.
Attach Cuff
With right side facing and smaller hook, join C at upper edge of back seam of cuff; ch 1, sc in first sc, place cuff over right side of stocking and beginning at first st after back seam of stocking, work 21 sc through both layers at same time, sc in next sc of cuff only, sc in next 21 sc through both layers, sc in last sc of cuff only; join. Fasten off.
Top Edging
Work same as Lower Edging from *** to ***, ch 12 for hanging loop, slip st in first sc again. Fasten off. Weave in all ends.

materials: RED HEART® Classic Crochet Thread Size 10: 1 ball 226 Natural
Ribbon used: 6 yds of ⅞”-wide Single Face Satin Ribbon, Natural A
6 yds of ⅞”-wide Pastel Chevron Ribbon, Carnation Pink B
3 yds of ⅝”-wide Glitter Canvas Ribbon, Natural C
3 yds of ⅝”-wide Single Face Satin Ribbon, Aqua D
3 yds of ¼”-wide Metallic Ribbon, Gold E
3 yds of ¼”-wide Narrow Rickrack Trim, Coral F
abbreviations: A, B, etc. = Color A, Color B, etc.
( ) = work all directions in parentheses in the indicated stitch or space
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Center motif measures: 8" [20.5 cm] diameter; completed Dreamcatcher (not including ribbons) = 14" [35.5 cm] diameter.
gauge: Rounds 1-9 = 8" [20.5 cm] diameter. Gauge is not essential for this project.
instructions:
DOILY
Make an adjustable ring (see Special Technique).
Round 1 (Right Side): Ch 3 (does not count as a st, now and throughout), work 16 dc in loop, slip st in first dc to join—16 dc.
Round 2: Ch 1 (does not count as a st, now and throughout), [sc, ch 6, skip next dc] 8 times, slip st in first sc to join—8 sc, 8 ch-6 spaces.
Round 3: Slip st in first 3 chs, ch 1, [sc in ch-6 space, ch 6] 8 times, slip st in first sc to join—8 sc, 8 ch-6 spaces.
Round 4: Slip st in ch-6 space, ch 3, [(3 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) in ch-6 space, ch 3] 8 times, slip st in first dc to join—48 sc, 16 ch-3 spaces.
Round 5: Slip st in next 2 dc and 2 chs, ch 1, [sc in ch-3 space, ch 6] 16 times, slip st in first sc to join—16 sc, 16 ch-6 spaces.
Round 6: Slip st in first 3 chs, ch 1, [sc in ch-6 space, ch 6] 16 times, slip st in first sc to join—16 sc, 16 ch-6 spaces.
Round 7: Slip st in ch-6 space, ch 3, [(3 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) in same ch-6 space, (ch 3, sc, ch 3) in next ch-6 space] 8 times, slip st in first dc to join—48 dc, 24 ch-3 spaces.
Round 8: Slip st in next 2 dc and 2 chs, ch 1, [sc in ch-3 space, ch 6] 24 times, slip st in first sc to join—24 sc, 24 ch-6 spaces.
Round 9: Slip st in first 3 chs, ch 1, [sc in ch-6 space, ch 6] 24 times, slip st in first sc to join; slip st in first 3 chs—24 sc, 24 ch-6 spaces. Fasten off, leaving a 36" (91.5 cm) tail.
ASSEMBLY
Attach Doily to Smaller Ring
Referring to photo for placement, [wrap long tail around smaller Ring then feed thread through ch-6 space] 24 times, pull tail to remove all slack, knot, weave in ends.
Attach Smaller Ring to Larger Ring
1. Leaving long tail, ch 216 with thread; fasten off, leaving long tail.
2. Referring to photo for placement, knot one tail end around smaller Ring, [weave chain around smaller Ring through ch-6 space then around larger Ring] 12 times, being careful to not weave too tightly. Leave about 3" (7.5 cm) slack to make wraps even all around.
3. Knot tails together, weave in ends.
Attach Ribbons to Larger Ring
4. Cut 24" (61 cm) strips for the following ribbons:
• 8 strips each of A and B.
• 4 strips each of C, D, E, and F.
5. Fold ribbons in half evenly. Referring to photo for placement, knot onto larger Ring in groups of 8 in the following sequence: A, B, C, D, E, F, B, A.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: 1 skein each of 316 Soft White A, 706 Perfect Pink B, 512 Turqua C, and 672 Spring Green D
Note: Only a small amount of each yarn color is needed.
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 3.75 mm [US F-5]
Polyester fiberfill, 18" [45.5 cm] thin gold ribbon (for hanger), stitch marker, yarn needle.
abbreviations: A, B, C, and D = Color A, B, C, and D
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Ornament measures about 3½" [9 cm] across.
gauge: 20 sts = 4" [10 cm]; 20 rows/rounds = 4" [10 cm] in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
DONUT
Beginning at center of donut, with A, ch 12; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring, taking care to not twist ch.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, sc in same ch as joining and in each remaining ch around—12 sc. Do not join, work in continuous rounds (spirals). Place a marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—24 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—30 sc.
Round 4: [Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—36 sc.
Rounds 5–8: Sc in each sc around.
Round 9: [Sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—30 sc.
Round 10: [Sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 11: [Sc2tog] 12 times—12 sts.
Round 12: Sc in each sc around. Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Stuff Donut around center opening, keeping opening clear. Sew first round to last round.

FROSTING
With B, ch 18; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring, taking care to not twist chain.
Round 1 (right side): Ch 1, sc in same ch as joining and in each remaining ch around—18 sc. Do not join, work in continuous rounds (spirals). Place a marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—30 sc.
Round 4: [Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—36 sc.
Rounds 5 and 6: Sc in each sc around.
Round 7: [Sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—42 sc.
Round 8: *Sc in next 2 sc, 2 dc in each of next 2 sc, sc in next sc, slip st in next sc; repeat from * around; join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail.

FINISHING
With A, C, and D, embroider French Knots on right side of Frosting. Place the French Knots randomly, as desired.
With B, sew Frosting on top of Donut.
Fold gold ribbon in half. Insert crochet hook around a few stitches at top of ornament, place ribbon fold on hook and draw through to form a loop. Thread ends of ribbon through loop and pull to tighten. Tie ends together with bow or overhand knot to form hanging loop.
Weave in any remaining ends.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 1 ball 1 White
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Circumference = 10” for Ball 1, 9½” for Ball 2 and Ball 3.
gauge: Gauge is not important for this project.
instructions:
Ball Cover
Ch 6; join with a slip st to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 5 (counts as dc, ch-2), [dc in ring, ch 2] 7 times; join with a slip st in 3rd ch of ch-5.
Round 2: Slip st in next space, ch 5 (counts as dtr), 3 dtr in same space, ch 3, [4 dtr in next space, ch 3] 7 times; join with a slip st in top of ch-5.
Round 3: Slip st in next dtr, [sc between 2nd and 3rd dtr, (4 dc, ch 2, 4 dc) in next ch-3 space] 8 times; join in first sc.
Round 4: Slip st in next 4 dc and into ch-2 space, ch 5 (counts as dtr), (dtr, [ch 3, 2 dtr] 3 times) all in same space, * (4 dc, ch 2, 4 dc) in next ch-2 space **, ([2 dtr, ch 3] 3 times, 2 dtr) all in next ch-2 space; repeat from * around, end at **; join in top of ch-5.
Round 5: Ch 1, * sc between next 2 dtr, (3 dc, [picot, 3 dc] twice) all in next ch-3 space; repeat from * twice more; sc between next 2 dtr, sc between dtr and dc, (4 dc, picot, 4 dc) in next ch-2 space, sc between dc and dtr; repeat from * around; join in first sc. Fasten off.
Round 6: Join thread in 3rd picot of Round 5; ch 1, sc in picot, * ch 3, sc in next picot, ch 5, sc in next picot, ch 3, pull up a loop in each of the next 3 picots, yo and draw through all 4 loops on hook, ch 3, sc in next picot, ch 5, sc in next picot; repeat from * around, end at **; join.
Round 7: Ch 1, sc in first sc, * ch 3, sc in next sc, ch 5, hdc in next sc, ch 3, dc in next joined sts, ch 3, hdc in next sc, ch 5, sc in next sc; repeat from * around, end at **; join.
