Round 8: Ch 1, sc in first sc, * ch 3, sc in next space, ch 3, sc in next sc, [ch 3, sc] twice in ch-5 space, ch 3, sc in next hdc, ch 3, sc in next space, ch 3, sc in next dc, ch 3, sc in next space, ch 3, sc in next hdc, [ch 3, sc] twice in ch-5 space, ch 3, sc in next sc; repeat from * around, end at **; (ch 1, hdc) in first sc to join and form last loop.
Rounds 9-17: Ch 1, sc in loop just formed, * ch 3, sc in next ch-3 loop; repeat from * around, ending with (ch 1, hdc) in first sc to join and form last loop.
Round 18: Repeat Round 17 ending with ch 3; join in first sc.
Round 19: * (Sc, picot, sc) in next ch-3 loop; repeat from * around; join in first sc. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
To Finish
Step 1: Insert satin ball into crocheted piece placing center hole at bottom of crocheted piece on center bottom of ball.
Step 2: Weave 18” length of ribbon through Round 15, draw up ribbon very tightly and knot, then tie in bow on top of knot. Trim ribbon ends.
Step 3: Insert teardrop pearl corsage pin through ends of 7” length of ribbon and into center top of ball to form hanger loop.
Make your Christmas tree or other decorating unique with these one-of-a-kind crochet thread ball décor. Amaze your friends and family. They make beautiful gifts.


Ball Number 2 (top of photo)
Circumference = 9½”.
Steel Crochet Hook: 1.5mm [US 7].
Tapestry needle, 1/8” x 7” double-faced satin ribbon, 2” long pearl teardrop corsage pin; 3” red satin ball.
Ball Cover
First Half: Ch 12; join with a slip st to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 1, 24 sc in ring; join with a slip st in first sc.
Round 2: Ch 10 (counts as dtr, ch-5), skip next sc, [sc in next sc, ch 5, skip next sc, dtr in next sc, ch 5, skip next sc] 5 times, sc in next sc, ch 5, skip next sc; join with a slip st in 5th ch of ch-10.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in same st as joining, ch 8, [sc in next dtr, ch 8] 5 times; join in first sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, sc in first sc, * sc in first ch of ch-8, ch 8, skip next 6 ch, sc in next ch, sc in next sc; repeat from * around, end at **; join in first sc – 18 sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, sc in first 2 sc, * sc in first ch of ch-8, ch 8, skip next 6 ch, sc in next ch, sc in next 3 sc; repeat from * to last sc, end at **; sc in last sc; join – 30 sc.
Round 6: Ch 1, sc in first 3 sc, * sc in first ch of ch-8, ch 8, skip next 6 ch, sc in next ch, sc in next 5 sc; repeat from * to last 2 sc, end at **; sc in last 2 sc; join – 42 sc.
Round 7: Slip st in next 3 sc, slip st in next 4 ch, ch 1, sc in same loop, ch 12, * sc in next loop, ch 12; repeat from * around; join in first sc.
Round 8: Ch 1, sc in first sc, sc in each ch and sc around; join – 78 sc.
Round 9: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join. Fasten off.
Weave in ends.
Second Half: Work same as First Half, leaving a 48” thread tail at the end of Round 9 to sew halves together and to make hanger loop.
Finishing
Step 1: Place crocheted halves over satin ball matching crochet design pattern and matching sts. Sew halves together starting at center top of ball with the length of thread that was left on Second Half.
Step 2: With remaining thread left after sewing, using crochet hook, anchor the thread with a slip st at center top of ball; ch 40; join to first ch to form loop being careful not to twist ch. Fasten off.
Step 3: Open hanger loop at base. Insert teardrop pearl corsage pin into satin ball at center top to give firm hold to hanger loop. Weave in ends.

Ball Number 3 (bottom of photo)
Circumference = 9½”.
Steel Crochet Hook: 1.5mm [US 7].
Tapestry needle; 1/8” x 7” double-faced satin ribbon; 2” long pearl teardrop corsage pin; 3” red satin ball.
Ball Cover
First Half: Ch 12; join with a slip st to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as dc), 23 dc in ring; join with a slip st to top of ch-3.
Round 2: Ch 6 (counts as dc, ch 3), skip next dc, [dc in next dc, ch 3, skip next dc] 11 times; join in 3rd ch of ch-6.
Round 3: Ch 3, 5 dc in next ch-3 space, [dc in next dc, 5 dc in next ch-3 space] 11 times; join.
Round 4: Ch 3, 2 dc in same st as joining, ch 3, skip next 5 dc, [3 dc in next dc, ch 3, skip next 5 dc] 11 times; join.
Rounds 5 and 6: Ch 3, dc in next 2 dc, ch 3, [dc in next 3 dc, ch 3] 11 times; join.
Round 7: Ch 3, dc in next 2 dc, 3 dc in next ch-3 space, [dc in next 3 dc, 3 dc in next ch-3 space] 11 times; join. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
Second Half: Work same as First Half, leaving a 48” thread tail at end of Round 7.
Finishing
Step 1: Place crocheted halves over satin ball matching crochet design pattern and matching sts. Sew or slip st together with the length of thread that was left on second half.
Step 2: Insert teardrop pearl corsage pin through ends of 7” length of ribbon and into center top of ball to form hanger loop.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 skein each 321 Gold A, 319 Cherry Red B and 373 Petal Pink C.
Yarn needle, fiberfill, black embroidery floss, 2 tiny buttons for eyes.
abbreviations: sc2tog = [draw up a loop in next st] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
A, B, C = Color A, B, C
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Gingerbread Boy is 5½” tall.
gauge: 16 sc = 4”; 14 rows = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
GINGERBREAD BOY (Make 2)
Head
With A, ch 4.
Row 1: Work sc in 2nd ch from hook, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last sc – 4 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in next sc, 2 sc in next 2 sc, sc in last sc – 6 sc.
Row 3: Ch 1, turn, sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last sc – 8 sc.
Rows 4-6: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Row 7: Ch 1, turn, sc in next sc, [sc2tog] 3 times, sc in last sc – 5 sc.
Row 8: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Shape Arms
Row 9: Ch 5, turn, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 3 ch, sc in next 5 sc – 9 sc.
Row 10: Ch 5, turn, sc in 2nd ch from hook and in next 3 ch, sc in next 9 sc – 13 sc.
Row 11: Ch 1, turn, slip st in next 3 sc, sc in next 10 sc.
Row 12: Ch 1, turn, slip st in next 3 sc, sc in next 7 sc.
Rows 13-15: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across – 7 sc.
Row 16: Ch 1, turn, sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in each sc to last 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in last sc – 9 sc.
Shape First Leg
Row 17: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 4 sc, leave remaining sts unworked.
Row 18: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc – 4 sc.
Row 19: Ch 1, turn, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc – 5 sc.
Row 20: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across. Fasten off.
Shape Second Leg
Row 17: Skip next st on Row 16 and join A in next st with sc, sc in next 3 sc – 4 sc.
Row 18: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Row 19: Ch 1, turn, sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in last sc – 5 sc.
Row 20: Ch 1, turn, sc in each sc across.
Edging
Round 1: Sc evenly around piece, working 2 sc in corners so piece lays flat, slip st in first sc in join. Fasten off.
PINK ICING EDGING
With C and working in front loops only, slip st in each st around Front piece.
FINISHING
Sew buttons in place on right side of Front piece for eyes. Using black embroidery floss, sew a French knot for nose. Work couched st with black embroidery floss for mouth. With wrong sides together, sew pieces together through the back loops, lightly stuffing with fiberfill before sewing closed.
Heart
With B, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Round 2: Working in continuous rounds, (hdc, dc, ch 2) in next sc, slip st in next sc, (ch 2, dc, hdc) in next sc, sc in next sc, 3 sc in next sc, sc in last sc, slip st to first st to join. Fasten off. Sew in place on Front. Weave in ends.

materials: Red Heart® Amigurumi™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 239 yds/219 m)
Size U.S. B/1 (2.25 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
Four 1” [2.5 cm] pompoms in color of your choice (for ear muffs and ends of scarf).
Small piece of chenille stem in color of your choice (for headband portion of earmuffs).
½” [6 mm] rhinestones, sequins or beads.
Optional: Piece of heavy cardboard approx 5” [12.5 cm] square for stuffing/stiffening ornament.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: Approx 5" [12.5 cm] tall.
gauge: 22 sc and 24 rows = 4” [10 cm]
instructions:
Notes:
• Head of snowman and top half of flying saucer are worked in one piece for top section. Lower half of flying saucer is worked separately for bottom section. Top and bottom sections are sewn together and stuffed while sewing. Before start, separate the different color sections of the yarn as follows: Push the rings of color out from center. Find the point where the color changes and break the yarn. Repeat this process for the remaining yarn colors. Wind each color into a separate ball.

SCARF
Note: To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops and proceed, keeping color change to WS of work.

With D, ch 43.
1st row: With D, 1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook and in each ch to end of chain. Join C. Turn. 41 hdc.
2nd row: With C, ch 1. 1 hdc in each st to end of row. Turn. Fasten off C.
3rd row: Working along opposite side of foundation ch, join B with sl st in first ch. Ch 1. 1 hdc in each ch to end of row. Fasten off B, leaving long end. Thread end through short edge and pull tightly to form a tapered (puckered) end. Weave in end securely. Use a scrap of yarn to taper (pucker) other short end. Sew pompom to each end of Scarf.

TOP SECTION
Note: Do not join at end of rnd. Work in continuous rnds (spiral). PM at end of rnd to indicate end of rnd. Move marker up as each rnd is completed.

Head
Beg at top of head with A, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each of next 6 sc. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: (1 sc in next st. 2 sc in next st) 6 times. 18 sc.
4th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 2 sts. 2 sc in next st) 6 times. 24 sc.
5th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 3 sts. 2 sc in next st) 6 times. 30 sc.
6 rnd: (1 sc in each of next 4 sts. 2 sc in next st) 6 times. 36 sc.
7th to 14th rnds: 1 sc in each st around.
15th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 4 sts. Sc2tog) 6 times. 30 sts.
16th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Sc2tog) 6 times. 24 sts.
Attach safety eyes between 11th and 12 rnds approx 5 sts apart. Begin stuffing head.
17th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Sc2tog) 6 times. 18 sts.
18th rnd: (1 sc in each st. Sc2tog) 6 times. 12 sts.
19th and 20th rnds: 1 sc in each st around. Sl st in next st. Join B. Fasten off A. Finish stuffing head.

Top of Saucer
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first sc.
1st rnd: With B, ch 1. (2 sc in next st) 12 times. Join. 24 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. (2 sc in next st. 1 sc in next st) 12 times. Join. 36 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 11 sts. 2 sc in next st) 3 times. Join. 39 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
5th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 12 sts. 2 sc in next st) 3 times. Join. 42 sc.
6th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join. Fasten off.
7th rnd: Join C with sl st in back loop of first st. Ch 1. Working in back loops only, (1 sc in each of next 6 sts. 2 sc in next st) 6 times. Join. 48 sc.
8th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 2 sts. 2 sc in next st) 16 times. Join. 64 sc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
10th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 15 sts. 2 sc in next st) 4 times. Join. 68 sc.
11th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
12th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 16 sts. 2 sc in next st) 4 times. Join. 72 sc.
13th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join. Fasten off.
14th rnd: Join D with sl st in back loop of first st. Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each st around. Join.
15th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join. Fasten off.

BOTTOM SECTION
With B, ch 2.
1st rnd: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join. 6 sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each of next 6 sts. Join. 12 sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each of next 12 sts. Join. 24 sc.
4th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each next st. 2 sc in next st) 12 times. Join. 36 sc.
5th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 5 sts. 2 sc in next st) 6 times. Join. 42 sc.
6th and 7th rnds: Ch 1. sc in each st around. Join. Fasten off.
8th rnd: Join C with sl st in back loop of first st. Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 6 sts. 2 sc in next st) 6 times. Join. 48 sc.
9th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 2 sts. 2 sc in next st) 16 times. Join. 64 sc.
10th rnd: Ch 1. sc in each st around. Join.
11th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 15 sts. 2 sc in next st) 4 times. Join. 68 sc.
12th rnd: Ch 1. sc in each st around. Join.
13th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 16 sts. 2 sc in next st) 4 times. Join. 72 sc.
14th rnd: Ch 1. sc in each st around. Join. Fasten off.
15th rnd: Join D with sl st in back loop of first st. Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each st around. Join.
16th rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join. Do not fasten off D.

FINISHING
Make Cardboard Insert (optional)
Place bottom section flat on piece of heavy cardboard and trace around it, adding approx 1/8" [3 mm] in diameter. Break out circle and check for fit by holding the circle together with top and bottom sections. Cardboard can be trimmed for better fit as needed.

Assemble Saucer
With RS facing, hold top and bottom sections together. With D, working in back loop of top layer and front loop of bottom layer, whipstitch edges of sections together approx halfway around. Insert optional cardboard and stuff bottom and top of saucer, keeping the cardboard at the center to separate the top and bottom stuffing. Continue to whipstitch edges of sections together, stuffing as you go.

Nose: Break orange toothpick in half (plain toothpick can be colored with orange permanent marker). Dip the broken end of the toothpick in strong craft glue and insert between stitches of head, centered approx 1 row below eyes.

Earmuffs: Break 2" [5 cm] length of chenille stem. Bend stem to fit over snowman’s head. With strong craft glue, glue a pompom to each end of chenille stem. Allow glue to dry for several hours or overnight. Hint: Protect work surface from glue with a piece of waxed paper. When glue is dry, place earmuffs on snowman’s head and glue the pompoms in place.

Saucer Lights: With craft glue, glue rhinestones, sequins or beads evenly spaced around D-colored edge of flying saucer. Tie scarf around snowman’s neck. If desired, attach thread or fishing line to top of snowman for hanging loop.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver® in Cherry Red A, Buff B, Green C, Black D, and Spring Pink E
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 3.75 mm [US F-5]
abbreviations: A, B, C, etc. = Color A, B, C; etc.
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Ornament measures about 3" [7.5 cm] tall.
gauge: 20 sts = 4" [10 cm]; 20 rows/rounds = 4" [10 cm] in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
APPLE
With A, ch 2.
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Do not join, work in continuous rounds (spirals). Place a marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—18 sc.
Round 4: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 5: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—30 sc.
Rounds 6–13: Sc in each sc around.
Round 14: [Sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 15: [Sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog] 6 times—18 sc.
Round 16: [Sc in next sc, sc2tog] 6 times—12 sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail. Stuff Apple firmly with fiberfill. Thread tail through stitches of last round and pull to close opening at top of Apple, then insert needle through center of top of Apple and down through the Apple to center of bottom of Apple. Pull to form an indent in the top and in the bottom of the Apple. Weave in end securely.
STEM
With B, ch 6.
Row 1: Work 2 hdc in 2nd ch from hook, slip st in each of the remaining 4 ch. Fasten off, leaving a long tail.
LEAF
With C, ch 8.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, hdc in next ch, dc in next ch, tr in each of next 2 ch, dc in next ch, 3 sc in last ch; working along opposite side of foundation ch, dc in next ch, tr in each of next 2 ch, dc in next ch, hdc in next ch, sc in next ch—15 sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, turn, sc in first 7 sts, 3 sc in next st, sc in remaining 7 sts; join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail.
CHEEKS (make 2)
With D, ch 3.
Round 1: Work 7 hdc in 3rd ch from hook; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail.
FINISHING
Face: With yarn needle and E, using photograph as a guide, embroider a back stitch smile and French knot eyes on front of Apple.
With D, sew Cheeks on each side of smile.
With B, sew Stem to center top of Apple.
With C, sew end of Leaf near Stem.
Fold gold ribbon in half. Insert crochet hook around a few stitches at top of ornament, place ribbon fold on hook and draw through to form a loop. Thread ends of ribbon through loop and pull to tighten. Tie ends together with bow or overhand knot to form hanging loop.
Weave in any remaining ends.

materials: Patons ® Grace (50 g/1.75 oz; 125 m /136 yds)
Size 2.75 mm (U.S. C or 2) crochet hook or size needed to obtain tension.
measurements: Approx 5 ins [12.5 cm] diameter.
gauge: One Motif = 5 ins [12.5 cm] diameter.
instructions:
SNOWFLAKE 1
Ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in ring. Ch 6) 5 times. 1 sc in ring. Ch 3. 1 dc in first sc.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in side of last dc worked. *Ch 2. (1 sc. Ch 3. 1 sc) in next ch-6 sp. Rep from * 4 times more. Ch 2. 1 sc in top of ch 3. Ch 3. Join with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd: Ch 3 (counts as dc). 1 dc in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 2. (2 dc. Ch 3. 2 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Rep from * 4 times more. Ch 2. 2 dc in last ch-3 sp. Ch 3. Join with sl st to top of ch 3.
4th rnd: Sl st in next dc and next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp. *Ch 3. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in next ch-3 sp. Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * 4 times more. Ch 3. (3 dc. Ch 3. 3 dc) in last ch-3 sp. Ch 3. Join with sl st to first sc.
5th rnd: Ch 5 (counts as dc and ch 2). *1 sc in next dc. Ch 5. (1 sc. Ch 5. Sl st in 3rd ch from hook – picot made. Ch 2. 1 sc) all in next ch-3 sp. Ch 5. Miss next 2 dc. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 2. 1 dc in next sc. Ch 2. Rep from * 4 times more, then rep from * to ** once. Join with sl st to 3rd ch of ch 5. Fasten off.

SNOWFLAKE 2
Ch 7. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring.
1st rnd: Ch 4. 1 tr in ring – counts as tr2tog. *Ch 2. [(Yoh) twice and draw up a loop. (Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook) twice] in ring twice. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook – tr2tog made. Rep from * 10 times more. Ch 2. Join with sl st to top of ch 4.
2nd rnd: Sl st in next ch-2 sp. Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp. *Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-2 sp. Rep from * 10 times more. Ch 5. Join with sl st to first sc.
3rd rnd: Sl st in next ch-5 sp. Ch 1. (1 sc. Ch 12. 1 sc) in same sp. *Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp. Ch 5. (1 sc. Ch 12. 1 sc) in next ch-5 sp. Rep from * 4 times more. Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp. Ch 2. 1 dc in first sc.
4th rnd: (6 dc. Ch 5. Sl st in 3rd ch from hook – picot made. Ch 2. 6 dc) all in first ch-12 loop. *1 sc in next ch-5 sp. Ch 3. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp. (6 dc. Ch 5. Picot. Ch 2. 6 dc) all in next ch-12 loop. Rep from * 4 times more. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp. Ch 3. Join with sl st to last dc of 3rd rnd. Fasten off.

Optional: Apply fabric stiffener following manufacturer's instructions.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 skein each 0448 Sherbet Print, 0672 Spring Green, 0722 Pretty in Pink, 0324 Bright Yellow, 0530 Orchid, or 0784 Bonbon Print.
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: One Easter Egg measures 3½” diameter.
gauge: 11 sts = 4”; 12 rows = 4” in single crochet. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
NOTE: Egg cover is worked in the round without joining. Place marker at beginning of round and move marker up to beginning of next round as work progresses.
EGG COVER
Beginning at tip of egg cover, with color of your choice, ch 4; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1 (Right Side): Work 4 sc in ring—4 sc.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—8 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 4 times—12 sc.
Round 4: [Sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 4 times—16 sc.
Round 5: [Sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 4 times—20 sc.
Round 6: [Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 4 times—24 sc.
Round 7: [Sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 4 times—28 sc.
Rounds 8 and 9: Sc in each sc around.
Round 10: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 13 sc] twice—30 sc.
Rounds 11–14: Sc in each sc around.
Round 15: [Sc2tog, sc in next 13 sc] twice—28 sts.
Round 16: [Sc2tog, sc in next 5 sc] 4 times—24 sts.
Insert Styrofoam® Egg: Pull up a large loop (to mark your place) and remove hook. Turn cover inside-out and position wrong side of beginning ch-4 ring at tip of egg. Roll cover down over egg. Insert hook back into large loop. Tighten loop.
Round 17: [Sc2tog, sc in next 4 sc] 4 times—20 sts.
Round 18: [Sc2tog, sc in next 2 sc] 5 times—15 sts.
Round 19: [Sc3tog] 5 times—5 sts. Fasten off, leaving a long tail.
FINISHING
Thread tail through stitches of last round and pull to close opening. Weave in ends.
Get creative and make a basket full of Easter eggs that won’t have to be dipped in dye. Kids and pets will love searching for them at your annual egg hunt.

materials: Caron® Simply Soft® (6 oz/170 g; 315 yds/288 m)
Contrast A Soft Pink (9719) 1 ball or 117 yds/107 m
Contrast B Chartreuse (9771) 1 ball or 162 yds/148 m
Contrast C Neon Pink (9775) 1 ball or 94 yds/86 m
Size U.S. H/8 [5 mm] Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
abbreviations: Popcorn = Work 5 dc into same stitch or space. Drop loop from hook. Insert hook from front to back into first dc of 5 dc group. Pull dropped loop through stitch. Ch 1 to secure popcorn.
measurements: Motif = 5" [12.5 cm] from point to point.
gauge: 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm].
instructions:
Motif 
See diagram on page 2.
Make 2 using A as Color 1 and B as Color 2.
Make 4 using A as Color 1 and C as Color 2.
Make 5 using C as Color 1 and A as Color 2.
Make 4 using C as Color 1 and B as Color 2.
Make 2 using B as Color 1 and C as Color 2. 
With Color 1, ch 4. Join with sl st to first ch to form ring. 

1st rnd: Ch 2 (does not count as dC). (Popcorn in ring. Ch 1) 6 times. Join with sl st to first popcorn. Fasten off Color 1. Join Color 2 with sl st to any Popcorn st.

2nd rnd: Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 1. 3 dc) in same sp as last sl st. Ch 1. [(3 dc. Ch 1. 3 dc) in next Popcorn. Ch 1] 5 times. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. 

3rd rnd: Sl st to next ch-1 corner sp. Ch 3. (2 dc. Ch 1. 3 dc) in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 1. 2 dc in next ch-1 sp. Ch 1. (3 dc. Ch 1. 3 dc) in next ch-1 sp. Rep from * to last ch-1 sp. Ch 1. 2 dc in last ch-1 sp. Ch 1. Join with sl st to top of ch 3. Fasten off.

FINISHING 
Sew Motifs tog as shown in Assembly Diagram, matching A side to A side, B side to B side, etc.
Top Edging: Join C with sl st to top left of Stocking. 
1st rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st and ch-sp around. Ch 15 for hanging loop. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: Ball #1: 1 skein each of 505 Aruba Sea A; 885 Delft Blue B and 672 Spring Green C
Ball #2: 1 skein each of 706 Perfect Pink A; 254 Pumpkin B and 319 Cherry Red C
Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 4.5 mm [US G-6]
abbreviations: * or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
( ) = work directions in parentheses as indicated
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Ball measures 5” (13 cm) in diameter
gauge: Each flower = 2” (5 cm)
instructions:
BOW
With C, ch 52. Fasten off. Tie the chain in a bow around the base of the hanger. Trim yarn at the ends of the chain.

NOTE
Size of wrapped ball may vary. Make enough flowers to cover ball completely.

BALL (using color combination for Ball #1 or Ball #2)

FLOWER A (make 11)
With A, ch 2.
Round 1 (right side): 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook, join with slip st in first sc—6 sc. Fasten off.
Round 2: With right side facing, join B in last sc made, *ch 2, hdc in same st, ch 2, slip st in same st, slip st in next st; repeat from * around, ending with slip st in first st of last round—6 petals. Fasten off.

FLOWER B (make 11)
With B, ch 2.
Round 1 (right side): 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook, join with slip st in first sc—6 sc. Fasten off.
Round 2: With right side facing, join A in last sc made, *ch 2, hdc in same st, ch 2, slip st in same st, slip st in next st; repeat from * around, ending with slip st in first st of last round—6 petals. Fasten off.

FINISHING
With C, wrap yarn around the Styrofoam ball, covering the entire ball. Before gluing on the flowers, attach flowers to the ball with straight pins for placement. Add glue to the back of center and petals of each flower, glue to the yarn-wrapped ball. Straight pins can be used to hold flowers in place while drying.

HANGER
With C, ch 24. Fasten off. Fold chain in half and attach ends to the top of the ball. Weave in ends.

materials: Susan Bates® Crochet Hook: 3.75 mm [US F-5]
abbreviations: A, B, and C = Color A, B, and C
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
measurements: Ornament measures about 4½" [11 cm] tall.
gauge: 20 sts = 4" [10 cm]; 20 rows/rounds = 4" [10 cm] in single crochet.
instructions:
COLA BOTTLE
With A, ch 2.
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook—6 sc. Do not join, work in continuous rounds (spirals). Place a marker for beginning of round. Move marker up as each round is completed.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: [Sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times—18 sc.
Round 4: Working in back loops only, sc in each sc around.
Round 5: Sc in each sc around.
Round 6: [Sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog] 3 times—15 sc.
Rounds 7 and 8: Sc in each sc around.
Round 9: [Sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 3 times—18 sc.
Rounds 10 and 11: Sc in each sc around and change to B in last sc of Round 11.
Rounds 12–15: With B, sc in each sc around and change to A in last sc of Round 15.
Start stuffing bottle and continue to stuff as work progresses.
Round 16: [Sc in next 4 sc, sc2tog] 3 times—15 sc.
Round 17: [Sc in next 3 sc, sc2tog] 3 times—12 sc.
Round 18: Sc in each sc around.
Round 19: [Sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog] 3 times—9 sc.
Round 20: [Sc in next sc, sc2tog] 3 times—6 sc.
Rounds 21 and 22: Sc in each sc around.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail.

CAP
With B, ch 2.
Round 1 (right side): Work 8 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc—8 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, working in back loops only, sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc.
Fasten off, leaving a long tail.

FINISHING
With B, sew Cap to top of Bottle. Label: With yarn needle and C, using photograph as a guide, embroider back stitch "Cola" on front of Bottle. Fold gold ribbon in half. Insert crochet hook around a few stitches at top of ornament, place ribbon fold on hook and draw through to form a loop. Thread ends of ribbon through loop and pull to tighten. Tie ends together with bow or overhand knot to form hanging loop. Weave in any remaining ends.

materials: Red Heart® Amigurumi™ (3.5 oz/100 g; 239 yds/219 m)
Size U.S. B/1 (2.25 mm) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
½” [6 mm] rhinestones, sequins or beads.
Small length of red yarn (for wreath bow).
Small piece of light cardboard (for use inside spaceship fins).
abbreviations: Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through all 3 loops on hook
measurements: Approx 6½” [16.5 cm] tall
gauge: 22 sc and 24 rows = 4” [10 cm]
instructions:
Notes:
• Before start, separate the different color sections of the yarn as follows: Push the rings of color out from center. Find the point where the color changes and Break the yarn. Rep this process for the rem yarn colors. Wind each color into a separate ball.
• To change color, work to last 2 loops on hook and draw new color through last 2 loops and proceed, keeping color change to WS of work.
SPACESHIP BODY
Note: Do not join at end of rnd. Work in continuous rnds (spiral). PM at end of rnd to indicate end of rnd. Move marker up as each rnd is completed.
Beg at nose cone, with D, ch 2.
1st rnd: 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Do not join. 5 sc.
2nd rnd: 2 sc in each of next 5 sts. 10 sc.
3rd rnd: 1 sc in each st around.
4th rnd: (1 sc in next st. 2 sc in next st) 5 times. 15 sc.
5th rnd: Sc in each st around.
6th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 4 sts. 2 sc in next st) 3 times. 18 sc.
7th rnd: Sc in each st around.
8th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 5 sts. 2 sc in next st) 3 times. 21 sc.
9th rnd: 1 sc in each st around.
10th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 2 sts. 2 sc in next st) 7 times. 28 sc.
11th rnd: (1 sc in each of next 3 sts. 2 sc in next st) 7 times. 35 sc.
12th - 14th rnds: Sc in each st around. Sl st in next st and fasten off D.
Striped Section
Note: Join all rnds with sl st to first sc.
15th rnd: Join C with sl st in back loop of first st. ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each st around. Join.
16th rnd: With C, ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 4 sts. 2 sc in next st) 7 times. Join. 42 sc.
17th rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
18th rnd: With A, ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 5 sts. 2 sc in next st) 7 times. Join. 49 sc.
19th and 20th rnds: With C, 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st in first sc and change to A at end of 20th rnd.
21st rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
22nd rnd: With A, ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 6 sts. 2 sc in next st) 7 times. Join. 56 sc.
23rd rnd: With C, ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
24th rnd: With C, ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 7 sts. 2 sc in next st) 7 times. Join. 63 sc.
25th and 26th rnds: With A, 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st in first sc and change to C at end of 26th rnd.
27th rnd: With C, ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
28th rnd: With C, ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 7 sts. Sc2tog) 7 times. Join. 56 sc.
29th rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
30th rnd: With A, ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 6 sts. Sc2tog) 7 times. Join. 49 sc.
31st rnd: With C, ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
32nd rnd: With C, ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Sc2tog) 7 times. Join. 42 sc.
33rd rnd: With A, ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
34th rnd: With A, ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 4 sts. Sc2tog) 7 times. Join. 35 sc.
35th rnd: With C, ch 1. 1 sc in each st around. Join.
Stuff spaceship body firmly and continue stuffing as work progresses.
36th rnd: With C, ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 3 sts. Sc2tog) 7 times. Join. 28 sc.
37th and 38th rnds: With A, 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st in first sc and change to C at end of 38th rnd.
39th and 40th rnds: With C, 1 sc in each st around. Join with sl st in first sc and change to A at end of 40th rnd.
41st-44th rnds: Rep 37th-40th rnds. Do not change to A at the end of 44th rnd. Fasten off A.
Work all rem rnds with C only.
45th rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each st around. Join.
46th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 5 sts. Sc2tog) 4 times. Join. 24 sc.
47th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each of next 2 sts. Sc2tog) 6 times. Join. 18 sc.
48th rnd: Ch 1. (1 sc in each st. Sc2tog) 6 times. Join. 12 sc.
Finish stuffing spaceship body. Fasten off C, leaving a long end. Thread end through rem sts of last rnd and pull to close opening. Pull tightly. Fasten securely.
FINS (make 3)
With D, ch 2.
1st row: 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Turn. 3 sc.
2nd row: Ch 1. 2 sc in first st. 1 sc in next st. 2 sc in next st. Turn. 5 sc.
3rd row: Ch 1.1 sc in first st. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in next st. PM in this st (center st). 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in last st. Turn. 7 sc (3 sc on each side of marked center st).
4th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 2 sts. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in marked st and move marker to st just made. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of last 2 sts. Turn. 9 sc (4 sc on each side of marked center st).
5th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each st to 1 st before marked center st. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in center st and move marker to st just made. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each st to end of row. Turn. 11 sc (5 sc on each side of marked center st).
6th-9th rows: Rep 5th row 4 times more. Turn. 19 sc after 9th row.
Remove center marker.
10th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 4 sts. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 9 sts. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in last 4 sts. Turn. 21 sc.
11th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 5 sts. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 9 sts. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of last 5 sts. 1 sc in each of first 4 sts. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 9 sts. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of last 4 sts. Turn. 23 sc.
12th row: Ch 1. 1 sc in each of first 6 sts. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in each of next 9 sts. 2 sc in next st. 1 sc in last 6 sts. 25 sc. Fasten off, leaving a long end. 
Fold piece in half bringing side edges tog. Whipstitch side edges tog.
WREATH
With B, ch 16. Join with sl st in first ch to form a ring.
1st rnd: Ch 1. 40 hdc in ring. Join with sl st in first hdc. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Make Cardboard Fin Inserts
Place one fin piece flat on piece light cardboard and trace around it. Break out the triangle, rounding the corners to prevent shape from poking through. Rep to make a total of three inserts.
Hold one RS of fin and one WS of fin tog with RS facing out. Sew fins tog, inserting one cardboard piece before seam is complete. Finish sewing pieces tog then secure. Rep for all three fins.
Optional Porthole Window
Place wreath on foil cardstock. Trace a circle that is smaller in diameter than the outside of the wreath but a little larger than the diameter of the inside circle of the wreath. Break out circle and glue to back of wreath to form the reflective porthole glass. 
Note: A picture of Santa or other creature could be substituted for the foil paper so it would give the appearance of someone/something looking out of the spaceship porthole.
Glue red sequins approx ¼” [6 mm] apart or as desired around wreath. With scrap of red yarn, tie a small bow and glue it to the bottom of the wreath over the seam line if desired. 
Referring to picture as a guide to placement, sew the following pieces tog. 
Pin fins vertically with long cast-on edge against lower portion of spaceship body, making certain to space them evenly. Fins should be placed with the larger part of the triangle towards the bottom of the spaceship. Sew fins securely to bottom portion of spaceship.
Sew wreath to spaceship.
With craft glue, glue rhinestones, sequins or beads around first C-colored stripe to represent running lights approx ½” [1.5 cm] apart or as desired.
If desired, attach thread or fishing line to spaceship for hanging loop.

materials: Lily® Sugar ’n Cream® (2.5 oz/70.9 g ;120 yd/109 m)
Sizes U.S. G/6 (4 mm) and U.S. H/8 (5 mm) crochet hooks or size needed to obtain gauge.
2 styrofoam cake dummies 14" [35.5 cm] diameter by 3" [7.5 cm] tall
2 styrofoam cake dummies 12" [30.5 cm] diameter by 3" [7.5 cm] tall
2 styrofoam cake dummies 9" [23 cm] diameter by 3" [7.5 cm] tall
Optional Top Design: Small amount of Warm Brown (01130).
measurements: Large Tier: Approx 14" [35.5 cm] in diameter x 6" [15 cm] tall. Medium Tier: Approx 12" [30.5 cm] in diameter x 6" [15 cm] tall. Small Tier: Approx 9" [23 cm] in diameter x 6" [15 cm] tall.
gauge: 12 sc and 13 rows = 4" [10 cm] with larger hook and 2 strands of yarn worked tog. 13 sc and 14 rows = 4" [10 cm] with smaller hook and single strand of yarn.
instructions:
Cake Tiers
Note: Tiers are worked with 2 strands of yarn held tog. Large Tier: With A, work as given below until diameter measures 14" [35.5]. Skip to turning rnd. Medium Tier: With B, work as given below until diameter measures 12" [30.5 cm]. Skip to turning rnd. Small Tier: With C, work as given below until diameter measures 9" [23 cm]. Skip to turning rnd. With larger hook and 2 strands of yarn, ch 4. Join in ring with sl st to first ch. 1st rnd: Ch 1. 8 sc in ring. Join with sl st to first sc. 8 sc. 2nd rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. 16 sc. 3rd rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 24 sc. 4th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 32 sc. 5th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 40 sc 6th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 2 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 2 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 48 sc. 7th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 56 sc. 8th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 3 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 3 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 64 sc. 9th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 7 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 72 sc. 10th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 4 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 80 sc. 11th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 9 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 88 sc. 12th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 5 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 5 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 96 sc. 13th rnd: Ch 1. *2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 11 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 104 sc. 14th rnd: Ch 1. *1 sc in each of next 6 sc. 2 sc in next sc. 1 sc in each of next 6 sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st to first sc. 112 sc. If necessary cont as established inc 8 sts per rnd to desired diameter. Turning rnd: Ch 1. Working in back loops only, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Next rnd: Ch 1. Working in both loops, 1 sc in each sc around. Join with sl st to first sc. Rep last rnd until work from Turning rnd measures approx 6" [15 cm] Fasten off. Icing (work for all Tiers) Note: Worked with 1 strand of yarn. With smaller hook and holding work upside down, join D with sl st to any rem front loop of Turning rnd. 1st rnd: Ch 1. Working in rem front loops of Turning rnd , (1 sc. 1 dc. 1 sc) in each st around. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. Rosettes and Leaves Note: Worked with 1 strand of yarn. Large Rosette (make 6) With smaller hook and G, ch 20. 1st rnd: **1 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 hdc in next ch. Ch 2. Sl st in next ch. Ch 3. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. ch 2. Sl st in next ch. Ch 4. 1 tr in each of next 4 ch. Ch 3. Sl st in next ch. ** Ch 4. 1 tr in each of next 6 ch. Ch 3. Sl st in last ch. Fasten off. Small Rosette (make 13) With smaller hook and G, ch 12. Work from ** to ** as given for Large Rosette. Fasten off. Finishing: Coil foundation ch into Rosette with hdc section in center. Sew lightly to secure. Large Leaf (make 12) With smaller hook and E, ch 10. 1st row: 1 tr in 4th ch from hook. 1 tr in each of next 2 ch. 1 dc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 sc in next ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working across opposite side of foundation ch, 1 sc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in next ch. 1 tr in each of next 2 ch. Ch 4. Sl st in same sp as first tr. Fasten off. Small Leaf (make 26) With smaller hook and E, ch 8. 1st row: 1 dc in 3rd ch from hook. 1 dc in each of next 2 ch. 2 hdc in next ch. 1 sc in next ch. 3 sc in last ch. Working across opposite side of foundation ch, 1 sc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 2 dc. Ch 3. Sl st in same sp as 1st dc. Fasten off. Piping With smaller hook and D, make a ch approx 44" [112 cm] long for Large Tier, 38" [96.5 cm] long for Medium Tier, and 28" [71 cm] long for Small Tier. Finishing Fit Tiers over Styrofoam forms and stack with Large Tier on bottom, Medium in middle and Small on top. Glue in place. Glue piping and Rosettes to Tiers as seen in picture: 4 Small Rosettes each with 2 Small Leaves on Small Tier, 6 Small Rosettes with 2 Small Leaves each on Medium tier and 6 Large Rosettes each with 2 Large Leaves on Large Tier. Glue rem 3 Small Rosettes with 2 Small Leaves each to top of Cake. Optional Top Design Draw or print message to size on paper. Glue yarn to design on paper and allow to dry. Cut out design close to yarn and glue to top of cake.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Bamboo Crochet Thread, Size 10: 1 ball 320 Mushroom.
abbreviations: Beg shell = slip st in next 2 dc and into next space, (ch 2, 2 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) all in same space.
Shell = (3 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) all in space indicated.
Picot = ch 3, slip st in top of last st made.

Triple Picot = ch 4, slip st into the top and side of the last st made, ch 5, slip st into the same st again catching the front loop of the first ch-4 loop, ch 4, slip st into the same st again catching the front loop of the first ch-4 loop and ch-5 loop.
measurements: Doily measures 17” across.
gauge: Rounds 1-5 = 2” across. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
DOILY
Ch 5; join with a slip st in 5th ch from hook to form ring.
Round 1: Ch 2 (counts as a dc), 15 dc in ring; join with a slip st in top of ch-2 – 16 sts.
Round 2: Ch 3 (counts as a tr), fptr around same st as joining, * tr in next dc, fptr around same dc; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in top of ch-3 – 32 sts.
Round 3: Ch 1, sc in same st as joining, (dc, fpdc, dc) all in next fptr, * sc in next tr, (dc, fpdc, dc) all in next fptr; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in first sc.
Round 4: Slip st in next dc, (slip st, ch 1, sc) all in next fpdc, * ch 4, sc in next fpdc; repeat from * around; (ch 1, dc) in first sc to join and form last space.
Round 5: Ch 1, sc over dc, * ch 5, sc in next ch-4 space; repeat from * around; (ch 1, dc) in first sc to join and form last space.
Round 6: Ch 1, sc over dc, * 5 dc in next sc, sc in next ch-5 space **, ch 5, sc in next ch-5 space; repeat from * around, end at **; (ch 2, dc) in first sc to join and form last space.
Round 7: Ch 1, sc over dc, * ch 6, skip next 2 dc, sc in next dc **, ch 6, sc in next ch-5 space; repeat from * around, end at **; (ch 2, edc) in first sc to join and form last space.
Round 8: Ch 1, sc over edc, 5 dc in same sc as joining, * sc in next ch-6 space **, ch 6, sc in next ch-6 space, 5 dc in next sc; repeat from * around, end at **; (ch 2, edc) in first sc to join and form last space.
Round 9: Ch 1, sc over edc, * ch 7, skip next 2 dc, sc in next dc, ch 7 **, sc in next ch-6 space; repeat from * around, end at **; join with a slip st in first sc.
Round 10: Slip st in ch-7 space, ch 1, 5 sc in same space, ch 3, * 5 sc in next ch-7 space, ch 3; repeat from * around; join with a slip st in front loop of first sc.
Round 11: Working in front loops only, ch 1, sc in same sc, * [ch 2, sc in next sc] 4 times, 3 sc in next ch-3 space **, sc in next sc; repeat from * around, end at **; join.
Round 12: Slip st into back loop of the first 3 sc of Round 10, working in back loops only, ch 1, sc in same sc, * ch 3, skip next 3 sc, (tr, ch 3, tr) all in next sc, ch 3, skip next 3 sc **, sc in back loop of next sc; repeat from * around, end at **; join.
Round 13: Slip st into ch-3 space, ch 1, * (2 sc, ch 3, 2 sc) all in ch-3 space, (2 sc, ch 4, 2 sc) all in next ch-3 space, (2 sc, ch 3, 2 sc) all in next ch-3 space; repeat from * around; join. Fasten off. Weave in ends.
Round 14: With right side facing, attach thread in any ch-4 space; (ch 2, 2 dc, ch 3, 3 dc) all in same space, * ch 7, dc in next ch-4 space, ch 7 **, shell in next ch-4 space; repeat from * around, end at **; join in top of ch-2.
Round 15: Beg shell, * ch 3, (sc, ch 2, sc) all in next ch-7 space, ch 3, (tr, fptr, tr) all in next dc, ch 3, (sc, ch 2, sc) all in next ch-7 space, ch 3 **, shell in next ch-3 space; repeat from * around, end at **; join.
Round 16: Beg shell, * ch 6, (tr, fptr) in next tr, (tr, fptr, tr) in next fptr, (fptr, tr) in next tr, ch 6 **, shell in next ch-3 space; repeat from * around, end at **; join.
Round 17: Beg shell, * ch 3, (sc, ch 2, sc) in next ch-6 space, ch 3, tr in next tr, fptr in next fptr, tr in next tr, (fptr, tr, fptr) in next fptr, tr in next tr, fptr in next fptr, tr in next tr, ch 3, (sc, ch 2, sc) in next ch-6 space, ch 3 **, shell in next ch-3 space; repeat from * around, end at **; join.
Round 18: Beg shell, * ch 4, [(tr, fptr, tr) in next tr, fptr in next fptr, tr in next tr, fptr in next fptr] twice, (tr, fptr, tr) in next tr, ch 4 **, shell in next ch-3 space; repeat from * around, end at **; join.
Round 19: Beg shell, * ch 2, sc in next ch-4 space, ch 2, (tr, fptr, tr) in next tr, [fptr in next fptr, tr in next tr] 3 times, (fptr, tr, fptr) in next fptr, [tr in next tr, fptr in next fptr] 3 times, (tr, fptr, tr) in next tr, ch 2, sc in next ch-4 space, ch 2 **, shell in next ch-3 space; repeat from * around, end at **; join.
Round 20: Beg shell, * ch 3, sc in next tr, (dc, fpdc, dc) in next fptr, sc in next tr, [ch 3, skip fptr, sc in next tr] 8 times, (dc, fpdc, dc) in next fptr, sc in next tr, ch 3 **, shell in next ch-3 space; repeat from * around, end at **; join.
Round 21: (Slip st, ch 2, 2 dc, ch 3, dc, ch 3, 3 dc) all in next ch-3 space, * ch 3, sc in next fpdc, skip next dc, 3 dc in next sc, sc in next ch-3 space, [ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space] 7 times, 3 dc in next sc, skip next dc, sc in next fpdc, ch 3, skip next ch-3 space **, (3 dc, ch 3, dc, ch 3, 3 dc) in next ch-3 space; repeat from * around, end at **; join.
Round 22: Slip st to next ch-3 space, ch 2, 2 dc in same space, * ch 3, 5 dc in next dc, ch 3, 3 dc in next ch-3 space, ch 3, skip next ch-3 space and next 2 sts, sc in next dc, 3 dc in next sc, sc in next ch-3 space, [ch 3, sc in next ch-3 space] 6 times, 3 dc in next sc, skip next dc, sc in next dc, ch 3, skip next ch-3 space **, 3 dc in next ch-3 space; repeat from * around, end at **; join. Fasten off.
Weave in ends.
AUNT LYDIA’S® Bamboo Crochet Thread, 100% Viscose from Bamboo Size 10, Art. 148 available in 300 yd (276 m) balls.

materials: Aunt Lydia’s® Crochet Thread Classic™ 10 (White & Natural: 400 yds/365.76 m, Colors: 300 yds/274.32 m)
Contrast A Frosty Green (0661) 2 balls or 285 yds/260 m
Contrast B White (0001) 1 ball or 15 yds/10 m
Contrast C Peacock (0856) 1 ball or 15 yds/10 m
Size U.S. E/4 (3.75 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Approx 24½" x 30" [62 x 76 cm].
gauge: 3 pat reps (30 sts) and 20 rows = 5" [12.5 cm].
instructions:
Notes:
• Ch 3 at beg of row counts as dc.
• To join new color, work to last 2 loops on hook. Draw new color through last 2 loops then proceed in new color.

With A, ch 192. Place marker on every 50th ch for easier counting.

1st row: (WS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. *Ch 5. Skip next 3 ch. 1 sc in next ch. Rep from * to last 2 ch. Ch 2. Skip next ch. 1 dc in last ch. Turn. 47 ch-5 sps.

2nd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first dc. Skip next ch-2 sp. *7 dc in next ch-5 sp. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp.** Ch 5. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp. Rep from *, ending last rep at **. Ch 2. 1 tr in last sc. Turn. 15 pat reps.

3rd row: Ch 1. 1 sc in first tr. *Ch 5. Skip next sc and dc. 1 sc in next dc. Ch 5. Skip next 3 dc. 1 sc in next dc.** Ch 5. Skip next dc and sc. 1 sc in next ch-5 sp. Rep from *, ending last rep at **. Ch 2. Skip next dc. 1 tr in last sc. Turn.

Rep 2nd and 3rd rows for pat until work from beg measures approx 28" [71cm], ending on a 3rd row. Join B. Break A.

With B, rep 2nd and 3rd rows once more. Join C. Break B.

With C, rep 2nd and 3rd rows once more. Fasten off.

FINISHING
Pin Curtain to measurements and cover with damp cloth, leaving cloth to dry.

materials: Bernat® Velvet Minis™ 1 Kit includes: 20 balls (1.2 oz/35 g; 41 yds/38 m) each total (25 oz/700 g)
Contrast A  Snowy White 1 ball or 18 yds/16 m
Contrast B Velveteal 1 ball or 15 yds/14 m
Contrast C Smokey Green 1 ball or 15 yds/14 m
Contrast D Blackbird 1 ball or 3 yds/3 m
Note: 1 ball of each A, B, C and D will make 2 Wreaths.
Size U.S. E/4 (3.5 mm) Susan Bates® Silvalume® crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
One 6" [15 cm] metal craft ring per Wreath.
One 6" x 8" [15 x 20.5 cm] piece of felt per Wreath.
Hot glue gun and glue sticks.
abbreviations: Lp st = Loop stitch (worked on WS) = Insert hook in next stitch. Wrap working yarn over top of index finger, from front to back, to form 1" [2.5 cm] loop. Placing tip of hook behind yarn at front of index finger, yoh and draw up a loop onto hook. Yoh and draw through 2 loops on hook, dropping loop off index finger to back of work (see diagram). Loop will be formed on RS of work.
Sc2tog = Draw up a loop in each of next 2 stitches. Yoh and draw through all loops on hook
measurements: Approx 6" [15 cm] diameter.
gauge: 15 sc and 15 rows = 4" [10 cm]. Flower = 4" [10 cm] diameter. Leaf = 2½" [6 cm] long.
instructions:
FLOWER
Petal Rounds (make 2) See diagram on page 3.
With A, ch 10. Join with sl st to first ch to form a ring, taking care not to twist ch.
1st row: (WS). Ch 6. 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Working back down ch-6 toward ch-10 ring, 1 sc in each of next 4 ch. Sl st in next ch of ch-10 ring. Turn.
2nd row: (RS). Ch 3. 1 dc in each of first 4 sc. 2 sc in next sc. Ch 2. Working back down opposite side of last ch-6 toward ch-10 ring, 2 sc in next rem loop. 1 dc in each of next 4 rem loop. Ch 3. Sl st in same rem loop as last dc. Sl st in each of next 2 ch of ch-10 ring. Turn.
Last 2 rows form one Petal.
Rep 1st and 2nd rows 4 times more to complete 4 more Petals (total of 5 Petals), ending with sl st in same rem loop as last dc.
Fasten off.
Center
With D, ch 2.
1st rnd: (RS). 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st to first sc of rnd. Turn.
2nd rnd: (WS). Ch 1. 2 Lp st in each sc around. Join with sl st to first st of rnd. 10 Lp sts.
Fasten off.
Flower Finishing: Place two Petal Rounds RS up, aligning Ch-10 rings and offsetting Petals. Place Center RS up on top of Petal Rounds and sew all three pieces tog to form Flower (as shown in photo).

Leaf (Make 3 each with B and C).
Ch 5. See diagram on page 3.
1st rnd: (5 tr. Ch 1. 5 tr) all in 5th ch from hook (counts as ch 4. 5 tr. Ch 1. 5 tr). Ch 4. Sl st in same 5th ch from hook.
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 5 sc in first ch-4 sp (working around first ch-4 along bottom edge of Leaf ). 1 sc in next tr. 2 sc in next tr. 2 hdc in next tr. 2 dc in next tr. 1 dc in next tr. (2 tr. Ch 2. 2 tr) all in next ch-1 sp. 1 dc in next tr. 2 dc in next tr. 2 hdc in next tr. 2 sc in next tr. 1 sc in last tr. 5 sc in next ch-4 sp (working around last ch-4 along bottom edge of Leaf ). Join with sl st in first ch-1. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Attaching Flower and Leaves to Craft Ring: Tie Flower and Leaves to metal craft ring as shown in photo. Center piece of felt behind metal craft ring, Flower, and Leaves. Using hot glue gun and glue sticks, glue WS of Flowers and Leaves in place along metal craft ring at the same time also gluing them to felt piece to secure in place and create a sturdy backing for the decorations. Trim edges of felt close to Flower and Leaves so it is hidden behind decorations when viewed from RS (as shown in photo).
Hanging String: Cut strand of B 20" [51 cm] long. Attach with Lark’s Head Knot to top of metal craft ring (as shown in diagram). Tie tail ends tog to desired length for hanging and trim ends.
Attach Hanging String with Lark’s Head Knot.

materials: RED HEART® 'Designer Sport™': 1 ball each 3215 Lemon Zest A, 3261 Terra Cotta B, 3570 Iced Violet C, 3620 Celadon D, 3801 Aqua Ice E, 3730 Blush Rose F and 3369 Cocoa G.
Split lock stitch marker, yarn needle, poly-fill stuffing.
abbreviations: dec (decrease) = draw up a loop in next 2 sc, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
measurements: Cozy stands about 3½” tall.
gauge: 4 sts = 1”; 5 rnds = 1” in sc. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
CHICK (Make 4) 
Head-Rnd 1: With A, ch 2; 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Rnd 2: [Inc] 6 times – 12 sc.
Rnd 3: Sc in each sc around.
Rnd 4: [Sc in next 3 sc, inc] 3 times – 15 sc.
Rnd 5: [Sc in next 4 sc, inc] 3 times – 18 sc.
Rnds 6 and 7: Sc in each sc around.
Rnd 8: [Sc in next sc, dec] 6 times – 12 sc.
Neck-Rnd 9: [Dec] 6 times – 6 sc.
Rnd 10: Working in front loops only on this rnd, inc in each st around – 12 sc.
Body-Rnds 11 and 12: Repeat Rnds 4 and 5 – 18 sc.
Rnd 13: [Sc in next 5 sc, inc] 3 times – 21 sc.
Rnds 14-16: Sc in each sc around.
Rnd 17: [Sc in next 6 sc, inc] 3 times – 24 sc.
Rnds 18 and 19: Sc in each sc around. Fasten off. Stuff head section only and sew the opening inside the neck closed.
Wing (Make 8)
Rnd 1: With A ch 2; 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Rnd 2: [Sc in next 2 sc, inc] twice – 8 sc.
Rnds 3-5: Sc in each sc around. Fasten off. Do not stuff. Hold flat and sew in place as pictured.
Foot (Make 8)
Row 1: With B ch 5; slip st in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next ch, hdc in next ch, dc in last ch; turn.
Row 2: Ch 2, dc in dc, hdc in hdc, sc in sc, slip st in slip st. Fasten off. Sew in place as pictured.
Tail (Make 4)
With A [ch 9, slip st in 2nd ch from hook and in next 7 ch] 3 times; join to first slip st with a slip st. Fasten off. Sew in place at lower edge of back.
Beak (Make 4)
Rnd 1: With B ch 2; 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Rnd 2: Sc in each sc around. Fasten off. Sew in place as pictured. Embroider French knot eyes above beak with G.
Baby Bonnet (Make 1) 
Row 1: With C ch 10; sc in 2nd ch from hook and next 7 ch, 3 sc in last ch, working on opposite side of ch, sc in next 8 ch; turn – 19 sc.
Rows 2-6: Ch 1, sc in each sc across; turn.
Brim-Row 7: Working in back loops only, slip st in next sc, [3 sc in next sc, slip st in next sc] 9 times. Fasten off. Sew in place.
Father’s Hat (Make 1)
Rnd 1: With G ch 2; 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Rnd 2: [Inc] 6 times – 12 sc.
Rnd 3: [Sc in next sc, inc] 6 times – 18 sc.
Rnd 4: Working in back loops only, sc in each sc around.
Rnd 5: Working in both loops, sc in each sc around.
Rnd 6: Working in front loops only, inc in each st around – 36 sc. Fasten off. Sew in place.
Mother’s Beret (Make 1)
Rnds 1-3: With D repeat Rnds 1-3 of Father’s Hat.
Rnd 4: [Sc in next 2 sc, inc] 6 times – 24 sc.
Rnd 5: [Sc in next 3 sc, inc] 6 times – 30 sc.
Rnd 6: Working in back loops for this rnd only, [sc in next sc, dec] 10 times – 20 sc.
Rnds 7 and 8: Sc in each sc around. Fasten off.
Flower (Make 1)
Rnd 1: With F ch 2; 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook.
Rnd 2: (Slip st, ch 1, hdc, ch 1) all in each sc around; join with a slip st in first slip st. Fasten off. Sew to side of beret. Sew flower in place. Sew beret in place.
Baseball Cap (Make 1)
Visor-Row 1: With E ch 2; 5 sc in 2nd ch from hook; turn.
Row 2: Ch 1, [inc] 5 times; turn – 10 sc.
Hat-Row 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc across, ch 14, slip st in first sc of Row 3; turn.
Rnd 4: Skip slip st, sc in each ch and in each sc around – 21 sc. Now work in continuous rnds without joining.
Rnd 5: Sc in each sc around.
Rnd 6: [Sc in next 5 sc, dec] 3 times – 18 sc.
Rnd 7: [Sc in next 4 sc, dec] 3 times – 15 sc.
Rnd 8: [Sc in next 3 sc, dec] 3 times – 12 sc.
Rnd 9: [Dec] 6 times – 6 sc. Fasten off leaving a long yarn tail. Weave yarn tail through remaining sts; draw up firmly. Sew cap in place.

materials: Lily Sugar’n Cream 4-ply Worsted Weight, 2.5 oz/70.9 g (Solids)
Size 4.00 mm (U.S. G or 6) crochet hook or size needed to obtain gauge.
measurements: Gauge: 16 sc and 16 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
gauge: 16 sc and 16 rows = 4 ins [10 cm].
instructions:
Daffodil (make 6): 
With A, ch 2. 
1st rnd: (RS). 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. Join with sl st in back loop of first sc. 
First Petal: 1st row: Ch 1. 2 sc in back loop of same sc as last sl st. Ch 1. Turn. 
2nd row: 2 sc in each sc. 4 sc. Ch 1. Turn. 
3rd to 5th rows: 1 sc in each sc to end of row. Ch 1. Turn. 
6th row: (Draw up a loop in each of next 2 sc. Yoh and draw through 3 loops on hook - sc dec made) twice. Ch 3. Turn. 
7th row: Miss first sc. Sl st in next sc. Sl st in side of each of next 5 rows of petal. Sl st in last sc worked on 1st row and in back loop of next sc. Do not turn. 
Second to Sixth Petals: 1st row: Ch 1. 2 sc in back loop of same sc as last sl st. Ch 1. Turn. 
2nd to 7th rows: Work as given for 2nd to 7th rows of First Petal. At end of Sixth Petal, fasten off. 
Trumpet: Join C with sl st to any front loop of 1st rnd. 1st rnd: Ch 1. 2 sc in same sp as last sl st. *2 sc in next front loop of sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. 
2nd rnd: Ch 1. 1 sc in same sp as last sl st. *Ch 1. 1 sc in next sc. Rep from * around. Join with sl st in first sc. Fasten off. 
Leaf (make 12): With B, ch 12. 
1st rnd: (RS). 1 sc in 2nd ch from hook. 1 sc in next ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 4 ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 3 sc in last ch. 
Working in other side of ch, proceed as follows: 1 sc in each of next 2 ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 dc in each of next 4 ch. 1 hdc in next ch. 1 sc in next ch. 2 sc in next ch. Join with sl st to first sc. Fasten off. 
Assembly: Wrap wire with B. Glue yarn ends in place when done. Thread wire through center of flower and twist the end of the wire into a tight spiral. 
Glue back of flower to wire to secure. Thread wire through point of two leaves and glue in position.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 Skein 311 White A and 319 Cherry Red B will make 7 to 8 mittens.
Split lock stitch marker; yarn needle; sewing needle and white thread.
abbreviations: [ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified.
measurements: Mittens measure 6½” long.
gauge: Snowflake measures 3¼” across with smaller hook. 16 sts = 4”; 16 rnds = 4” in sc with larger hook. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hooks to obtain the gauges.
instructions:
With larger hook and A, ch 26; join with a slip st to form a ring taking care that ch is not twisted.
Rnd 1: Ch 1, sc in joining and in each ch around changing to B in last sc; join with a slip st in first sc – 26 sc. Fasten off A.
Rnds 2-5: With B, ch 1, sc in each sc around; join.
Start Thumb-Rnd 6: Ch 1, sc in first 12 sc, [2 sc in next sc] twice, sc in last 12 sc; join – 28 sc.
Rnd 7: Ch 1, sc in first 13 sc, [2 sc in next sc] twice, sc in last 13 sc; join – 30 sc.
Rnd 8: Ch 1, sc in first 14 sc, [2 sc in next sc] twice, sc in last 14 sc; join – 32 sc.
Rnd 9: Ch 1, sc in first 15 sc, [2 sc in next sc] twice, sc in last 15 sc; join – 34 sc.
Rnds 10-13: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join.
Top of Mitten-Rnd 14: Ch 1, sc in first 13 sc, ch 1, skip next 8 sc (thumb), sc in last 13 sc; join – 26 sc.
Rnd 15: Ch 1, sc in first 13 sc, skip ch-1, sc in last 13 sc; join – 26 sc.
Rnds 16-23: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join.
Rnd 24: Ch 1; [draw up a loop in next sc] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook – sc2tog made; [sc2tog] 12 times; join – 13 sc.
Rnd 25: Ch 1, [sc2tog] 6 times, sc in last sc; join – 7 sc. Fasten off leaving long yarn tail. With yarn tail in yarn needle, weave through remaining sts; draw up firmly; fasten securely.
Thumb-Rnd 1: With right side facing and larger hook, attach B at ch-1 of thumb opening; ch 1, sc in 8 sc of thumb; join.
Rnds 2 and 3: Ch 1, sc in each sc around; join.
Rnd 4: Ch 1, [sc2tog] 4 times; join. Fasten off leaving long yarn tail. With yarn tail in yarn needle, weave through remaining sts; draw up firmly; fasten securely.
FINISHING-Edging and Hanging Loop: With right side facing and larger hook, attach A at joining of beginning ch; slip st in each ch around, ch 10, slip st in same st as last slip st. Fasten off.
Snowflake: With smaller hook and A, ch 5; join with a slip st to form a ring.
Rnd 1: Ch 1, [2 sc in ring, ch 3] 6 times; join with a slip st in first sc – 6 ch-3 loops.
Rnd 2: Slip st in next sc, ch 1, [(2 sc, ch 3, 2 sc) all in ch-3 loop] 6 times; join.
Rnd 3: Slip st in next sc, ch 1, [(sc, ch 3, sc, ch 5, sc, ch 3, sc) all in ch-3 loop, ch 2] 6 times; join. Fasten off and weave in ends.
FINISHING: Using sewing needle and thread, attach snowflake to top of mitten.

materials: AUNT LYDIA’S® Classic Crochet Thread, Size 10: 1 ball 1 White
3” diameter Styrofoam ball (for forming crochet piece)
abbreviations: () = work directions in parentheses into same st
[] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Each ornament measures about 3” across.
gauge: Each design fits a 3” diameter ball. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
DIAMOND SPOKE STITCH ORNAMENT (Shown at lower left of photo)
Ch 10; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 6 (counts as first trtr), trtr in ring, [ch 3, tr in ring, ch 3, 2 trtr in ring] 5 times, ch 3, tr in ring, ch 3; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-6—12 trtr, 6 tr, and 12 ch-3 spaces.
Round 2: Ch 4 (counts as first tr), tr through top of post (under 3 loops) of next trtr, ch 10, [tr through post of each of next 2 trtr, ch 10] 5 times; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-4—12 tr and 6 ch-10 spaces.
Round 3 (Spoke Round): *[Ch 5, slip st in 3rd ch from hook, ch 2, skip next ch, tr in next ch] 8 times, ch 10, slip st in top of last tr made, [ch 5, slip st in 3rd ch from hook, ch 2, slip st in ch under tr] 8 times, slip st through post of next tr of Round 2 (spoke completed); slip st in each of first 4 ch of next ch-10 space, ch 5, slip st in 3rd ch from hook, ch 2, skip next 2 ch of same ch-10 space, slip st in each of last 4 ch of same ch-10 space**, slip st through post of next tr; repeat from * around ending last repeat at **; join with slip st in base of beginning ch—6 spokes. 
Fasten off and weave in ends.
PICOT SPOKE STITCH ORNAMENT (Shown at upper right of photo)
Ch 10; join with slip st in first ch to form a ring.
Round 1: Ch 3 (counts as first dc), 2 dc in ring, ch 3, [3 dc in ring, ch 3] 5 times; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—18 dc, and 6 ch-3 spaces.
Round 2: Slip st in next 2 dc, (slip st, ch 3, 2 dc) in first ch-3 space, ch 6, [3 dc in next ch-3 space, ch 6] 5 times; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-3—18 dc, and 6 ch-6 spaces.
Round 3 (Spoke Round): *Slip st in next dc, [ch 5, triple-picot] 5 times, ch 14, hdc in 12th ch from hook and in next 2 ch, [triple-picot, hdc in next 5 ch] 5 times (spoke completed), (4 sc, triple-picot, 4 sc) in next ch-6 space; repeat from * around; join with slip st in same st as first slip st—6 spokes.
Fasten off and weave in ends.
FINISHING
Cover 3” Styrofoam ball with plastic wrap. Saturate crochet in stiffener and shape around ball. Allow to dry. When piece is rigid, remove Styrofoam ball and insert satin ball. Tie or sew loops together at top. Using ribbon tie a bow to the top of the ornament and attach an ornament hanger.

materials: RED HEART® Super Saver®: One skein each 336 Warm Brown A, 365 Coffee B, 505 Aruba Sea C, 321 Gold D, 320 Cornmeal E, and 316 Soft White F
Susan Bates® Crochet Hooks: 5.5mm [I-9 US] and 3.75mm [F-5 US]
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
( ) = work directions in parentheses into same st
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated.
measurements: Cover measures 4½” tall x 4½” diameter (11.5 x 11.5 cm)
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
Tummy
With smaller hook and D, ch 2.
Rounds 1–5: Work same as Rounds 1–5 of cover; change to E at end of Round 5.
Feathers
Round 6: Ch 1, *sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc, ch 15, sc in next sc, [ch 15, sc] twice in next sc, ch 15, sc in next sc, ch 15, sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc; repeat from * once; join with slip st in first sc—36 sc. Fasten off.
Feet
With right side facing and smaller hook, join D with slip st to 5th sc from last ch-15 space made.
Row 1: [Ch 5, slip st in next sc] 4 times. Fasten off.
Beak
With smaller hook and D, ch 2.
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; do not join, work in continuous rounds (spiral)—6 sc.
Rounds 2 and 3: Sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first st at end of Round 3. Fasten off.
Eyes and Ears (make 2 each)
With smaller hook and F, ch 2.
Round 1: Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st to first sc; change to B—6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc; join with slip st in first sc; change to C—12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, [sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—18 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, [sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc; change to A—24 sc.
Cover
With larger hook and A, ch 2.
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook; join with slip st in first sc—6 sc.
Round 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc—12 sc.
Round 3: Ch 1, [sc in next sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—18 sc.
Round 4: Ch 1, [sc in next 2 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—24 sc.
Round 5: Ch 1, [sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—30 sc.
Round 6: Ch 1, [sc in next 4 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—36 sc.
Round 7: Ch 1, [sc in next 5 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—42 sc.
Round 8: Ch 1, [sc in next 6 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—48 sc.
Round 9: Ch 2 (counts as first hdc here and throughout), working in back loops only, hdc in each sc around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2, turn.
Round 10–20: Ch 2, working in both loops, hdc in each hdc around; join with slip st in top of beginning ch-2, turn. Fasten off at end of Round 20.
Round 5: Ch 1, [sc in next 3 sc, 2 sc in next sc] 6 times; join with slip st in first sc—30 sc.
Round 6: Ch 1, sc in next sc, hdc in next sc, (2 dc, ch 2, 2 dc) in next sc, hdc in next sc, sc in next, slip st in next st. Fasten off.
ASSEMBLY
Use photograph as a guide to placement of all pieces. With E, whipstitch tummy to cover. Position eyes over tummy with ears at top and pointing in opposite directions; with A, whipstitch eyes to cover. With D, whipstitch beak to cover centered between eyes and tummy.
FINISHING
Weave in ends. Insert toilet tissue roll in cover.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 Skein each 313 Aran A, 334 Buff B, 400 Grey Heather C, 505 Aruba Sea D, 319 Cherry Red E, 312 Black F, 256 Carrot G.
Split-ring stitch marker, stuffing, yarn needle, black embroidery floss and embroidery needle, 3 ¼” black buttons, 4 ¼” red buttons, red crayon.
abbreviations: Sc2tog = [draw up a loop in next st] twice, yo and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
To Change Color: Work last st of row until 2 loops are left on hook, drop old color, yo with new color and complete stitch. Fasten off old color.
measurements: Snowman & Boy are 6¼” tall.
gauge: 16 sc = 4”; 16 rounds = 4”. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
SNOWMAN
Head & Body
With A, ch 2.
Round 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook – 6 sts.
Round 2: 2 sc in each st around – 12 sts.
Round 3: * Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around – 18 sts.
Rounds 4-7: Sc in each st around.
Round 8: *Sc2tog; repeat from * around – 9 sts.
Round 9: 2 sc in each st around – 18 sts.
Round 10: * Sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around – 24 sts.
Rounds 11-14: Sc in each st around.
Round 15: *Sc2tog; repeat from * around – 12 sts.
Round 16: 2 sc in each st around – 24 sts.
Round 17: * Sc in next 3 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around – 30 sts.
Rounds 18-22: Sc in each st around.
Round 23: *Sc2tog; repeat from * around – 15 sts. Add stuffing.
Round 24: Sc in next st, [sc2tog] 7 times – 8 sts. Fasten off leaving a long tail. Weave tail through remaining sts and draw tight.
Carrot Nose
With G, ch 3.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook, dc in next ch. Fasten off, leaving long tail for sewing.
Hat
With F, ch 2.
Rounds 1-3: Work same as Head & Body Rounds 1-3 – 18 sts.
Round 4: Working in back loops only, sc in each st around.
Rounds 5-7: Sc in each st around.
Round 8: Working in front loops only, 2 hdc in each st around – 36 sts. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew Carrot Nose in half and sew into place on Snowman’s face. Embroider eyes according to picture. Sew buttons in place. Sew Hat on Head. Weave in ends.
BOY
Head & Body
With B, ch 2.
Rounds 1-8: Work same as Snowman Head & Body Rounds 1-8 – 9 sts.
Round 9: Sc in each st around.
Round 10: 2 sc in each st around – 18 sts.
Round 11: Sc in each st around.
Round 12: Repeat Round 11; change to C.
Round 13: With C, sc in each st around. 
Cuff-Round 11: Join A in any unused loop of Round 7, ch 1, sc in front loop only of each st around; join with a slip st. Fasten off.
Thumbs (Make 2)
With E, ch 2.
Row 1: Dc in 2nd ch from hook. Fasten off. Fold in half and sew in place.
Hat
With C, ch 2.
Rounds 1-3: Work same as Snowman Head & Body Rounds 1-3; change to D at end of Round 3 – 18 sts
Round 4: With D, * sc in next 2 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around – 24 sts.
Round 5: Sc in each st around; change to C.
Round 6: Sc in next 3 sts, * (sc, ch 1, hdc) all in next st, dc in next 2 sts, (hdc, ch 1, sc) all in next st, ** sc in next 10 sts; repeat from * to **; sc in next 3 sts. Fasten off.
FINISHING
Sew Hat in place. Embroider face referring to photo. Color cheeks with red crayon. Sew Legs in place. Wrap Coat around Body with opening in front; sew opening closed. Sew Coat Panel over opening; sew buttons in place. Sew Collar around neck. Sew Arms to Coat referring to photo. Tack Boy and Snowman together referring to photo.
Legs (Make 2)
With E, ch 2.
Round 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook – 6 sts.
Round 2: 2 sc in each st around – 12 sts.
Round 3: Sc in next 5 sts, [2 sc in next st] 2 times; sc in next 5 sts – 14 sts.
Round 4: Working in back loops only, sc in each st around.
Round 5: Sc in next 5 sts, [sc2tog] 2 times; sc in next 5 sts – 12 sts.
Round 6: * Sc in next st, sc2tog; repeat from * around – 8 sts.
Round 7: Sc in each st around.
Round 8: Working in front loops only, * sc in next st, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around; change to C – 12 sts.
Round 9: With C, working in unused back loops of Round 7, sc in each st around – 8 sts.
Round 10: Sc in each st around. Fasten off. Add stuffing. Turn up cuff of boot.
Coat
With D, ch 13.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across; turn – 12 sts.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in 1st st, 2 sc in next st, * sc in next st, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * across; turn – 18 sts.
Row 3: Ch 1, sc in 1st 5 sts, 2 sc in next st, * sc in next 5 sts, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * across; turn – 21 sts.
Rows 4-8: Ch 1, sc in each st across; turn. Fasten off at end of Row 8.
Collar
With A, ch 15.
Row 1: Sc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across – 14 sts. Fasten off.
Coat Panel
With D, ch 9.
Row 1: Hdc in 2nd ch from hook and in each ch across – 8 sts. Fasten off.
Arms (Make 2)
With D, ch 2.
Round 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook – 6 sts.
Round 2: * Sc in next st, 2 sc in next st; repeat from * around – 9 sts.
Rounds 3-7: Sc in each st around. Fasten off D at end of Round 7.
Round 8: Join E in back loop of any st, ch 1, sc in back loop only of each st around.
Rounds 9-10: Sc in each st around. At end of Round 10, add stuffing, fasten off and draw remaining sts together.

materials: RED HEART® Soft®: 1 ball each 1882 Toast A, 9114 Honey B, 4422 Tangerine C, 9388 Wheat D, and 9870 Deep Sea E
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, Color B, Color C, etc.
[ ] = work directions in brackets the number of times specified
* = repeat whatever follows the * as indicated
measurements: Owl measures 6” (15 cm) tall
gauge: 19 sc = 4” (10cm); = 4” (10cm) in single crochet
instructions:
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in ring; do not join, work in continuous rounds (spiral)—6 sc.
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc] 6 times—18 sc.
Round 4: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 5: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc] 6 times—30 sc.
Round 6: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 4 sc] 6 times—36 sc.
Rounds 7–18: Sc in each sc around.
Round 19: [Sc2tog, sc in next 4 sc] 6 times—30 sc.
Round 20: [Sc2tog, sc in next 3 sc] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 21: [Sc2tog, sc in next 2 sc] 6 times—18 sc.
Rounds 22 and 23: Sc in each sc around.
Round 24: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 2 sc] 6 times—24 sc.
Round 25: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 3 sc] 6 times—30 sc.
Round 26: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next 4 sc] 6 times—36 sc.
Rounds 27–37: Sc in each sc around; join with slip st in first sc at end of Round 37. Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Using photograph as a guide for shaping, flatten top of owl’s head so ears appear, insert more stuffing as needed to form ears and a firm head, and sew head closed.

EYE PATCH (make 2)
With B, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in ring; do not join, work in continuous rounds (spiral)—6 sc. 
Round 2: Work 2 sc in each sc around—12 sc.
Round 3: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc] 6 times; join with slip st to first sc—18 sc. 
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Attach safety eyes off center in Round 2. Sew eye patches on head between Rounds 27–33.

BEAK
With C, ch 2.
Row 1: Work 3 sc in 2nd ch from hook, turn—3 sc.
Row 2: Ch 1, sc in first sc, sc in next 2 sc, slip st in last sc—3 sc. 

BELLY PATCH
Working from bottom up, with D, ch 7.
Row 1 (right side): Work 2 sc in 2nd ch from hook, sc in next 5 ch, turn—7 sc. 
Row 2: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in next 5 sc, slip st in last sc, turn.
Rows 3–5: Ch 1, 2 sc in first sc, sc in each remaining sc, turn—10 sc at end of Row 5.
Rows 6–11: Ch 1, sc in each sc, turn.
Row 12: Ch 1, sc in first sc, sc2tog 4 times, sc in last sc, turn—6 sc.
Row 13: Ch 1, sc in first sc, sc2tog 2 times, slip st in last sc—3 sc. 
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Sew belly patch to front of body.

WINGS (make 2)
With A, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1 (right side): Work 6 sc in ring; do not join, work in continuous rounds (spiral)—6 sc. 
Round 2: [2 sc in next sc, sc in next sc] 3 times—9 sc.
Rounds 3–5: Sc in each sc around.
Round 6: [Sc in next sc, sc2tog] 3 times—6 sc.
Rounds 7–9: Sc in each sc around; join with slip st to first sc at end of Round 9. 
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Position wings diagonally with ends down around body and sew to sides of body.

FEET (make 2)
With A, make an adjustable ring.
Round 1 (right side): Work 8 sc in ring; do not join, work in continuous rounds (spiral)—8 sc. 
Round 2: Sc in each sc around.
Round 3: [Sc in next 2 sc, sc2tog] twice—6 sc. 
Round 4: Sc in each sc around; join with slip st to first sc. 
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing. Weave tail through sts and pull tightly to flatten foot. Shape each foot into a triangle and sew under body.

SCARF
With E, ch 51.
Row 1: Hdc in 3rd ch from hook (beginning ch count as first hdc), hdc in each ch across—50 hdc. 
Fasten off. Cut 8 lengths of E, each 3” (7.5 cm) long. Hold 4 lengths together and fold them in half forming a loop at the fold. Insert crochet hook in end of scarf, place fold of strands on hook and draw loop through. Insert ends of folded strands into loop and pull to tighten; repeat from * to attach remaining 4 strands to other end. Trim fringe to even length. Wrap scarf around neck and, if desired, secure in place.

FINISHING
To make hanging loop, cut a length of A 15” (38 cm) long, thread through top of head, and tie ends in a knot. Weave in ends.

materials: faux mistletoe (use bunch of mistletoe and cut it into smaller sprigs)
RED HEART® Boutique Sassy Fabric™, E818 available in prints 30 yd (27 m) hanks
RED HEART® Super Saver®, Art. E300 available in solid color 7 oz (198 g), 364 yd (333 m); prints, multicolor and heather 5 oz (141 g), 236 yd (215 m), flecks 5 oz (141 g), 260 yds (238 m) skeins
gauge: Gauge is not important for this project.
instructions:
1. Make a ruffled scarf with one hank of the Sassy Fabric. See pattern LW4170 or video.
2. Pin scarf to ball going in vertical rows so that you only have one layer of ruffles covering the whole ball, see Photo A.
3. Pin sprigs of mistletoe around the ball, see Photo B.
Hanging Loop Using a yard or so of yarn, crochet a chain and then do a row of single crochets into chain. Pin to top of ball and secure with a dab of glue.

materials: RED HEART® “Super Saver®”: 1 skein each 334 Buff A
abbreviations: s-inc (sc increase) = 2 sc in next st.
dec (decrease) = [draw up a loop in next st] twice, yo and draw through all 3 loops on hook.
h-inc (hdc increase) = 2 hdc in next st.
measurements: Sock Monkey measures 7” high.
gauge: 16 sts = 4”; 16 rounds = 4” in sc rounds. CHECK YOUR GAUGE. Use any size hook to obtain the gauge.
instructions:
MONKEY
Legs (Make 2)
Round 1: With B, make a loop over your fingers, insert hook into the loop and draw up 1 ch; 4 sc into loop; draw up end to tighten loop – 4 sc. Do not join but work in continuous rounds. Mark last sc of round. Move marker up each round.
Round 2: [S-inc] 4 times – 8 sc.
Rounds 3 and 4: Sc in each sc around.
Rounds 5-10: With A, sc in each sc around. Cut yarn and set aside first leg.
Make 2nd leg, do not cut yarn.
Join Legs/Body
Round 1: Ch 1 for crotch, sc in the 8 sts of first leg, sc in ch between legs, sc in the 8 sc of 2nd leg, sc in remaining loop of ch – 18 sc.
Rounds 2-5: Sc in each sc around.
Round 6: [Dec, sc in next 4 sc] 3 times – 15 sc.
Round 7: [Dec, sc in next 3 sc] 3 times – 12 sc. Fasten off.
Head
Round 1: With A, make a loop over your fingers, insert hook into the loop and draw up 1 ch; 6 sc into loop; draw up end to tighten loop – 6 sc. Do not join but work in continuous rounds. Mark last sc of round. Move marker up each round.
Round 2: [S-inc] 6 times – 12 sc.
Round 3: [S-inc, sc in next sc] 6 times – 18 sc.
Rounds 4-7: Sc in each sc around.
Round 8: [Dec, sc in next 4 sc] 3 times – 15 sc.
Round 9: Sc in each sc around. Fasten off.
Muzzle
Rounds 1-2: With B, work as for Head through Round 2.
Round 3: [S-inc, sc in next 3 sc] 3 times – 15 sc. Fasten off.
Ears (Make 2)
Row 1: With A, ch 3; 8 hdc in 3rd ch from hook. Fasten off.
Arms (Make 2)
Work as for Legs.
Hat
Round 1: With B, make a loop over your fingers, insert hook into the loop and draw up 1 ch; 9 hdc into loop; join with a slip st in first hdc; draw up end to tighten loop – 9 hdc.
Round 2: Ch 2 (counts as hdc), hdc in same st as joining, [h-inc] 8 times; join with a slip st in top of ch-2 – 18 sts.
Round 3: Ch 2, hdc in same st as joining, hdc in next 5 hdc, [h-inc, hdc in next 5 hdc] twice – 21 sts.
Round 4: Ch 1, slip st in each st around. Fasten off.
FiNiSHiNG
Stuff Legs, Body, Head, Arms and Muzzle. Sew Head to Body. Sew Muzzle and Ears to Head. Flatten tops of Arms and sew to sides of Body. Embroider eyes with D French knots. Embroider mouth with C and make 6 satin sts across Muzzle. For topknot, cut six (6) 10” strands of C; thread strands through a st at top of hat. Knot strands together with an overhand knot at base. Trim to ½”. Sew Hat to Head.

materials: RED HEART® Anne Geddes™: 1 ball each 702 Rosie, 301 Teddy, 504 Robin, 203 Daffodil, or 591 Posy A and 100 Lily B
abbreviations: A, B, C = Color A, B, C, etc.
* or ** = repeat whatever follows the * or ** as indicated
measurements: Macarons approximately 5 cm [2”] diameter
gauge: Gauge is not critical for this project.
instructions:
Macarons are worked in continuous rounds unless otherwise indicated. Place marker for beginning of round. Each cookie is worked in two halves which are joined around the middle using simple seaming technique. For seaming purposes, the half macaron that has the final round worked with B will be considered the top portion of the cookie. Increases are off-set in order to maintain a circular shape and to prevent hexagon shaping. For best results, insert one 5 cm [2”] diameter cardboard circle in between two halves when seaming. This will provide a firm foundation for the stuffing in the upper and lower portion and will maintain better cookie shaping. Stuff cookies lightly.

SPECIAL ABBREVIATIONS
sc2tog (single crochet 2 stitches together) = [Insert hook in next stitch, yarn over and pull up a loop] twice, yarn over and draw through all 3 loops on hook.

Macaron Half (make 2 with same color for each Macaron)
